loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es: Flor D. María L. D. P. D. 34 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. La Libertad, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como vigilante y vive junto a sus dos hijos D. 11 y 8 años D. edad. Flor posee una venta D. tortillas, la cual se encuentra en su casa D. habitación, así mismo comercializa diferentes marcas D. cosméticos. Flor solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar maíz gas propano y más cosmésticos, con el deseo D. poder aumentar sus ventas, atendiendo a mayor cantidad D. personas. Su negocio es bastante estable, ya que ella incluso hace tortillas los días domingos, en los cuales son pocas las personas que las elaboran, lo cual hace su trabajo aún más eficiente y le permite ser preferida por las personas. Las ganancias generadas por este negocio son D. suma importancia para el sostenimiento D. su hogar, por lo que el mayor deseo D. ella es el D. poder mejorarlo significativamente.
texts.en: Flor D. María L. D. P. is 34 years old.  She lives in La Libertad department together with her husband, who works as a security guard, and their two children who are 11 and 8 years old.  Flor has a tortilla stand which she runs from her own home.  She also sells different brands of cosmetics.  Flor is requesting a loan which she can use to buy corn, propane gas and more cosmetics.  She hopes to be able to increase her sales and serve more people.  Her business is quite stable since she also makes tortillas on Sundays when not many other people do.  This makes her job even more efficient and means people prefer to buy from her.  The profits she makes in this business are very important for supporting her household.  For this reason her biggest wish is to be able to improve her business significantly.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Dionicio Eusebio

texts.es:
Dionicio Eusebio R. O. tiene 56 anos. Vive en Unión Libre  vive con la compañera y con el hijo, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo que se llama Julio de 35 años.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. Dole 2 se dedican a labores agrícolas en la hacienda bananera DOLE, ubicada en la cabecera cantonal, todos los miembros viven en el Cantón Ventanas, la mayoría de los socios trabajan mas de un año en la mencionada hacienda, y sus actividades son relacionadas a la bananera. Son aproximadamente 13 socios.

Dionicio trabaja en la bananera como Jefe de campo y encargado de labores Agricolas trabaja desde hace un año, las comprar las realiza en el comisariato  1 en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para ponerse un negocio en la casa y adecuar el local y comprar productos para su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es mejorar la vivienda y cumplir la meta del negocio.
Le gusta trabajar y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Dionicio Eusebio R. O. is 56 years old.  He lives with his common-law wife and his child in Ventanas district, Los Ríos province.  He has one child who is called Julio who is 35 years old.

The members of V. R. C. Dole 2 perform agricultural tasks on the DOLE banana plantation which is in the district capital.  All the members live in Ventanas district.  Most of the members have been working on the plantation for more than a year and work for the banana industry.  There are approximately 13 members.

Dionicio works as a field manager and is in charge of agricultural work.  He has been working there fore a year.  He makes his purchases in Comisariato 1 (a market) in Ventanas.

He is requesting this loan so that he can set up a business in his home, adapt the premises and buy products for his business.  This loan would help him financially to cover his needs.  His dream is to improve his home and achieve his business goal.

He likes to work and take part in sports

loans.use: To set up a business in his home

loans.name: Margaritas Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “Margaritas” inicia su onceavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch, es un grupo entusiasta, comenta que lleva el nombre de Margarita, en honor a la Jefe de Centro Focal, quién es una señora respetable a quién apreciaron mucho desde la formación del grupo. Tambien, ellas comentan que es un espacio en el que pueden compartir y aprovechar de la compañía de sus compañeras. Está compuesta por once integrantes.  Los negocios son diversos: servicio de limpieza en un baño público, macramé en mantas, artesanía en bolsitas, venta de biberones, venta de frazadas, venta de linaza, venta de comida y desayuno y refrescos, artesanía, venta de batidos.

La presidenta de la banca comunal, señora Claudia es madre de 2 niños,  ingresó a formar parte de la banca comunal porque necesitaba capitalizarse para llevar adelante su negocio de venta de desayuno – almuerzo – te, en la parada de los buses del parque Ecológico de la ciudad de La Paz.  El préstamo que ha solicitado es por Bs.2000.- y será invertido en la compra de azúcar, fideo, aceite, papa por mayor.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Margaritas" (Daisies)  is in its eleventh cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Germán Busch Community Center.  They are an enthusiastic group who chose the name Margarita in honor of the woman who is head of the Community Center, a respected woman whom they have appreciated a great deal since they formed their group.  They also say that the center is a place where they can share and enjoy the company of their companions. 

There are 11 members in the group.  Their businesses are diverse: a cleaning service in a public restroom, bed spread macramé, handicrafts on bags, baby bottle sales, costume sales, flaxseed sales, sale of food, breakfast, and refreshments, handicrafts sales, and shake sales.

The president of the communal bank, Claudia, is a mother of two children.  She joined the communal bank because she needed to raise money to advance her business selling breakfast, lunch, and tea at the bus stop in the Parque Ecológico (Ecological Park) in La Paz.  The loan that she has requested is for Bs. 2000, which will be used to purchase sugar, fideo noodles, cooking oil, and potatoes wholesale.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, fideo noodles, oil, and potatoes wholesale

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa K. sells 'Fante kenkey' at Abura. 'Fante kenkey' is a popular Ghanaian dish made from corn. It is very common in the Western and  Central Region of Ghana. She is married and takes care of six dependents. Her husband is into farming. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more maize for 'kenkey'. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

In this photo, Adjoa is taking out the cooked 'kenkey' (wrapped in banana leaves) from her cooking pot.

loans.use: buy more maize for 'kenkey'

loans.name: Wilmel

texts.en:
Wilmel D. J. is from the town of Banga. She is 23 years old. Wilmel is married and has 2 children, aged 4 and 1. To make a living, Wilmel owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Wilmel works hard to grow her business.

Wilmel joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilmel has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Wilmel is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Mery

texts.es: Mery, de 49 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su hijo; y juntos de esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante.Desde hace 6 años, esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta de mercería y ropa interior. Brinda su mercadería de manera ambulante durante todos los días incluidos los fines de semana, y como realiza sus ventas en el exterior, generalmente  usa  su sombrilla que la protege del sol y de las lluvias. Tiene regular cantidad de clientes pues sus productos los ofrece a precio bajos que son de la preferencia de sus compradores, además se abastece de mercadería en las tiendas distribuidoras de su ciudad y considera que su trabajo es una labor  rentable y ventajosa para su economía pues tiene considerables ganancias. Para el futuro desea seguir en el negocio de comercio de mercería y ropa interior, además espera aumentar la cantidad de mercadería.Es su segundo crédito con MFP, y promete ser  responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias; además agradece  a las  personas que serán gestoras del préstamo ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Mery tiene planeado invertir el  dinero solicitado en la compra de  más mercadería para su negocio, de esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
49-year old Mery lives in her own house with her son. Together they work hard on a daily basis to make progress in life. For the last six years this enterprising woman has sold notions and underwear in the local streets. She works every day including weekends. As she works outdoors, she generally sits under an umbrella to shelter her from the sun and rain.

Mery has regular customers who seek her out because she sells her products for low prices. She gets her stock from local distributors. Mery says her business is profitable and is doing well so she gets a good income from it.

In the future she wants to continue in the same business but expand her stock. This is her second loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she promises to make her repayments on time. She is grateful for the opportunity to be part of her community bank as all the members are responsible and committed. She wishes to thank the donors as this loan will help her with her business. She plans to use the money to buy more merchandise and continue making progress.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her business

loans.name: Lim

texts.en: Lim K., 52, is a widowed farmer who lives with her two children in Takeo province. She typically makes US$2 each day and would like to increase her profits. The weather conditions have been difficult in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Lim K. included. She is asking for a loan of US$1200 to purchase fertilizer for the farm, and raise pigs.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and raise pigs.

loans.name: Florah  Mumbi

texts.en:
Florah Mumbi M. is a single mother of two children.  They live in Lodwar town. Florah buys new clothes in bulk and sells at retail.  She has been in this business for three years and gets a monthly income of seventeen thousand shillings.

This will be Florah's second loan from KADET LTD.  She has repaid her previous loan successfully.   She will use the entire loan to buy more new clothes to sell. With the additional income she earns, she is going to expand her business by buying more stock of new clothes. 

In the future, Florah wants to be a successful business lady in Lodwar and able to support her family by providing them with basic needs.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Eal

texts.en:
Mrs. Eal T. was born in 1961.   She lives in Tonloab village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Ny Norn, are farmers who own 2.5-hectare plot of land where they grow rice to sell to support their family.  They own an agricultural machine. Mr. Ny Norn also works as a construction worker.

Mrs. Eal T. wants to buy two oxen to use in plowing, but her savings are not enough to buy them. To achieve her purpose, Mrs. Eal T. is requesting a loan to add to her savings to buy two oxen to do farming. 

Mrs. Eal T. is the mother of a child who is also a farmer. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy two oxen to do farming

loans.name: C4808 Ahazaza Group

texts.en:
Juvenal is the president of a group called “Ahazaza”, which has a total of six members, each with a different business. Juvenal is the second person on the left in the photo. Juvenal owns a small general store which sells different kinds of products.

Juvenal is 37 years old and is married, with two children. His business is open from 7am until 8pm every day, including weekends. This is his third successful year in his business.

Juvenal and his group will use this loan to purchase more products, such as salt, cassava flour, bread, and so on. Juvenal has many plans for any profits that he makes from this loan. He would like to provide food for his family, pay school fees for his children, renovate his house, save money for the future, as well as purchase more stock for his store. A long list!

loans.use: To purchase products such as salt, cassava flour, bread, and so on.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu T. is married with five children, all of whom attend school. They own a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. For the past six years, she has operated a business selling farm produce at the market to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she operates a food vending business which contributes to her income.

Saumu faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a cereals business in the future. With this 60,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase farm produce for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation in society.

loans.use: to purchase farm produce for resale.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard M. is 43, married and has five children aged between eighteen months and thirteen years. Four of the children are currently attending school. He is a farmer in Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya, where he has been farming for the last seven years. He sells milk, maize, vegetables and tea in the local market. He plans to improve his farming despite the challenges of poor weather conditions and a lack of a stable market for his products.

Richard has requested a loan of 35,000 KES through Kiva’s partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from this loan will help him provide for the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Zagdsuren

texts.en:
Mrs.Zagdsuren is 38 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family owns a small family house. Her husband Turtulga, 36, runs a transportation business carrying people between Ulaanbaatar and Zuunmod, the nearest city to the capital, 45 kilometers away from the capital. 

Zagdsuren has run a tailoring business for 11 years. She makes or fixes clothes and dresses according to her customers' orders. She is an experienced tailor who makes dresses starting from classic ones to traditional Mongolian national ones. She gets enough orders from customers, especially during national celebrations and weddings. She is asking for a loan to buy necessary spare parts and to do proper servicing of her husband's minivan.

loans.use: To buy necessary spare parts and to pay for servicing of her husband's minivan.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a modern camera for her photography.

loans.name: Yony

texts.es:
Yony nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba (Apuricma, Perú), ella tiene 45 años y tiene su pareja y fruto de esta unión tiene cuatro hijos.  

Yony es una madre de familia que vive con sus hijos en su casa propia que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos (agua, luz y desagüe) en la ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco. Esta zona se caracteriza por su actividad comercial y el turismo.

Yony es ama de casa y alterna sus actividades de su casa con su profesión y como profesora trabaja en el magisterio, ella también se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía de tipo manualidades como por ejemplo hace muñecas y es proveedora de diferentes centros comercial de venta de artesanía. 

Ha solicitado Yony a Asociación Arariwa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para adquirir materiales como por ejemplo telas y otras cosas más.  Con los ingresos de la venta de sus productos cubriría las cuotas del crédito brindado.

Yony es una persona muy conocida por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable y una buena madre al querer brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Yony was born in the city of Quillabamba (Apuricma, Peru).  She is 45 years old, has a partner, and has four children from her relationship.

Yony is a mother who lives with her children in her own home which has all basic services (water, electricity and sewerage), in the city of Cusco, in Cusco department.  This area is noted for its commercial activity and tourism.

Yony divides her time between her daily household activities and her job as a teacher.  She also makes handicrafts such as dolls.  She is a supplier for different shopping malls that sell handicrafts.

Yony has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Asociación Arariwa which she will use to acquire materials such as fabrics and other products.  She will make her loan repayments with the profits she makes from the sale of her products.

Yony is a person who is very well known for being a hard-working, responsible woman and a good mother who wants to provide her children with a better future and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to acquire materials such as fabric, etc.

loans.name: Tabudirira Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 48-year-old Alice (with the lovely white hat) from Mutare. She is married to a council policeman, and together they have five children. She also cares for three dependents.

Alice sells clothing and electrical goods. She has been in business for two years. The main challenge she faces is the lack of working capital.

Alice has requested a loan of $400 to buy more clothing and electrical goods. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her family to develop in a multitude of ways. In the future Alice plans to open a shop.

loans.use: to buy more clothing and electrical goods.

loans.name: Yusif

texts.en:
Yusif  is 51 years old. He is married with three children. Yusif is dedicated to his livestock breeding business. Having little knowledge in the beginning in 2005, he had to learn a lot about farming. As of now, he has acquired a fair experience in agriculture. 

Yusif is very happy with his three children who are the motivation for his desire to grow his business. His first two loans from AqroInvest allowed Yusif to develop his business and purchase more cattle. And now this is the third time he has applied to AqroInvest Credit Union to obtain a loan to buy three cattle and fodder. 

As summer is the high season for wedding parties and meat is a  main course, Yusif will do his best to increase his turnover and put aside some savings for the rest of the year. This will enable him to expand his herd and to take care of his children and his home.

loans.use: to purchase three cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Run

texts.en: Run, 56 years old, is a cake seller at a state school. Her husband is a farmer. They have 4 children, two are working in the factory and one is working as construction worker. Every month, she spends around $65 on family expenses. She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy car spare parts because she wants to start a career of car repair with her son. If her son can make a good income, she will extend her small shop at school by buy more cakes from market to sell in the school.

loans.use: to buy car spares equipment.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Kodjo est un homme âgé de45 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Il a 02 enfants.  
Kodjo travaille comme éleveur de poules depuis 2006. Il élève les poules et vend à toutes personnes. Il achète les produits à Lomé.
Kodjo a requis son 1er cycle de crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter 10 sachets d’ingrédients servant aux nourritures des poules, 23 boites de produits vétérinaires et 10 boites de vitamines.
texts.en: Kodjo is a 45-year-old man. He is married to a retailer and has two children. He has been working as a chicken farmer since 2006. He raises hens and sells them to anyone. He purchases his supplies in Lomé, the capital of Togo. Kodjo has requested his first loan cycle from WAGES in order to buy 10 packets of hen feed, 23 containers of veterinarian products, and 10 bottles of vitamins.

loans.use: to buy 10 packets of ingredients as food for hens and some vitamins

loans.name: Erick Antonio

texts.es: Erick Antonio se dedica a la confección de manteles, pantalones, camisas, faldas y trajes desde hace 8 años. Comenzó éste rubro cuando era joven pues le gustaba este tipo de actividad fue así que día a día proporciono empeño para empezar su negocio, El trabaja en el comedor de su casa y su horario es muy cansado pues depende de los pedidos que tenga para realizar. Su mercadería la compra en la misma ciudad, ya que los precios son igualmente convenientes. Con el crédito comprará telas, hilo, zipper, tijeras, alfileres entre otros. El se siente muy cómodo y agradecido de los servicios otorgados debido a la confianza y facilidad que brinda la institución.
texts.en:
Erick Antonio has been manufacturing tablecloths, pants, shirts, skirts and suits for the last 8 years.  He started in this line of work when he was young because he liked this type of activity and this was how he gradually acquired the determination to start a business of his own.  

He works in his dining room and his schedule is very demanding because it depends on the orders he has to complete.  He buys his merchandise in the city because prices are affordable.  He will use the loan to buy fabric, thread, zippers, scissors and pins, among others.  He feels very comfortable and grateful for the services rendered because of the trust and easy terms the institution confers.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, zippers, scissors and pins, among others.

loans.name: Bayandelger

texts.en:
Bayandelger is a 29-year-old man who operates a clothing-retail stall at a local market in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Aside from his business at the market, he works as an excavator specialist at Hera Investment Co., Ltd, a company that supplies heavy machinery and equipment.

As Bayandelger is often called out of town, his wife runs the business. They sell women’s clothing imported from Beijing, China. Bayandelger is requesting a loan of 1,300,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) to purchase more clothing for this fall.

Bayandelger has been saving earnings from the business with the intention of moving into an apartment in the future and improving his and his wife's standard of living. He repaid his previous loan from Transcapital Company Ltd. successfully and on time and hopes to use this opportunity to develop his business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for fall

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
This is Wilma, 53, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a single mother with two children. 

Wilma has managed to support her older child's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to send her other child to school. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Wilma operates a cell phone accessories business. She buys cell phone accessories and merchandise from wholesalers and sells them per item with a little profit. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options offered. Her regular customers are the local community.  She earns a minimum of 400 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Wilma dreams of being able to give both her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for cell phone accessory items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 37 years.  He is 71 years old and married to Hannah.  They have two children who attend school.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan.  He repaid all his previous loans well and on time.  He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, John hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has been practicing farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the past four years. He is 47 years old, married to Jane, and they have six school-going children. He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. Joseph plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Joseph hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 43 años, casada con Jose y madre de dos hijos: Carina de 21 años y Jhonny de 17 años. Viven al sur de la ciudad de Quito que es capital del Ecuador en un barrio urbano marginal llamado "Magdalena Alta". Su esposo se dedica a la construcción.

Su familia se dedicaba a la crianza de animales por lo que hace unos años ella empezó también con el negocio. Rosa compra animales pequeños y los cría hasta venderlos a mejor precio, de esta manera ella aporta con la economía familiar. Nos comenta que ha sido difícil encontrar financiamiento, las grandes instituciones financieras no dan facilidades a los microempresarios que como ella no cuentan con un negocio formal. 

Rosa sueña con construir su propia casa, y para ello debe aumentar su negocio haciendo una inversión y por ello Fundación Alternativa le ha dado su apoyo en otorgarle los recursos económicos que necesita y así su calidad de vida mejore y esté más cerca a cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 43 year-old woman who is married to Jose and is the mother of two children: Carina, 21, and Jhonny, 17.  They live south of the city of Quito, the capital of Ecuador, in a neighborhood on the outskirts of the city called "Magdalena Alta."  Her husband works in construction.

Her family used to raise animals, and so a few years ago she also started in this business.  Rosa buys young animals and raises them until she can sell them at a better price.  In this way she contributes to the household finances.  She tells us that it has been difficult to find financing through the big financial institutions, because they will not give loans to small businesspeople like her that have an informal business.

Rosa dreams of building her own house.  To do this, she must expand her business by investing in it.  To achieve this objective,  Fundación Alternativa has given her support by granting her access to the resources she needs.  This way, her quality of life will improve and she will get closer to fulfilling her dreams.

loans.use: to buy animals

loans.name: C5679 Intwarane Group

texts.en:
Esperance is 34 years old and she is married with two children who are 6 and 8 years old. She owns a business selling pineapples, passion fruit, apples and so on. Esperance is the leader of this group, which is called "Intwarane" in the local language. She is the first person on the right side. Esperance has been in this business for about one year and her business is open from 6 am until 6 pm every day. She employs one person to help her. 

Esperance and her team have requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to increase their quantities of pineapples, passion fruit, and green bananas to sell. Esperance and her team will reinvest their profits into their businesses and pay school fees for their children.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit like pineapples, passion fruit, green bananas, etc.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela wants a loan to renovate her rentals. She lives in Masindi, Uganda, and is a widow with three children. She started with a house and now has two. Her dream is to own an estate. Her major challenge is tenants who are negligent with the property.

loans.use: to renovate her rentals.

loans.name: Faizullo

texts.ru: Файзулло примерный семьянин отец пятерых детей Он вместе с женой занимается агробизнесом. У него большой опыт в этой сфере уже на протяжении 25 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур лука, зерна, моркови. Он от дохода старается содержать свою семью и создать все условия для них. Он хочет получить займ в размере 1000$ США для покупки минеральных удобрений и ядохимикатов. Он надеется получить займ и обработать землю для подготовки к новому посеву.
texts.en: Faizullo is an exemplary family man and a father of five children.  Together with his wife, he is involved in an agricultural business.  He has an extensive experience in this field since he has been growing agricultural crops, such as onions, cereals, carrots, for 25 years.  Faizullo tries to use the business income to support his family and provide all of the necessary conditions for them.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1000 for the purchase of mineral fertilizers and pesticides.  He hopes to get this loan and treat his land to prepare for the new sowing season.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Cyntia

texts.es:
Cyntia tiene 23 años de edad, convive hace 2 años con José de 30 años. Ambos fueron bendecidos con 1 hijo de 1 año. Esta joven familia vive en una casa propia en el distrito de La Unión. La agricultura ha sido su sustento desde pequeña, esta actividad fue heredada de sus padres y compartida por los comuneros de su distrito. Además la naturaleza les brindo suelos fértiles y un clima adecuados para la siembra de una variedad de productos. Cyntia aprovecha muy bien estos factores, por ello siembra arvejas, espinacas, zanahorias, habas, maíz y papas en terrenos de su propiedad y en otros que arrienda. Por su parte José aporta ingresos de su trabajo como operario de una fábrica de cemento hace 2 años. La familia de Cyntia aún es joven, por esa razón ven sus planes y sueños con esperanza y confianza.  Piensan arreglar su hogar, implementándolo con muebles y otras comodidades.  Solo tienen un hijo, razón por la cual planean brindarle educación de calidad en instituciones reconocidas de la ciudad. Con su ayuda, Cyntia accederá a su préstamo número 2 de MFP, es consciente de que la puntualidad es uno de los valores que la ayudarán a crecer, por eso no duda en mencionar que lo será en el pago de sus cuotas. Son 2 ciclos los que está asociada a “Los Ángeles de la Unión 2”, su grupo comunal del que se siente contenta. 
Con el dinero, Cyntia comprará un saco de abono de 118 soles y media bolsa de semillas de arvejas de 300 soles.
texts.en:
Cyntia is 23 years old and has been living with 30-year-old José for two years.  The couple have been blessed with a son who is 1 year old.  This young family live in their own home in La Unión district.  Farming has been Cyntia's means of support since she was a young girl.  This business was inherited from her parents and is shared with the people in her district.  Nature provides them with fertile soil and a suitable climate for growing a variety of crops.  Cyntia makes the very most of these factors.  She grows peas, spinach, carrots, beans, corn and potatoes on land that she owns and on other land that she rents.  For his part, José contributes income from his job as a laborer in a cement factory where he has worked for two years.

Cyntia's family is still young and so they view their plans and dreams with hope and confidence.  They plan to fix up their home, equipping it with furniture and other comforts.  They only have one child and so they plan to provide him with a good-quality education in well-known institutions in the city.  With your help, Cyntia will receive loan number 2 from MFP.  She is aware that punctuality is one of the values that will help her to grow.  For this reason, she doesn't hesitate to mention that she will observe this in making her repayments.  Cyntia has been a member of the 'Los Ángeles de la Unión 2' community bank for two loan cycles and feels very happy with her community bank.  Cyntia will use her money to buy a sack of fertilizer for 118 soles and half a bag of pea seeds for 300 soles.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer and pea seeds

loans.name: Rosadina

texts.es:
Rosadina tiene 46 años, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos.  Cuenta con casa propia, la cual queda ubicada en Oyotún, ubicada a 2 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.  Rosadina y su familia son muy estimados por sus vecinos, quienes han dado buenas referencias personales.

Rosadina se dedica a la venta de tamales (plato típico de algunas regiones de Sudamérica preparado en base a una pasta de maíz rellena de carne, verduras y otras especias) desde hace 3 años.  Este producto es bastante consumido por los pobladores de la zona.  Rosadina por su amabilidad y buena atención a sus clientes es muy estimada y siempre la buscan para comprar sus productos. Con los ingresos que percibe puede solventar sus gastos y los de su familia.

Rosadina desea adquirir algunos insumos y materiales como ollas hacer crecer a su negocio.  Por ello ha decidido solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer bastante tranquila y responsable. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien honrada y de confianza.
texts.en:
Rosadina is 46 years old and she has a partner and 3 children. She owns her own house which is located in Oyotún, 2 hours from the city of Chiclayo which is the capital of the department of Lambayeque. Rosadina and her family are well respected by their neighbors, who have given them good personal references.

Rosadina has sold tamales (a typical dish from some South American regions, which is made up of corn pasta stuffed with meat, vegetables and spices) for the past 3 years. This food is often eaten by the people in her area. Because of her kindness and good customer service, Rosadina is very respected and is always sought after by customers who want to buy her products. With the income that she earns, she can settle her bills and those of her family.

Rosadina wants to purchase some ingredients and equipment like pots to help her business to grow. Therefore, she has decided to request a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

She is a responsible and rather quiet woman. The people who know her consider her to be honest and trustworthy.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and materials, to increase her business of selling tamales.

loans.name: Huruma B Group

texts.en:
Alex is the facilitator of the Huruma B group. Alex and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Alex takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Alex had a very good maize yield harvesting 13 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alex was only able to harvest 2½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alex and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Alex will educate his children.

In 2012, the members of Huruma B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es:
La Sra. Daniela es de Ciudad del Este, está casada y tiene dos hijos, todos ya mayores de edad. Ella tiene una pequeña despensa en Hernandarias, cuya venta cada vez más está en ascenso, generándole un buen ingreso.
Nos cuenta que con la ayuda de su esposo y toda la familia están saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo, ya que tratan de ayudarse como familia, para que por medio del trabajo en conjunto puedan salir adelante y tener un mejor estilo de vida.
Hoy día ella es una microempresaria exitosa con una clientela fiel y numerosa, debido a su amabilidad.
Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta.
Acude una vez más a la fundación para la compra de lácteos, bebidas, comestibles, hortalizas y demás tipos de insumos con lo cual quiere abastecer su negocio, para ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Daniela is from Ciudad del Este.  She is married and has two grown children.  She has a small store in Hernandarias whose sales are ever on the rise that generates good income for her.

She tells us that, with the help of her husband and her whole family, they are getting ahead with a lot of sacrifice and hard work.  They try to help each other out like family so that through their work together they can get ahead and achieve a better lifestyle.

She is currently a successful small businesswoman with a large, loyal clientele, thanks to her kindness.

She has proven to be a responsible and honest person.

She is coming to the foundation once again to buy dairy products, drinks, foodstuffs, vegetables, and other kinds of products to stock her business and offer more variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, drinks, foodstuffs, vegetables, and more

loans.name: Kuña Mbarete Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Ita se ha conformado un grupo de mujeres denominado Kuña Mbarete, ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, que día a día se esfuerzan para poder darle lo mejor a sus familias. Actualmente está integrado por 16 mujeres, quienes están en el tercer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de las fundación paraguaya.
Mirian es una de las miembros, ella cuenta que el sustento de su familia es su peluquería, la cual está bien equipada con todo tipo de artículos. Comenta que gracias a la amabilidad con que atiende a los clientes y gracias a la buena calidad de sus trabajos es que ha podido mir creciendo de a poco. Su meta es seguir creciendo y ayudando a su familia.
Mirian solicita el crédito para abastecer su negocio con tintes, gel, spray para pelo, shampoo, enjuagues y demás insumos necesarios para su trabajo.
texts.en:
A group of women in the city of Ita has formed a group called Kuña Mbarete. They are very industrious and hard-working women, who day after day make the effort to be able to give a better life to their families. The group now consists of 16 women who are in their third loan cycle in Foundation Paraguay's program for entrepreneurial women.

Mirian is one of the members. She tells us that her beauty salon is the sustenance of her family. It is well equipped with every type of article. She comments that thanks to the friendliness with which she tends to her customers and thanks to the good quality of her work, she has been able to see her business growing little by little. Her goal is to continue growing and helping her family.

Mirian is applying for a loan to stock her business with dyes, gel, hair spray, shampoo, rinses, and other supplies necessary for her work.

loans.use: To buy dyes, hairspray, shampoo, rinses and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Hai

texts.en: Hai is 44 years old. She has two children whom are in secondary and high school. She transports construction materials and raise pigs for a living. She has done these job for 8 years and gained from them 4,700,000 VND. She has taken part in crediting program of SEDA from 2010. The last cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to build pigsty and buy food for pig. Then she hopes the benefit would be afforded enough for her children’s education fees.

loans.use: to build pigsty and buy food for pig. Then she hopes the benefit would be afforded enough for her children’s education fees.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is involved in selling soft drinks and also operates a provision shop in Ve-Wudome (near Hohoe).  Her earnings are generally used to help her husband, who is a driver, support their five children. She has been involved in selling provisions and other petty trading businesses for 20 years now. 

She plans on using her loan to purchase additional amounts of soft drinks, toilet roll, sachets of Milo (malted milk) and milk powder, biscuits, washing powder and soap, thus helping her sell more due to increased inventory capacity. 

She aspires to use her profits to both better market her soft drink and provision enterprise and to increase her existing working capital. She hopes that this strategy will allow her to expand her present customer base.

loans.use: to purchase additional amounts of soft drinks, toilet roll, sachets of Milo and milk powder, biscuits, washing powder and soap.

loans.name: Baltazar

texts.en:
N. is married with four children. He lives in Tandika area of Dar es Salaam. He owns a small shop in Tandika market where he sells new imported clothes.

He is planning to add a shoes line, along with selling clothes. His capital is not sufficient to cover this new business line. He is in need of USD 400 to facilitate his plan.

loans.use: Working Capita

loans.name: Namik

texts.en: Namik is inhabitant of Agsu district of Azerbaijan. He is 45, married,  and has 2 children. He started his business long ago, in 1997 with his own resources. In 2005-2006 he borrowed 2 loans amount $300-$600 from Normicro Agsu branch and used these loans for his business expansion purposes. Now he applies to borrow $1200 for further business development.

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.en:
Maria Dolores, 48, is married and has three daughters, ages 21, 22, and 24. Her husband Agustin has worked in basic chemical services for 25 years. Nevertheless, Maria saw the need to earn an extra income to cover the household expenses, and it was in this way that, seven years ago, she began selling cosmetics and nutrition products from her home. Her love for sales and entrepreneurial character have allowed her to carry out her project and keep it going for so long.

Maria's love for her family motivates her to work hard day after day. She currently needs a $275 loan to purchase merchandise so that she can offer her clients greater variey and better service. You can play an important role in the success of this business. Maria appreciates your support and generosity.

La señora Maria Dolores tiene 48 años de edad, es casada y madre de tres hijas, de 21, 22 y 24 años. Agustín, su esposo, es obrero en servicios químicos básicos desde hace 25 años. Sin embargo, Maria vio la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra para apoyar a los gastos del hogar, y fue así como desde hace siete años inició con las ventas de cosméticos y productos nutricionales, que realiza en su propio domicilio, el gusto por las ventas y su espíritu emprendedor le han permitido llevar a cabo su proyecto y permanecer por tanto tiempo en el negocio.

El amor hacia su familia han motivado a Maria a esforzarse día a día, ahora ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 275 dólares que utilizará para la compra de mercancía, para tener mayor variedad que ofrecerles a sus clientes y brindarles un mejor servicio. Tú puedes ser parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio, Maria agradece tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use:
Purchase of merchandise

compra de mercancía

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
N. Milly is a Muganda lady from Impala village, which is found in the Entebbe district. She is 34 years old and married with six children. Four of her children are going to school and the other two are still at home. Before Milly joined Life in Africa she used to be a full time house wife and didn't have much to do. Life was really not so easy, having many children to take care of and also having to sustain the family. At the time, her husband was also facing some problems with his work that was on a contract basis, where sometimes the payments would be delayed.

Milly is a creative wife and she was involved in making crafts on a small scale at her home, which she would sell in order to try to raise an income for the family. The income generated was not really enough to sustain the family bills and needs and as a result, Milly chose to search for work to sustain the family. After a little searching, Milly was able to find work with Life in Africa. She was one of the people on the Invisible Children bracelet project. This job was a great support in boosting the family's income, but life has to go on. Milly, as a member of Life in Africa, is very instrumental in the community; she is very good in making handcrafts and also at sharing her craft making knowledge with the other community members. She has good interpersonal skills and consistent conduct.

From the salary earned and her savings, Milly was able to make an investment in the form of building rental houses. She managed to build three single room tenant houses and currently two are occupied and the other one is still incomplete. The first two single room rental houses also still need plastering. Currently, Milly has been charging 50,000 Ugandan shillings per room for the two rooms and has been generating an income of 100,000 shillings. Milly is requesting a loan of 250,000 Ugandan shillings (about USD150) to enable her to finish her third house to acceptable housing standards and also to do the plastering on the other two rental houses.

Milly will employ one person for the work. After the completion of the third room and plastering, Milly plans to increase the rent for her houses from 50,000 shillings to 60,000 shillings and she is expecting a monthly income of 180,000 shillings. This will allow her to save enough money from the rentals to build two more rental houses. The two single rooms are going to be built over a long time. It's a long-term investment depending on the profits saved.

LOAN BUDGET

Buying cement (6 bags) for 120,000 shillings;

Buying sand with one trip for 70,000 shillings;

Buying water (50 jericans worth) for 5,000 shillings;

Labour costs 50,000 shillings;

Contingency costs 5,000 shillings;

This totals 250,000 shillings.

loans.use: Building

loans.name: Rashad

texts.en: 47-year-old Rashad lives in the Salyan region, Yenikand village. He is married and has two children. Rashad breeds calves. He supports his  family with this business. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy a cow and baling presses. He wants to breed cows in order to get more milk and to improve his  business and income. He has run this business for 10 years.

loans.use: To buy a cow and baling presses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a photocopier

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en: Mrs. Moeun R. is a housewife and her husband is a barber, earning $4 per day.  They have eight children, some of whom are married and live away from home, some who are hairdressers, and two who are students.  She would like to request a loan of $500 in order to purchase hairdressing tools for her children’s business and to buy a motorcycle for her family’s transportation.  Her husband is pictured in the photo as she was not available at the time.

loans.use: To purchase hairdressing tools and a motor-bike.

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en: My name is Sughran B. and I live in the large city of Lahore, Pakistan. I am married and have four childrenl. My daughter is married and my three sons operate a shoe store in a nearby market. My husband is a scrap dealer who buys and sells used items. We need a loan to expand our son's shoe store. There are three other members in my loan group, and their names are: Parveen J., whose husband is a painter and needs a loan to open a paint store; Noor B., who needs a loan for her husband’s scrap business; and Allah R., who needs a loan for her husband’s brother's grocery store. All of these people are my friends, and we work together to solve each other's problems.

loans.use: Expand a shoe store and several other businesses

loans.name: Araceli

texts.es:
Aracely, 31, is married; her husband, 43, is an auto mechanic and he and Aracely have 3 boys who are 7-, 13- and 16-years old. The youngest is in second grade and the older two are in high school. Aracely has had a shop in her house for some years. She sells cosmetics, food and other everyday products. She's an enterprising woman who supplies the things that her neighbors need and her business is highly regarded in the neighborhood.

Her husband doesn't always have work and they can't always count on his income so Aracely does everything she can to sell as much as she can. As the new school year approaches, her customers have asked her for school supplies like notebooks, backpacks, uniforms, etc., but Arcely doesn't have enough resources to meet the demand and, consequently, she's applying for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Aracely tiene 31 años, es casada, su esposo se desempeña como Mecánico Automotriz y tiene 43 años, ambos han procreado a 3 hijos varones de 7, 13 y 16 años, el pequeño se encuentra cursando 2 grado de primaria y los otros dos están estudiando en secundaria. Doña Aracely es una comerciante que tiene una tienda en su casa de habitación en la cual lleva ya algun tiempo de trabajo, en su negocio vende cosméticos, granos básicos, productos perecederos, y otros productos propios de un hogar. Aracely es una mujer emprendedora ya que ha ido surtiendo su negocio con diferentes productos necesaR. en los hogares de su vecino. actualmente su negocio goza de mucho prestigio entre sus vecinos.

El trabajo que desempeña su esposo es de manera esporádico y no cuenta con un ingreso fijo para su familia, es por eso que Aracely se esfuerza mucho para poder veder la mayor cantidad de productos posibles. Se esta aproximando la entrada a clases y sus clientas le están solicitando útiles escolares como son cuadernos, mochilas, uniformes, y en estos momentos la Sra. no cuenta con los suficientes recursos para poder satisfacer esa demanda, es por eso que solicita un préstamo.

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
I am Samina F. from the industrial city of Faisalabad, Pakistan. My husband is a farmer and I stitch clothes for my neighborhood clients. Now, I want a loan to buy a new sewing machine and invest in high quality notions. I am a mother of an only daughter and I want to give her a sound economic future. There are four other women in my loan group; all of them will invest their share of loans in their own or in their family’s businesses. I have known these women for a long time and completely trust them. They are: Uzma M., who runs a beauty salon and needs to buy cosmetics and small equipment; Razia B., who will use this loan to buy poultry feed and hens for her husband’s poultry farm; Zia I.,who requires this loan to buy a rickshaw for her husband; and Rukhsana N., who needs this loan to expand their furniture store.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Ngov

texts.en: Mrs. Ngov S., age 33, is a mother of three children and works selling fish, earning around $10 a day in revenue. Her husband works as a construction worker building houses. On average, he makes about $3 a day. This couple needs a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike to ship fish from the river to the market. This will reduce their expenses and allow the family saves forthe future.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to ship fish from the river to the market.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T., 46 years old, joined the Fund since 1998. Her 3 grown-up children are living separately. Currently, her family has 2 parents and her 2 youngest children. Before, Mrs. T. invested the money in selling general goods in the market and also selling unhusked rice. Her income was 6-7 USD/day. Her 2 children have been helping her a great deal. This year, since the price of everything goes up, Mrs. T. decides to invest money in breeding fish. Her suggested amount of money is 950 USD and it is used to buy fish and more general goods to sell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Thủy, 46 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 1998. 3 con lớn đã có gia đình riêng, trong nhà hiện nay chỉ còn 2 vợ chồng và 2 người con cuối. Các vòng vốn trước chị Thủy đầu tư vào buôn bán hàng tạp hoá ở chợ và đi thu mua thóc về bán cho các đại lý, thu nhập 6-7USD/ngày. Công việc nhiều, 2 con của chị cũng tích cực hỗ trợ mẹ bán hàng. Năm nay trước tình hình giá thực phẩm tăng cao chị Thủy quyết định đầu tư thêm vào nuôi cá. Mức vốn đề nghị của chị là 950USD để mua cá giống và mua hàng bán.

loans.use: Buy fishes and goods

loans.name: Ndiaya

texts.fr:
Mrs. S., born in 1961, married, and raising 4 children, has requested a loan to purchase cloth, shoes, etc. to expand her inventory. She is planning to sell her wares from door-to-door. This is her first loan which she will reimburse in one single payment in 6 months, when the loan term is up.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Mme S. née en 1961, mariée avec 04 enfants en charge souhaite acquérir un crédit pour acheter des tissus, des chaussures et divers pour augmenter son stock de marchandise. elle va faire un commerce ambulant pour écouler la marchandise. voici son premier prét qu'elle va rembourser en une seule échéance au bout de six mois.

loans.use:
Purchase and re-sale of clothes, shoes

Achat et revente de vétements, chaussures

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es:
Mirian K. P., belongs to “El Triunfo” (The Triumph) community bank, she lives in the San Martin region, province of Picota, district of San Hilarion. Her business is located in the Jr. Bolognesi market, she sells root vegetables and other vegetables.

Thanks to help from her aunt she started the business, with enthusiasm and effort it has slowly grown, she thanks the bank for helping her with the loan that allowed her to implement the business.

With the new loan of $700 USD (S/.2,000) which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase: sacks of potatoes, cucumbers by the hundreds, kilograms of cabbage, pumpkins by the hundreds, sacks of garlic, bananas and other vegetables that her clients need.

Miriam is very outgoing and joyful, she is 34 years old, lives with her husband, her two daughters who are the motor that make her keep going forward, she works with enthusiasm and care to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora, Mirian K. P., pertenece al banco comunal “El Triunfo”, vive en la región San Martín provincia de Picota, distrito de San Hilarión su negocio esta ubicado en el Jr. Bolognesi - Mercado de abastos, se dedica a la venta de tubérculos y verduras.

Gracias al apoyo de su tía se inicia en el negocio, con entusiasmo y esfuerzo fue aumentando poco a poco, ella le da gracias al banco por haberle brindado el apoyo con un préstamo, que le permitió implementarlo.

Con el reciente crédito de S/.2000.00 el cual será pagado en un plazo de 6 meses, comprará : papas en sacos, pepinillo en cientos, repollo por kilos, zapallo por cientos, ajos en sacos, cebolla en sacos, plátanos en racimos y otras verduras que el cliente lo requiera.

La señora Mirian es muy comunicativa y alegre, tiene 34 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijas, que son el motor para seguir adelante, ella trabaja con entusiasmo y esmero para crecer en su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase wholesale vegetables.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a single woman with 1 child, age 10. She owns a small grocery, which she started in 2007. Every day she works from 10:00 AM to 11:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Esther now hopes for a loan to buy more grocery items (beer) for her business.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to increase her stock

loans.name: Sandra Luz

texts.es:
Hello friends. My name is Sandra Luz G. V.. The loan I am requesting is for the purchase of tools and used clothing because I buy and sell clothing, footwear, and tools in order to earn money to pay for the family expenses and take care of my 5 children. My business is called “El Milagrito” (The Little Miracle) because it has been established after much effort. I like to work hard in order to move ahead and show my children how to be decent people.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

“Hola amigos, mi nombre es Sandra Luz G. V., el préstamo que requiero es para la compra de un lote de herramientas y ropa usada ya que yo me dedico a la compra-venta de ropa, calzado, herramientas y así es como me gano el dinero para los gastos de mi familia ya que tengo 5 hijos, mi negocio se llama ¨El Milagrito¨ porque a base de esfuerzos se ha logrado, a mi me gusta luchar para salir adelante y enseñarles a mis hijos a ser personas de bien.”

loans.use: Purchase used tools and clothing

loans.name: Mout

texts.en:
Mrs. Mout R., 54, is a widow and works as a rice farmer. A few months ago, her crops faced a problem of insects destroying almost sixty percent of her crop. As a result, what she could make was just barely enough to cover her entire family's living expenses.

Fortunately, one of her son can earns about US$ 4/day working in construction and another one makes around US$ 3 each day working as a laborer at a dock. Together they can help her handle her entire family's living expenses.

Hearing about CREDIT MFI from her neighbor, Mrs. Mout R. has recently applied for a loan in the amount of US$ 800 to purchase insecticide, fertilizer and seeds to expand her crops and make her crops safe from insects. She believes that this year she will gain much more rice output than before. ( Her son who works in construction is pictured because Mrs. Mout R. was not available.)

loans.use: To buy insecticide, fertilizer, and seeds to expand her crop yield

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 43-year-old Evelina K. from Mbeya. She is married with four children, between the ages of 12 and 23. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependants because they are orphans.

Evelina has been running a fish-selling business since 2003. She buys fish from fishermen, brings them to town, and sells them. Fish is plentiful in the waters around the city and is a staple of the local Tanzanian diet.She works at the business 12 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by her children.

Evelina currently earns about 60 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 250 USD in order to purchase fish. In the future, she plans to expand the business.

Evelina thanks you for your support!

• SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase fish for re-sale

loans.name: Délali

texts.fr: Née à Kpélé-Elé, Madame Y. Délali est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle vit actuellement avec son Mari à Afagnan. La préparation et la vente de produits alimentaires (bouillie et beignets) est son activité. Elle sollicite ce financement pour constituer un stock de mais afin d'augmenter sa capacité de vente. De l’exploitation, elle tirera  des revenus suffisants pour améliorer l’existence de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in Kpélé-Elé, Ms. Délali Y. is married and the mother of six. She currently lives with her husband in Afagnan. Her work involves making and selling food (porridge and doughnuts). The financing she is requesting would be used for building a stock of corn in order to increase her sales capacity. Through the use of the loan, she will derive an income large enough to improve her family's life.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock of corn mais for making and selling porridge

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is 26 years old, single and still lives with his parents.  He became a farmer when his parents became too old to cultivate their farm. They live in a peaceful community where there are lot of food sources available such as vegetables, root crops, and other exotic foods. 

He has been in this business since 2002.  He realized that this business requires a big capital for him to maintain good harvest.  Because of this Oliver requests at least PHP 8,000 loan to serve as his additional working capital in their farm.  He will use this in purchasing farm inputs. 

Oliver hopes that he can have a good harvest so that income will also be good and there will be enough resources for his parents and for his future family.  He is very patient in waiting for his dream to come true.  

His parents are still helping him in order to maximize their expenses in terms of labor works.  He is thankful for the support they are giving him and he also prays for their good health.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Ivapene

texts.en: Ivapene L., 44, is married with seven children.  She has many years of experience in the sewing business. She sells to the villagers, families, and public six days per week. She has two previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (about US$208).  SPBD loans are Ivapene’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used to purchase a new hand sewing machine, fabrics, needles, threads, and materials. Part of the loan will be used to buy timber, cement, bricks, nails, and iron roofs for improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: Purchase a new hand sewing machine, fabrics, needles, threads, and materials

loans.name: Kholmirzo

texts.en:
Since 2004 K. Kholmirzo has been a livestock farmer. He breeds calves, cows and sheep. He is married and has 2 children whom he needs to support and give a proper education to. Kholmirzo has improved his financial situation because he has been able to wisely use the loans he has received from IMON International to breed his animals. Nowadays, his biggest dream is to expand his business and to also offer animal derivates (as dairy products) in the surroundings of his community. Therefore, his biggest need is to get a loan in order to buy more cows. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the cattle

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris B. sells fish which she buys from the fishermen, bringing them home for processing and preservation, and then sending them to the market for sale at Mpoben near Elmina. Doris has received primary level education. She is married and has 2 children.

Doris has been selling fish since 1999. She is responsible for paying utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards acquiring a piece of land for the building of a family house so that they can stop paying rent and also get a comfortable shelter for the family.

loans.use: increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale

loans.name: Houv

texts.en:
H. is 50 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province. He is the father of three children: all of them are married and live separately. He is married to Rom, 51, who earns a living planting vegetables behind her house. H. owns an old small tri-wheel cart for his firewood service to the whole commune and he has been in this business for more than two years. He travels far for his sales and he gains a lot of customers.

H. also owns a plot of farmland which he inherited from his parents. Recently, H. is preparing for his paddy field; he is tired of having to hire his neighbor's oxen for his family since he doesn't have any ox. To help reduce the family's expenses, H. is taking a loan of US$ 300 to buy a pair of buffalo for plowing the farmland. He dreams of having a big house for his family.

loans.use: To buy a pair of buffalo for plowing the farmland

loans.name: Pauline

texts.fr:
D. Pauline est née le 28/12/1970 à Comè un village du département de MONO dont elle est originaire. Pauline est mère de cinq (5) enfants dont trois (3) garçons et deux (2) filles, tous scolarisés. Pauline est mariée à AGBOTON Paul, un photographe de profession. Pauline et sa famille vit en location à Kowegbo un quartier périphérique de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Pauline vendait des habits pour enfants de façon ambulante dans la journée et de la nourriture les soirs devant son domicile. Mais depuis quatre (4) ans, Pauline a laissé cette activité au profit de la vente des divers (pâtes alimentaires, boîtes de lait, savons, biscuits, de l'huile d'arachide et de palme, de maïs, etc.)qui est plus rentable que les activités qu'elle menait avant. Pauline a ouvert une boutique dans son quartier non loin de son domicile où elle expose tous ses produits qui lui marchent à merveille. La demande de la clientèle de Pauline se fait de plus en plus pressante et Pauline n'arrive plus à la satisfaire. C'est pourquoi Pauline  sollicite un prêt afin d'accroître son capital et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Pauline D. was born on December 28, 1970 in Comè, a village in the province of Mono, where her roots are. Pauline is the mother of 5 children, 3 boys and 2 girls, all in school. Pauline is married to Paul Agboton, a professional photographer. Pauline and her family rent a place in Kowegbo, an outlying neighborhood of Cotonou, economic capital of Benin.

Pauline used to sell children's clothing door-to-door in the daytime and cooked food evenings in front of her house. Four years ago, however, Pauline left off these businesses in favor of selling various items (pasta, tinned milk, soap, biscuits, peanut and palm oil, maize, etc.) which brings in more money than her former businesses.

Pauline opened a little shop in her neighborhood, not far from her home, where she displays her products and is having great success. Her customers' demand is becoming more insistant and Pauline is not able to satisfy it. This is why she is requesting a loan so as to increase her working capital and satisfy the demand of her clientele.

The significance of ALIDé in the local language of Benin, Fon, is "there is always a pathway for the poorest of the poor". Benin is a small country in West Africa next door to Nigeria, where the GNP is about $1,500 per year. ALIDé offers special loans at 0% interest to very vulnerable individuals and is part of a group which will soon begin a program of small scale health insurance for recipients of micro-credit.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various items (sugar, candy, sweet biscuits, detergent, etc.), peanut and palm oil and sacks of maize

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is forty-five years old. She is the mother of three children and still married. Her children are schooling in the primary and junior high schools. Mary lives with her family in a family apartment at a community called Oda which is in the Eastern Region of Ghana. A sizable number of the inhabitants are engaged in farming activities. However, quite an appreciable number are also involved in trading and other business activities.

Mary is a hairdresser by profession. She does both plaiting and perming. She says she started her salon six years ago and has since trained four young ladies in hairdressing who have since started their own businesses in other communities. She has a small store close to the local market where she works. Apart from hairdressing, she also trades in cosmetics. She operates her salon starting in the morning and switches over to the sale of cosmetics in the evening through hawking (selling door-to-door).

She believes the loan assistance will enable her to buy hairdressing equipment, fashion accessories, artificial hair and also pomades and other materials she will need to serve her clients satisfactorily. She hopes to increase her income to enable her to save more to support her children’s education.

Mary is a member of “Asempa Kanea” (translated: “Gospel Light”) Trust Bank group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and to support themselves in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy hairdressing materials and fashion accessories

loans.name: Resty's Group

texts.en:
Resty N. is 38 years old and the mother of four children, ages 18 years – 18 months. She is a friendly and hard working lady with a 10 year old restaurant business. She also sells raw bananas.

Most of the food Resty prepares is grown from her farm with only a few items bought from neighbors. She works hard to insure that she saves enough for her children’s education, since two are in candidate classes.

With her good customer care, Resty hopes to open up other outlets so she can maximize her profits, build a big family house and pay school fees for her children, with the balance injected in her restaurant to buy sauce. She is a member of Victoria lending group in Lugazi.

loans.use: Buy sauce and food stuffs for her restaurant.

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married with two grown children. She owns a small business selling groceries in one of the local markets in Stryi. She has one hired employee.

Galina has been in the market vending trade for 11 years. Initially, she launched a clothing sales business, and she has only recently switched to food sales as it seems to be a more sustainable venture in this time of economic recession in the Ukraine. Currently, she has about 8,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory in stock.

Galina is very enthusiastic about her new business. One of the biggest attractions of her business is the reasonable prices she offers. Galina would like to receive a loan for 8,000 Grivnyas to purchase diversified merchandise for further retail sale. These funds will allow her to maintain an adequate amount of inventory on hand and easily update her product selection.

We believe that this loan will continue to help her business be successful and provide much-needed income for Galina and her family. She is hoping to use some of her profits generated to take her family on a much-deserved vacation this summer.

loans.use: To maintain her inventory and diversify her grocery offerings

loans.name: Christian

texts.es:
El socio  CHRISTIAN, vive en la provincia D. Calca en el distrito D. huandor, ubicado a 1 hora 30 minutos desD. la ciudad del Cusco. 

Nuestro socio tiene 23 años y es soltero;  alterna sus diferentes actividades con el comercio minorista, el arregla todo tipo D. celulares, compra y venD. los mismos y con ellos los accesorios D. diferentes celulares. El socio desea el préstamo en razón a que el dinero adquirido le permitirá comprar un mayor número D. accesorios y repuestos para así tener más clientes.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total D. su deuda en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Associate Christian lives in the province of Calca in Huandor Disctrict, located 1 hour and 30 minutes from the city of Cusco. He is 23 years old and is single; he alternates his different activities in retail traD., repairing cell phones, buying and selling cell phones and accessories. Christian desires a loan and with the acquired money will buy a larger number of accessories and parts so he can have more clients. He thanks and values the loan granted by these means and promises to fulfil his payments to service his debt in the established time.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy accessories and parts for cell phones

loans.name: Mhammad

texts.en:
Mhammad is 27 years old and lives in Saida, southern Lebanon. He has owned a hairdressing salon for ten years. Mhammad requested a loan of $2400 USD from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to change his salon’s décor and purchase women's beauty products. This is his second loan cycle and he has always paid on time.

Mhammad is successful in his work because he is known for his good work and competitive prices. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Mhammad set up his salon because that’s what he always wanted to do. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To change his salon’s décor and purchase women's beauty products

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina E. is from the village of Alangilan, Sagay Camiguin. She is 45 years old. Marina is married and has 8 children. To make a living, Marina owns and operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling root crops including camote (sweet potatoes) and cassava and others in the local community. Marina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from HSPFI. Marina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Marina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en: Mahdi is a 46-year-old married man and father of three children.  Since 2000, He has been working in construction and architecture.  Today, Mahdi is applying for a loan of $1,200 to buy additional tools for his work so he can satisfy the heavy demands of the market and help increase his income.

loans.use: To buy additional tools

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
Gulnora is divorced and has two children. Gulnora has 15 years experience in her tailor shop. On her own initiative, she began to elaborate garments, which she then began to sell. This endeavor went very well, and little by little she has been purchasing different kinds of sewing machines for her store. She works every day of the week from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Gulnora is requesting this loan in order to purchase new fabrics for sewing national dresses. With this investment, she will be able to improve her earnings and to improve her store. She will also be able to offer better service to her customers. Gulnora would like to be able to improve her quality of life and to remodel her tailor shop so that it looks nicer.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi.
