The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics for sewing national dresses

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
53-years old Virginia C. is managing a small rice field. She started tilling her farm since 1980. Now, that more than 2 decades had passed, she wanted to buy more farms to be able to buy her whole family needs. She has three children. All of them are married. She said, what give meaning to her life now are her grandchildren, whom she also supports especially in giving allowance in going to school. 

She requested a loan of Php 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to pay the workers who shaped and prepare her farm ready for planting. The loan as well will help pay the rent for the equipment he used during land preparation. 

This loan will help her grow her farm immensely. She hopes that she will have an abundant harvest after the loan in CEVI.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Chork's Group

texts.en: This small loan is being requested by two borrowers. Mrs. Chork S., 47, has been selected to be the leader by the other group member. Chork currently sells little sweet cakes to her neighbors in the village. She is a widowed mother who has four children. She is looking for a loan to order rice in bulk from rice farmers which she will then sell to gain more income. The other member of the group, Mrs. T., will be using part of the loan to support her business of selling vegetables.

loans.use: To order rice in bulk

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en:
Bassam is a 46-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Bassam has been working as a hairdresser for the last 10 years. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase beauty products for his salon and pay the school tuition of his children. This is his fourth cycle and he has always paid on time. 
His previous loans helped him improve his salon by changing the décor and purchasing new seats. Bassam is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are mainly his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had to face the competition. Bassam decided on doing his business because he had to work in order to improve his family’s financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his work by opening another shop.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products for his salon and pay the school tuition of his children.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca M. is managing a rice farm in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur, Mindanao. Rice is a basic commodity in their location. People there are buying rice. That is why she decided to grow rice on her farm. She has six children. Her eldest child is 22 years old. She dreams that someday she will be able to save money to support their college education.

She says she was about to give up planting rice. But, because it is helping her family a lot, she continues to grow rice for a living. She would like to request a loan of 12,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. The loan will be put into buying all the farming necessities for an abundant harvest.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Mrs. Roath Sao Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank, which consists of thirteen members, is located in DaeU. Kray village in Takeo province, and they plan to use the loan they obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Roath S. is the village bank president who was selected by the members. She is farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Nheom Houn, is a recycling collector who collects empty bottles, cans and so on. Although they try to work hard, they still earn less income than they need to support their family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Roath S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Mrs. Roath S. is the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Leap Children Group

texts.en:
Vivian S. is a leader of a group of 5 borrowers called 'LEAP children'.She is a high school graduate who’s fending for herself and her family through business. Vivian doesn’t have a child herself but she cares for a little sister. She lives in the V.I community, Gbarnga city, Bong county, Liberia.

Her business is the sale of slippers. She buys slippers wholesale and sells retail to residents of her community. Vivian has been running this business for 3 years, and she is hoping to improve to have a real shop in the future. She gives customers low prices in order to encourage them to continue buying from her.

She sometimes faces difficulties in purchasing her goods in US dollars because she sells in Liberian dollars. Vivian needs this loan to purchase new goods to grow her business. She dreams of buying land and building a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase new  goods to improve business

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: Ngozi sells groceries and food to make a living. She hopes to own a super market in the future.  She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries and food to sell. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to make more profits during this season.  Ngozi is 31 years-old and married with five children. Her eldest child is 16 years-old and her children are excelling in school. She is a hard working woman and she sells for long hours to support her home. She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Africa, particularly Nigeria. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and food.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim is a 24-year-old farmer. He got married a year ago and now has a 1-year-old baby. Now that he has his own family, he doubles his efforts in farming. He also raises chickens and pigs to add income for his family. He has dreams for his family, especially his child.

Kim used to borrow money from individuals who charged high interest. It was hard for him, because he ended up with nearly nothing. Now that he is a member of the Kiva field partner, CEVI, he is grateful for the financial service he gained access to, especially its low interest rate. He requested a loan of 10,000 PHP. He will use this loan to purchase farm supplies, like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Musutu Ene

texts.en:
Musutu is widowed and has four children. She provides for her children by herself.

Musutu was introduced to KADET through existing clients.  Musutu has been in the business of selling livestock for thirty years. Musutu sells sheep and sells ornaments she makes.

Musutu's area of business is located within the town in which she resides. She sells her ornaments to curio shop traders. With the extra profits, Musutu will further the education of her children and improve the family's living standards.

Musutu hopes to have a farm and plant and produce plants of high yields as she believes she is very hardworking.

loans.use: The loan will be used to increase stock of livestock and craft materials

loans.name: Sumacc Ayllu Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Sumacc Ayllu palabra en quechua que significa “Bonita Familia”, está ubicado en el distrito D. Yauli, que pertenece al departamento D. Huancavelica, tiene 8 socias y se encuentra en el ciclo 8.
 
Elisa, es casada, tiene 5 hijos, el mayor D. 16 años y L. menor D. 2 años, Elisa inicio su negocio D. venta D. artesanía haciendo tejidos para sus hijos, con sus vecinas aprendió a tejer pequeños llaveros, gorras, guantes D. colores que ahora teje en cantidad y manda para que se vendan en L. ciudad D. Huancavelica y en Lima. En esta época D. lluvias tiene dificultades con las ventas por las constantes lluvias y deslizamientos se ha interrumpido L. carretera y no hay pase a Huancavelica ni a Lima, Elisa aprovecha L. venta en las ferias D. su comunidad.

Eustaquia es casada, tiene 8 hijos, el mayor D. 18 años y el menor D. 2 años, Eustaquia se dedica a L. venta D. abarrotes, inició su negocio por necesidad, su esposo le ayuda llevándole mercadería en su carro desD. Huancavelica hasta L. comunidad, en L. cual solo hay 3 tiendas. DesD. que está en FINCA Perú es más responsable, sus hijos L. ayudan a sacar sus cuentas. El préstamo que solicita le ayudará en L. compra D. mas mercadería para su negocio, así tendrá más clienteL..
El sueño D. Eustaquia es que sus hijos estudien fuera D. L. comunidad, ellos quieren estudiar en Huancavelica y para eso tiene que hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Communal Bank Sumacc Ayllu's name is a quechua word that means "Beautiful Family." It is in the Yauli district, which is part of Huancavelica department. It is maD. up of 8 members and they are in their 8th loan cycle. Elisa is married and has 5 children, whose ages range from 16 to 2 years. Elisa began her crafts business knitting items for her children. Together with her neighbors, she learned how to knit small keyrings, caps, and gloves of many colors. She now knits large quantities of them and sends them to Huancavelica and Lima to be sold. During the rainy season sales are difficult due to the constant rains and landslides have washed away parts of the highway so the road between Huancavelica and Lima is interrupted. Elisa, then, must take advantage of the local markets to sell her wares. Eustaquia is married and has 8 children, whose ages range from 18 to 2 years. She sells groceries. She began this business based on need, there are only three stores in her community. Her husband brings her merchandise in his car from Huancavelica. Since she has been in FINCA Perú she is more responsible; her children help her with her accounts. The loan she is asking for will help her buy more stock items for her store so that she will have more customers.. Eustaquia's dream is that her children go to school outsiD. their community; they want to study in Huancavelic and to do so, the business has to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Elisa will buy supplies at wholesale.

loans.name: Han

texts.en:
Mr. Han N. is 36 years old and a villager in Preak Reussei village in Kandal province. He is a father of five children who are all enrolled in a local public school. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Yoeun Pen (pictured right), is a string seller.
In his rice field, Mr. Han N. has some problems because his field is far from the irrigation system, and he does not have money to support it. Therefore, in order to improve his rice production, Mr. Han N. decided to ask for a loan to dig a well. With the rest of the loan, he would like to hire someone to even out the land.

loans.use: To dig a well

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia es socia del Banco Comunal Rubi.
Virginia es casada, tiene 46 años y 3 hijos, Virginia tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende verduras, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Virginia necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de verduras.
Los sueños de Virginia son mejorar su casa y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Virginia is a member of the Ruby Community Bank. Virginia is 46 years old and is married with 3 children. Virginia has a stall at the April 12th Market where she sells vegetables daily. Virginia needs a loan of 1050 soles with which she will buy vegetables. Virginia's dreams are to improve their home and educate their children.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Rumaldo

texts.es: El Sr. Rumaldo L. García se dedica a la comercialización de refrescos y golosinas, esto por encontrarse cercano a un centro de estudio, recibe otros ingresos del seguro por ser una persona jubilada, es padre de dos hijos en edad escolar, sus ventas son mayores en el periodo escolar, este crédito lo solicito para la compra de productos tales como bolis, chocolates, leche, fresquito en bolsa, chocolitas y otros productos que encantan a los niños.
texts.en:
Mr. Rumaldo L. G. is the father of two school-age children and makes a living selling soft drinks and candy at a nearby school. Also, he receives social security income, since he is retired. His sales are greatest during the school year. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of products suchs as ballpoint pens, chocolate, milk, fresquito, chocolitas, and other products that children love.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics, imitation jewelry, candy, and soft drinks

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad S. is a 29-year-old married man from Gaza. He lives with his wife and four children. In 2008, Ahmad opened a woman’s clothing store. He now is hoping that throughout this loan, he will be able to buy new summer clothes for women. By doing so, he will be able to bring in more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy new summer clothes for women

loans.name: Luisa Concepcion

texts.es:
Luisa es socia del Banco Comunal Ollantay II.
Luisa es conviviente, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos, Luisa vende artículos plásticos como bolsas, productos que reparte a diferentes tiendas y puestos del mercado, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Luisa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de bolsas.
Luisa sueña con tener una tienda estable para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the Communal Bank “Ollantay II”. She is 36 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Luisa sells items made of plastic, such as bags. Her products are distributed to different shops and market stalls. She engages in this activity every day.

Luisa needs a loan of 1000 PEN to invest in the purchase of plastic bags. She dreams of having a stable store where she can sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plastic bags

loans.name: Sok Nea's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok Nea H. is the group leader of a group loan which consists of six people. They will use the loan for different purposes so that it can improve their businesses in the future. 

All the members are villagers in Ampil Lech village in Takeo province. Mrs. Sok Nea H. is a weaver at her home. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. So to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Sok Nea H. is requesting a loan to bU. silk. Her husband, Mr. Pou Song, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice on to support his family. Through these activities, they support five children, two of whom are helping their mother to weave, while the others are enrolled in local public school.

loans.use: To buy silk

loans.name: Françoise

texts.fr: Née en 1977 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, F. Françoise vit depuis une vingtaine d'année à Gankpodo, un quartier de Cotonou. Françoise est mariée à HOUETO Adrien et est mère de trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Françoise vit à Gankpodo avec ses enfants et son mari. Françoise vient en aide à son mari en ce qui concerne les différentes charges de la famille. Pour y arriver, Françoise vend des sous-vêtements et aussi des habits pour enfants à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est aussi à Dantokpa, mais également à Lomé au Togo, que Françoise achète ses produits. Françoise mène cette activité depuis une dizaine d'année, et a déjà obtenu cinq crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a tous bien remboursés. Afin d'élever le niveau de son activité et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Françoise sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un sixième prêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1977 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Françoise F. has lived in the Gankpodo quarter for around 20 years. She is married to Adrien Houete and is a mother of three school-aged children; she lives in Gankpodo with her children and husband, whom she helps with the family duties. To do this, she sells underwear and children's clothes at Dantokpa, Benin's international market. She buys her products from Dantokpa and Lomé in the Togo. She has been involved in this trade for around ten years and has already received five loans from ALIDé, which have all been repaid. She is seeking a sixth in order to boost her business and meet her customers' demands.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of children's clothes and underwear

loans.name: Toch's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has five people located in Boeng Kandal village in Kandal province. All the members will use a small piece of the loan for different purposes to improve their businesses in the future. They have selected Mrs. Toch P. as their group leader. 

Mrs. Toch P. was born in 1957. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is a dessert seller, while the other is a government worker. She and her husband, Mr. Pou Heng, are farmers who own a .09 hectare plot of land to grow crops to sell to support their family. 

Now they have a problem because their field is far from an irrigation system. So to improve production, Mrs. Toch P. is asking for a loan to buy a water machine.

loans.use: To buy a water machine.

loans.name: Huk's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Huk C. is 42 years old. He is a farmer who owns a 1.6 hectare plot of land to grow crops to sell to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Samoeu Gnoem, is an incense seller at the local market. He is the father of four children who are all attending the local public school. Now he has a problem because his field has infertile soil. So, to improve production, Mr. Huk C. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer. 

Four people make up this group. They live in Boeng Kraom village in Kandal province. Mr. Huk C. is the group leader selected by the other members. They will use their loan for different purposes.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Yuryi

texts.en:
Yuryi is married and has a child. He is a businessman from Beregovo, Western Ukraine. Yuryi is in a construction business offering construction services in his region and beyond. He has been working in this sphere for 5 years. Presently, his gross income amounts to 40,000 Grivnyas. Net profit is about 6,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Yuryi is seeking an 8,000 Grivnya loan to purchase construction equipment and supplies. Previous loans have benefited his business, promoting its growth and expansion. Yuryi is hoping to further develop his venture in gaining more experience and clientele along with providing for his family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase construction equipment.

loans.name: Mirella Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mirella de 43 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales), ella tiene una papelería en su casa vende bebidas, papelería, cuadernos .(en Ecuador se los llama “bazar”).   

Desde hace años ella comenzó a trabajar en su propia papelería no solo para ser independiente y por la separación de su esposo sino para solventar los gastos de sus hijos, con esfuerzo y dedicación ella ha surtido su papelería, trabaja desde las 08h00am.

Quiere comprar con el préstamo cuadernos, hojas y laminas para surtir mas su negocio, en el futuro quiere tener un almacén en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Mirella is 43 years old and lives in Guasmo de Guayaquil (an urban zone whose inhabitants mainly work in sales on the informal economy). She has a store in her home, called a "bazar" in Ecuador, in which she sells items such as school supplies, paper goods, and soft drinks. She started her own school supply store years ago, not only for the sake of independence and because of her separation from her husband, but also to cover her children's expenses. With effort and dedication, she has been able to expand her store's inventory. She works starting at 8:00 in the morning. With the loan, she would like to buy notebooks, paper sheets and laminated educational materials to further expand her store's inventory. In the future, she would like to have a store in downtown Guayaquil. .

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Notebooks, paper, learning materials

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.en: Baktygul M. is a resident of Tup, a nice town in the Isykul region. She is a 55-year-old widow. She has raised two daughters and a son. The first daughter and the son work in Bishkek in a sewing workshop and the second daughter helps her mom with the business. In 1998, because of the high unemployment rate, Baktygul started her own business. She began to sell convenience goods. In 2002, she opened her own store and now she sells convenience goods, clothes, soaps, etc. In this way, she makes 8000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Baktygul wants to increase the turnover of her business and purchase a variety of drinks, foodstuffs and clothes. In the future, she plans to expand her business, open a big store and build a house in Bishkek. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of drinks, foodstuffs and clothes

loans.name: Mayra Sonia

texts.es:
Mayra es una mujer de 54 años de edad,  se dedica al comercio de venta de ropa, costurera, en su casa vende helados y hielo logrando a si obtener mejores ingresos para ayudar a sus tres hijos. Su esposo trabaja como vigilante siendo un sueldo bajo, es por eso tiene que trabajar para poder mejorar las condiciones.
A mucho esfuerzo y trabajo han logrado hacer su casa. Hoy en día necesita cambiar el techo de su vivienda ya que por ser muy viejo esta en malas condiciones ya que se le esta pasando el agua en este invierno. Y no cuenta con el dinero en total para poder hacer las mejoras.

A través de Afodenic, logro aumentar el inventario de ropa pues es su segundo ciclo, en donde, ahora hará la mejora del cambio de techo. Comprando: laminas de zinc, golosos, madera y poder hacer el cambio.
texts.en:
Mayra is a 54 year old woman who has a business selling clothing, working as a seamstress, and selling ice cream and ice in her home, striving to earn more income to help her three children. Her husband works as a guard earning a low wage, so Mayra has to work in order to improve their living conditions. After much effort and hard work, they have succeeded in building their home. Today the roof of the house needs to be changed because it is very old and in bad condition for the rain that will come this winter. Mayra does not have the money needed to make these improvements. Through Afodenic, she was able to increase her clothing inventory, since it is her second loan cycle, from which she will now be able to make the improvements to the roof. She is buying sheets of zinc, screws, and wood to be able to make the change.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Fischetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheets of zinc to fix the roof of her house, which is old and leaky, and needs to be improved

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa A. is married to a carpenter and they live with their two children. Adjoa has been through junior high school.

Adjoa sells gari (a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava), charcoal, cassava and plantain at Elmina and uses her income to help her husband in promoting the general wellbeing of her family. She will use the loan to purchase more cassava and plantain to sell.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava and plantain to sell

loans.name: Toribia

texts.es:
Toribia tiene 42 años de edad, es separada y tiene un hijo a su cargo, reside junto a su hermana en el distrito de Monsefú, un distrito conocido por sus festividades turísticas y religiosas, se encuentra ubicado a veinticinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a la confección, bordado y venta de todo tipo de tejidos para ferias y fiestas sociales, ella elabora estos productos en su vivienda y los ofrece en venta por pedidos a sus clientes, que en su mayoría son pobladores de la zona. Debido al tiempo que tiene trabajando en esta actividad ella es conocida en el rubro y sis productos son bastante apreciados.

Actualmente Toribia cuenta con varios pedidos pendientes, como manteles y trajes para bailar marinera (danza típica del norte peruano), ella necesita adquirir material para poder cumplir con su trabajo de mejor manera, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de telas e hilos con los cuales pueda realizar sus labores.

Toribia es una mujer creativa y con mucha destreza para su oficio, su sueño es ver a su trabajo reconocido en diversos festivales y ferias de la zona. Las personas que le conoce le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Toribia is 42 years old, separated and has one child. She lives with her sister in the Monsefú district, which is known for its tourist and religious festivals and is located 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past three years she has been sewing, embroidering and selling all kinds of fabric for fairs and social events. She makes the products at home and sells by request to her customers, most of whom are residents of the area. Because of the time she has working in this activity, she is known in the business and her products are very popular.

Currently Toribia has a number of orders outstanding for tablecloths and outfits for the marinera dance (a typical dance from northern Peru). She needs to buy material so she can fulfill the work. For this reason she has decided to ask for a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternative. The loan is for 800 new soles and she plans to buy fabric and thread with which to do her work.

Toribia is a creative woman who has a lot of skill for this type of work. Her dream is to see her work recognized at various festivals and fairs in the area. The people who know her have great respect and affection for her.

loans.use: Buy fabric and thread for her dressmaking and fabric business.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
la señora Maria del Carmen R. tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella, Maria vive en Jicaro Galan Nacaome y se dedica desde hace 3 años a la comercializacion de ropa nueva, vende  ropa interior, faldas, pantalones, blusas y mas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de jeans, camisas, camisetas y blusas.
Sus puntos de venta son las colonias aledañas a su domicilio, 
su mayor deseo es tener su casa propia.
texts.en: Maria del Carmen R. is 43 years old, she is a single mother and she has 2 children who still depend on her. Maria lives in the community of Jicaro Galan Nacaome and for the past 3 years she has been selling new clothing, undergarments, skirts, slacks, blouses and more. She will use her loan to purchase jeans, shirts, t-shirts and blouses. She makes her sales in the neighboring regions. Her greatest dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: To purchase jeans, t-shirts, and blouses.

loans.name: José Miguel

texts.es:
José Miguel A. C. tiene 25 años. Es soltero vive con los padres, vive  en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hijos.

José Miguel  pertenece a la Ventanilla La Florida ubicada a media hora del Cantón  San Miguel, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura como fuente para los ingresos de las familias, esta ventanilla tiene 14 miembros.

José Miguel se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz, trigo, fréjol y papa,  las comprar las realiza en San Miguel y vende en el mercado de San Miguel y en la misma localidad.

Solicita  el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, trigo, fréjol y papa. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Su sueño es hacer una casa.

Le gusta hacer deporte y paseo con la familia.
texts.en:
José Miguel A. C. is 25 years old.  He is single and lives with his parents in the San Miguel neighborhood in Bolívar province.  He has one child.

José Miguel belongs to La Florida solidarity group which is located half an hour away from San Miguel.  The members of the group work in farming as a source of income for their families.  This solidarity group has 14 members.

José Miguel is a farmer.  He sows corn, wheat, beans and potatoes.  The support of this loan will help him financially and he will be able to provide for his family.  His dream is to build a house.

He likes to participate in sports and go for walks with his family.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for sowing corn, wheat, beans and potatoes

loans.name: Celia Isabel

texts.es:
Celia es socia del Banco Comunal “Azangarinas Valientes” ubicado en el distrito Azángaro, provincia de Azángaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 48 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene 02 hijos (01 dependientes), estudió hasta 5to de educación primaria.

Celia viene  trabajando con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 04 años, su    préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para incrementar el capital de su negocio de venta de artículos artesanales.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de lanas para tejer sus chompas, pantalones y chalinas, para luego venderlas.

Su sueño para el futuro es terminar de construir su casa y mejorar su negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Celia is a member of the Azangarinas Valientes communal bank, located in the Azángaro district and province within the department of Puno. She is 48 years old and has a live-in partner and two children, one of which is dependent. She completed up to the fifth year of elementary school.

Celia has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four years. Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN), which she used to increase the capital for her handicrafts sales business.

She is requesting a new loan of 1,500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN), which she will invest in the purchase of wool to knit her sweaters, pants and scarves and later sell.

Her future dream is to finish building her house and to improve her business.

What she likes most about her communal bank is the punctuality and the responsibility.

loans.use: To purchase wool for making sweaters, scarves and other items

loans.name: 20 De Noviembre Group

texts.es: Este grupo  se llama 20 de Noviembre, en alusión al día de la Revolución Mexicana, que se llevó a cabo hace 100 años, por hombres y mujeres que buscaban justicia y equidad social, por eso las integrantes se sienten identíficadas al ser mujeres emprendedoras y valientes. Está ubicado en el Estado de Hidalgo en México. El grupo está conformando por 11 integrantes.Rodríguez Díaz Guadalupe es una integrante del grupo. Tiene cincuenta y cinco años  estudio hasta sexto año de primaria. Es viuda  y tienen en total  seis hijas mujeres ya ninguna depende  de ella económicamente. Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas de comal. Que inicio desde hace dos años. La Sra. Guadalupe solicito su préstamo para la compra  de maíz, una  máquina de tortillas manual. Sus clientes  se sienten satisfechos por su trato amable y la calidad de sus  tortillas frescas. Espera que con sus ganancias pueda adquirir material de construcción para la remodelación  de su local  y vivienda. Para tener un mejor nivel  de vida.
texts.en: This group is named November 20th, a reference to the day of the Mexican Revolution, which was begun 100 years ago by men and women seeking justice and social equity.  The group's members therefore identify with hard-working and valiant women.  They are located in the state of Hidalgo in Mexico.  The group is made up of 11 members, R. D. Guadalupe among them.  She is fifty-five years old, and has a sixth-grade education.  She is a widow and has 6 grown daughters, none of whom are dependent on her economically.  She works making tortillas on a griddle, which she began doing two years ago.  Mrs. Guadalupe is asking for this loan to buy corn and a manual tortilla maker.  Her customers enjoy her pleasant treatment of them and the quality of her fresh tortillas.  She hopes that with her earnings she can acquire construction materials to remodel her shop and her home, in order to have a higher quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase corn and a manual tortilla maker.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase construction supplies and build a house

loans.name: Maxima's Group

texts.en:
Maxima M., from the village of Union Kalingan Luna, Isabela, is the 54-year-old group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Maxima, who is married and has six grown children, owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling vegetables and snacks in the local community. Engaged in her business for over 15 years, she earns approximately 3500 PHP a month.

In 2007, Maxima joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital, she is requesting her third loan for 7000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. Maxima plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Carmen Paola

texts.en:
38 year old Carmen Paola is separated and has one child. She lives in a brick house with all the basic services in an area called Paraiso, located on the outskirts of the city of Guayaquil.  

She used to live in Puyo in the province of Pastaza, located in the Ecuadorian Amazone. Later she moved to Guayaquil. She has a business providing phone services: national and international calls; and she also sells prepaid cards for cell phones. She works from Monday through Sunday. The main difficulty Carmen Paola deals with in her business is delinquency. 

This is Carmen Paola's first loan through D-MIRO and she plans to use the $1,000 to buy another phone booth and a computer.

loans.use: To buy a new phone booth and a computer for her call center service.

loans.name: Bakytbek's Group

texts.en:
Sculptures from times of Soviet period and of Kyrgyz Independence period made by famous Kyrgyz sculptors and architects can be seen in most of the city parks of Kyrgyzstan. Our following creditor is very unique, because he creates pieces of art.

Bakytbek K., 42, is a member of this group. Being inspired by successful people and historical events, Bakytbek always felt comfortable expressing his emotions in clay. Sculptures have been his passion since early childhood, when he used to make figures from sand on the beach at Lake Issyk Kul. He tried working on monuments and plates with inscriptions, and realized he could turn his hobby into a business.

To Bakytbek’s surprise, this business started developing at a high pace. Now he has orders almost every day and is quite busy. Seven years have brought good results. At this moment Bakytbek earns 7,000 monthly, which supports his wife and four children financially. The purpose of his applying for a loan is to purchase raw materials for accomplishing more orders from customers. Bakytbek is very thankful to lenders, because it gives him the opportunity to express his inner world and make a living through his favorite occupation.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Youk

texts.en:
Youk T. is a 53 year-old woman who earns her daily living by selling rice in Kompong Tom province.  Usually Youk T. can earn a profit of approximately $2.25 each day to use for daily expenses. 
Youk T. divorced for her husband of many years .She has five single children, three of whom are working as sewing workers and construction workers. Monthly they always share their gross profit with Youk T.. 
Unluckily, her daughter's existing motorbike broke during operation, and she spent much money to mend it often. In order to solve this problem, Youk T. will take out her loan to purchase a secondhand motorcycle for her daughter to replace the broken one.

loans.use: To purchase a secondhand motorcycle to replace the broken one.

loans.name: Daya Pertiwi Group

texts.en:
Gusti Ayu S. is a housewife, aged 33, who lives in the village of Tegal Cangkring with her husband and two children. Her daily business is pig-raising near her house, together with her husband who also works as a farmer. 

She also is the leader of "Daya Pertiwi" group which is working together with MUK to fund its pig-raising activities. After having successfully repaid the loan from the last period, Gusti Ayu S. has returned to MUK for her third loan in the amount of Rp. 1.800.000. The loan amount, together with a little additional capital derived from profits from the last period, will be used to buy piglets and pig feed. 

Gusti Ayu S. hopes that if she continues to grow her pig-raising business she will gain even greater financial benefits that can improve the living conditions of her family and of course pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Chinchero, provincia de Urubamba, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Ines; La socia tiene 28 años de edad, la socia es conviviente; la socia tiene 2 hijos (12,6) años de edad, la socia es artesana de profesión ella tiene su stand en la casa taller, que está situado en el bello poblado de Chinchero, la casa taller alberga a muchos artesanos del poblado enseñándoles las técnicas de la pintura textil y aprendiendo a combinar colores y a teñir las lanas con óxidos naturales provenientes de la misma naturaleza; la socia se dedica en especial a la textilería con la ancestral técnica, ella tiene todos sus trabajos exhibiéndose en la casa taller de lunes a domingos; La socia desea el crédito para poder invertir en la compra de materiales y de este modo seguir produciendo para sacar adelante a sus pequeños hijos y darles una buena educación, la socia lleva el arte en las venas, toda su familia desde muy pequeña aprendió la técnica para poder vestirse entre ellos y abrigarse con las frazadas que ellos mismo hacían. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales. 

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ines is a member of the "Nueva Victoria - Chinchero" community bank which is located in Chinchero district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Ines is 28 years old, lives with her partner, and has 2 children aged 12 and 6.  She is a craftswoman by trade and has a stall in a workshop which is located in the beautiful town of Chinchero.  This workshop houses many craftspeople from the town.  It teaches them textile painting techniques and how to combine colors and dye yarn with natural oxides which can be found in nature.  In particular, Ines works in textiles, using an ancestral technique.  She displays her works in the workshop from Monday to Sunday.

Ines would like this loan so that she can invest in buying materials and thereby continue producing her works so that she can get her young children ahead in life and provide them with a good education.  Ines carries art in her veins.  All her family members learned these techniques when they were very young so that they could dress themselves and wrap themselves up in the blankets that they made themselves.

Ines is requesting this loan to invest in buying materials.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to invest in buying materials

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en:
Constancia D. C. is from the village of Acmac, Iligan City. She is 54 years old. Constancia is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fresh mackerel and milk fish and different kinds of dried fish in the local community. Constancia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Constancia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Constancia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fresh and dried fish to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fresh and dried fish to sell

location.town: Acmac, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent A. is 23 years old, married, and has two children. He owns a business selling beans, sorghum, and maize. His business is well-known with two employees. Innocent has four years of experience in his business.

Innocent is requesting his first loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, which he will use to purchase a large quantity of beans, sorghum, and maize.  These items will help him to satisfy his customers' needs. Innocent will able to earn more profits to reinvest in his business and he will pay school fees for his two children.

loans.use: To purchase beans, sorghum, and maize

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity U. is 28 years old and married to a watchmaker. The couple has four children, two of whom are in school. She is currently in the business of selling fish and will use the requested loan to increase her stock of fish for sale. Charity's future goal is to build a bigger shop.

loans.use: to increase her stock of fish for sale.

loans.name: Eddah

texts.en:
Eddah is aged 43 and has been in farming  for six years in the area of Kitale, Western Kenya. She has been producing milk and selling to hotels in the local market. She is married with six children, one of whom is an adult with the other three still schooling. She has one farmhand.

Eddah has made a request for a loan amounting to 35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her purchase poultry. She says she wants to venture into the poultry business to supplement income from dairy which experiences frequent price fluctuations. She adds that the income from farming has been helping her in paying for the education of the children.

She is optimistic, saying the businesses will improve significantly in the future.

loans.use: To pay for the purchase of poultry.

loans.name: Carmen Anabel

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 21 De Noviembre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Carmen, tiene 36 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 18, 15 y 5 años, los dos menores estudian en colegio y en jardín de infantes. Su marido es carpintero.
  
Ella junto  a su esposo tienen un taller de tapicería y costura en el cual se dedica a tapizar muebles y carros, nos cuenta que mientras su marido se encarga de tapizar ella se encarga de elaborar cortinas para autobuses, cojines y almohadas pequeñas. Trabajan todos los días y sus trabajos son reconocidos en toda la provincia ya que también realizan trabajos en otros cantones hasta donde se trasladan para realizar sus obras. Llevan en este negocio 17 años y siempre se han tenido buena clientela a pesar de la competencia.

Este crédito es para comprar materia prima para elaborar sus productos como telas, tapices, hilos, cierres, esponjas, etc. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por el beneficio que recibe del banco.

Sus metas son incrementar más su negocio y seguir progresando cada dia más.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the '21 de Noviembre' community bank meet in Montecristi canton which is known for its rich pre-colonial architecture and also for its handicrafts which are well-known both at home and abroad.  It is the home of the famous Panama hat.

Here we meet 36 year-old Carmen who lives with her common-law husband and has three children aged 18, 15 and 5.  Her two youngest are attending high school and kindergarten.  Her husband is a carpenter.

Carmen and her husband have an upholstery and sewing workshop where they upholster furniture and vehicles.  She tells us that while her husband takes charge of the upholstering, she makes curtains, cushions and small pillows for buses.  They work every day and their work is well known throughout their province since they also do work in other cantons.  In these cases, they travel in order to carry out their work.  They have been in business for 17 years and have always had a good customer base, in spite of the competition.

Carmen will use this loan to buy raw materials for making her products such as fabric, coverings, threads, fasteners, sponge, etc.  She has been a member of her community bank since the beginning and she likes it for the benefits that she receives.  Carmen's goals are to further increase her business and to continue making progress every day.

loans.use: to buy fabric, coverings, threads, fasteners, sponge, etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a hardworking Filipina entrepreneur who has had an eatery for the past twenty years. She earns additional income from her general store and peanut sales.

Victoria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and loans from NWTF. She is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her eatery. She dreams of saving enough to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her eatery.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Mère de 02enfants, Ama réside à Avédji lieu où elle exerce son activité (vente de la tomate, du riz, huile végétale). Elle achète au Grand Marché. C’est une ancienne cliente de WAGES  mais elle est à son premier crédit. Elle veut assurer un avenir radieux à ses enfants et aider son mari qui est comptable financier.  Elle a une ambition avoir une boutique pour exposer ses produits, et plus tard  faire du commerce IMPORT- EXPORT. Elle a démarré en 2003.
texts.en: The mother of two children, Ama resides in Avédji, where she has a business selling tomatoes, rice, and vegetable oil. She makes her purchases at the Grand Market. Ama is a previous client of WAGES, but she is on her first loan. She wants to ensure a brilliant future for her children and to help her husband, who is an accountant. Her ambition is to have a boutique for displaying her products and, later on, to have an import-export business. She started off in 2003.

loans.use: to buy grocery items

loans.name: Regelyn

texts.en:
Regelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who runs a farm machinery rental business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for the past three years and earns additional income from raising pigs and ducks. Regelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.

Regelyn is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts to repair and maintain her rental machinery and equipment. She dreams of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair and maintain machinery

loans.name: Sop Sa Jëker Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Sa Jëker du banc villageois de Diamegueune est créé le  07 décembre 2010. il es composé de  21 femmes issues du même quartier et qui s'activent dans le petit commerce.
Madame Bator la responsable est âgée de 47 ans, mariée mère de 05 enfants. Elle fait du commerce et de l'aviculture. Sur la photo elle est debout à droite couverte d'un châle blanc.
Après chaque financement elle achéte des poussins qu'elle revend 04 mois après pour préparer son remboursement.
Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter des poussins à élever.  
Elle aide son mari dans les besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Sa Jëker of the Banc Villageois of Diamegueune was created on December 7, 2010. It is composed of 21 women who are from the same district and who are active in small-scale commerce. 

Ms. Bator, the group's official, is 47 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She works in commerce and raises poultry. In the photo, she is the one standing at the right and wrapped in a white shawl. With every loan, she purchases chicks that she sells four months later in order to make her payment. Her loan will enable her to buy some chicks to raise. She helps out her husband with family needs.

loans.use: to do commerce and raise poultry

loans.name: Duo La Arboleda Group

texts.es: Duo la Arboleda. este grupo esta conformado por Alejandro quien es el lider del duo el se dedica a la venta y crianza de pollos,el tiene tiempo de dedicarse a esta actividad.por lo mismo esta solicitando este credito para la compra de pollos ya que pues nos cuenta que nececita mas capital para trabajar el se encuentra muy contento porque sus ventas han aumentado y tambien sus clientes.el sueño de el es agrandar sus negocio y ayudar a su familia.la siguiente socia tambien esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa de segunda.
texts.en:
Alejandro is a member of the Duo la Arboleda group and is the leader of the duo.  He sells and breeds chickens and has worked at this for a long time.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy chickens, as he needs more capital to work.  He is very happy because his sales have increased as well as his customers.  His dream is to enlarge his business and help his family.  

The other group member is also requesting this loan in order to buy second-hand clothes.

loans.use: to buy chickens for breeding

loans.name: Leanet

texts.en: Leanet is a focused 33 years old business lady. She is married and blessed with three children who are school going. For the last 4 years she has been operating a boutique so as to meet her needs. She wants in the next 5 years to have expanded her business premises and doubled her annual turnover. She is requesting for a loan of 50000 Kenya shillings to buy clothes for resale. Thanks to Faulu Kenya she is now financially literate.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Since 2005, Ahmad is the proud owner of a small shop where he sells car spare parts and oil. He is the only income source for his family. He is a 30-year-old married man and lives with his wife and only child. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase his purchases of new car spare parts and oil. 

This will be his third Kiva loan and we note that he is an excellent client with payments on time.

loans.use: to increase his purchases of new car spare parts and oil.

loans.name: Dorocus

texts.en:
Dorocus has been a farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 25 years. She is 45 years old, and a single mother of two school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers--this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy a dairy cow and increase her milk production.

In the future, Dorocus hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: Tailleur de profession, en même temps commercant vivant dans une ville proche de la capitale du Sénégal. Il fait la confection d'habits aussi bien que pour les hommes que pour les femmes. Ce prêt a pour but d'achat de tissus pour la confection des produits qu'il doit vendre avec aussi comme objectif d'acheter des machines a coudre pour l'ouvrir d'autres boutiques qui fait dans la confections des tissus afin d'avoir une bonne continuité et d'étre plus professionnel et ne pas dépendre des prix sur le marché. Avec une expérience longue d'une douzaine d'annéé le fait de ne plus avoir des problémes avec son stockage de marchandises qui doit etre a jour avec une demande pressant lui a pousser a faire ce prêt pour renforcer ses activitées.
texts.en: This man is a tailor by training, and at the same time is also a merchant in a city close to the capital of Senegal. He makes clothing for both men and women. This loan will be used to buy fabric to make the products he sells, and also to buy sewing machines to open additional clothing stores in order to maintain an uninterrupted business, be more professional, and avoid being dependent on market price changes. Given his 12 years of experience, the appeal of not having to deal with merchandise stock issues combined with rising demand has pushed him to seek this loan to strengthen his business.

loans.use: To buy fabric in order to make clothing.

loans.name: Akouavi Délali

texts.fr:
Akouavi Délali est une femme âgé(e) de 22ans. Elle est mariée å un  transitaire. Ils ont 01 enfant en charge.
Akouavi Délali travaille comme revendeuse de bijoux et pagnes de façon ambulante depuis 2007.
 Elle achète les produits au Grand Marché de Lomé et au BENIN. 
Akouavi Délali a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des bijoux et pagnes. Elle veut ouvrir une boutique pour ne plus se déplacer.
texts.en:
Akouavi Délali, age 22, is married to a freight forwarder. They have one child to support. Since 2007, she's been working as an ambulant saleswoman, selling jewelry and "pagnes" (colorful African cloth).

She gets her supplies at the Grand Market in Lomé, as well as in Benin. She's seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy jewelry and pagnes. She wants to open a shop so that she won't need to move anymore.

loans.use: to buy jewelry and "pagnes" (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida is 44 years old married. She has seven children: four sons and three daughters. Her eldest son was educated till 9th standard and now is working in an optical shop. Her remaining children are enrolled in a school and getting their education. 

Her husband sells mobile phones and wrist watches. He operates a shop in the market where he sells his products to his customers. He has been in this business for the past five years.
 
Zubaida herself knows the skills of sewing, which she uses to supplement the income for the family. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy mobile phones and wrist watches to sell. She is hopeful that his business will be improved further after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones and wrist watches for selling.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en:
Marisol is 28 years old and married. She has a 2-year-old child. Marisol’s husband works as a Barangay official.

Marisol has had a sari-sari store business for two years. She sells items like canned goods, sugar, vinegar and soy sauce. Marisol earns 3,000 PHP per month with her business. 

She requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks and noodles. Marisol hopes to earn better and be able to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks and noodles.

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom is 33 years old and supports her husband by operating a rope-selling business. The ropes she sells are used for making cots. She started this business a few years ago to meet the financial expenses of her family. 

Her husband is a master tailor. He operates his shop in the market and provides quality sewing services to his clients. 

Kalsoom is the mother of two daughters and three sons. Three of her children study, while the others stay at home. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her business of selling ropes. With the loan, she will buy ropes in larger quantities. That will allow her to finish clients’ orders on time and increase her profits. 

She is very experienced in her work and has been operating the business for the past ten years. She is confident that an investment will help her expand her business. 

Kalsoom is a regular loan user of Asasah. This is her second loan application. In her previous loan year, she has proven herself to be a responsible client by paying her installments on time and attending every meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Kalsoom.

loans.use: to buy ropes for selling.

loans.name: San Marcos Group

texts.es: Este Grupo solidario se llama San Marcos, está conformado por las señoras Saturnina, Marina y Basilia van a comprar con su préstamo barro, tierra blanca, leña, greta para elaborar jarros, cazuelas y macetas, el señor Víctor va a comprar leña, barro, greta y pintura para elaborar cazuelas. La señora Marina tiene 40 años de edad, ella es casada tiene 2 hijos 1 estudia la secundaria y el otro ya trabaja, ella trabaja la alfarería elabora macetas y cazuelas de barro, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar barro, tierra blanca y leña, ella inicio su negocio hace 20 años, es herencia de sus abuelitos, ella veía como sus papas trabajaban el barro y le llamaba la atención y comenzaba también a elaborar las cazuelas, su negocio es importante para ir pasando la vida para trabajar y sacar ingresos para sostener a la familia, ella se siente orgullosa de ser artesana de seguir con este trabajo de sus antepasado, su negocio es popular porque en su pueblo elaboran cazuelas, jarros, olla, macetas de barro de buena calidad, ella utiliza las ganancias en invertir en los materiales para seguir trabajando, en la comida, el jabón y en la escuela de su hijo. Sus sueños y esperanzas son comprar loza para revender y que a sus hijos no les falte calzado, uniformes ropa y buena salud. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “Les damos las gracias por la confianza que nos tienen al darnos este préstamo y no vamos a quedar mal, gracias por ayudarnos a crecer los negocios y las familias.
texts.en:
This community bank is called 'San Marcos'.  Saturnina, Marina and Basilia are members of the bank and they will use their loan to buy clay and white clay to make pitchers, casserole dishes and flowerpots.  Víctor will buy firewood, clay and paint to make casserole dishes. 

Marina is 40 years old, married, and has two children.  One of her children is attending high school and the other is already working.  Marina makes pottery.  She makes flowerpots and clay casserole dishes.  She is requesting her loan to buy clay, white clay and firewood.  She started her business 20 years ago (an inheritance from her grandparents).  She saw how her mom and dad worked the clay and it drew her attention.  She started making casserole dishes too.   Marina's business is important as it enables her to work and make income to support her family.  She feels proud to be a craftswoman and to carry on this work which was done by her ancestors.  Her business is popular because in her village they make good-quality casserole dishes, pitchers, pots and flowerpots.  Marina uses her profits to invest in materials so that she can continue working.  She also spends them on food, soap and school for her son.  Her hopes and dreams are to buy pottery to resell and for her children to never lack shoes, uniforms, clothes and good health.  The members of this group would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad "Thank you for the trust that you are placing in us by giving us this loan.  We won't let you down.  Thank you for helping us to grow our businesses and families".

loans.use: to buy clay, white clay and firewood for making flowerpots and casserole dishes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell flowers.

loans.name: Manuna Group

texts.en:
Sarah is the facilitator of the Manuna group. Sarah and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Sarah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Sarah joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Sarah had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Sarah was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Sarah will educate her children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Manuna group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Sarah with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: La señora Nancy es comerciante de calzados de niños. El crédito que requiere  es para compra de más calzados y así poder surtir su stock para  aprovechar las fiestas de fin de año. Nancy es viuda y tiene tres hijos. Vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona Villa Nueva Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz. Nancy es cliente de Impro desde el año 2006, con 11 créditos concedidos durante todos estos años y pagados en forma excelente. Esta vez ella ha decidido que su aplicación sea enviada a Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Nancy is a merchant who sells children’s shoes. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more shoes so that she can replenish her stock and take advantage of the year-end festivities. Nancy is a widow and has three children. She lives in her own home in the District of Villa Nueva Potosí in the city of La Paz.

Nancy has been a client of IMPRO since 2006. She has received 11 loans throughout this entire time and has repaid them in an excellent manner. This time she decided that her application would be sent to Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase children's shoes to sell during the holiday season.

loans.name: Ho's Group

texts.en:
Ho is a 58-year-old mother of seven children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. To feed and support her family, she has been farming on a four-hectare farmland for thirty-eight years. She owns three hectares and leases one hectare. She has been with VisionFund for five years. Her past loans have improved her living significantly, including helping her provide food and provide for her children’s education. 

Now Ho is requesting another loan with VisionFund with her group member Soheurt, who has been with VisionFund for two years. She will use this $125 USD loan to hire workers to harvest her rice paddy. She hopes to increase her crop yield and earn more income in order to better support her basic needs and to keep her children in school to obtain a higher education.

loans.use: To hire workers to harvest her rice paddy.

loans.name: Yolanda Marina

texts.es: Yolanda Marina es una emprendedora exitosa, ya que cumplió su objetivo de tener su propio negocio que es la venta de ropa nueva, tiene experiencia en el negocio y sobre todo sabe que es lo que los clientes le buscan eso le permite a ella que la visiten por la calidad de ropa que le ofrece y la atención. No es la primera vez que solicita crédito a Fundación León 2000 y ella ha mostrado ser una persona responsable y sobre todo cumplir sus objetivos que se propone. Actualmente está solicitando crédito para invertir en mercadería para esta temporadas buenas.
texts.en: Yolanda Marina is a successful entrepreneur because she reached her goal of having her own business selling new clothes.  She has experience in the business and above all knows what customers are looking for which leads them to visit her because of the quality of the clothes she offers and the service.  This is not her first loan request to Fundación León 2000 and she’s shown herself to be a responsible person who above all reaches the objectives she sets out for herself.  She is currently asking for a loan to buy merchandise for these good seasons.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Mayson

texts.en:
Mayson is a 37-year-old woman from Aqaba, Jordan.

Mayson is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase new furniture for her house with an aspiration of doing new decorations for the house and building a second floor.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en: Oanh is 22 years old. She has a little baby and a child whom is studying at school. She is a carpenter. She gains from it 4,500,000 VND per month. She has taken part in crediting program of SEDA from 2009. The last cycle, she borrowed 8,736,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to make more furniture to sell. Then she will use the benefit for raising her children up and rebuilding her house.

loans.use: to make more furniture to sell. Then she will use the benefit for raising her children up and rebuilding her house.

loans.name: Magsarjav

texts.en: Mrs. Magsarjav is 39 years old and lives with his wife and his children in small house in Khuvsgul, province of Mongolia. His wife helps his business and his children go to the secondary school. He started meat trade business in 1998. He has been well-experienced in meat trade business in his local resident appreciates him as a honest and diligent man. Now, he is business is sustaintle and has many regular customers and suppliers. He is requesting 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase livestocks for his business. He wants save the money for his children's higher education.

loans.use: To purchase livestocks for his business

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
ENGLISH

Mrs. Martina is a enthusiastic woman who distinguishes herself as being very dynamic. She lives with a couple and has two children who help her in her business. Six years ago, she decided to start her small business, selling in her house buttons, zippers, lace, etc. and with her husband’s support she built a small place in the front of her house, where she has a notions and gifts store.

She wants to be preparing for the next Christmas time, because people like to make hand crafts and her sales increase. This is why she is requesting a loan by $925 USD to buy merchandise and be able to supply to her clients. She wants to repay in a term of 6-12 months.

ESPAÑOL

La Señora Martina es una mujer muy entusiasta que se distingue por ser muy dinámica, ella vive con su pareja y sus dos hijos que le ayudan en el negocio. Hace seis años decidió iniciar su pequeño negocio vendiendo en su casa botones, cierres, encajes, etc. y con la ayuda de su cónyuge logró construir un pequeño local a la entrada de su casa en donde tiene una mercería y regalos.

Ella quiere prepararse para la temporada navideña que se avecina, ya que la gente acostumbra elaborar manualidades y se incrementan sus ventas, es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo por $ 925 USD para comprar mercancía y poder surtir los pedidos de sus clientes, el plazo que solicita es de 6-12 meses.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Solopeta

texts.en: Solopeta, 48, is married and has four children. When she joined the SPBD microcredit program the business idea she had in mind was a bit unusual for women -- lawn mowing. But she saw a great opportunity for offering lawn mowing services for the better-off houses in the village. Now her business has proven to be successful and she is proposing to buy two additional brand-new lawn mowers and employ her jobless relatives.

loans.use: To purchase two additional lawn mowers

loans.name: Fazila

texts.en: Fazala is 40 years old. She lives with five members of her family in District 3 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is uneducated and is a tailor. She wants to support her family because she wants help her husband who is not working. She requests a loan from AFS to buy a sewing machine and extra materials to continue her business. She plans to work hard and find more customers in order to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Hot

texts.en: Mr. Hot H. is 44 years old and works as a small fisherman in Siem Reap Province.  He earns about $4/day at this job, but 2 of his sons also work to supplement the family income.  One son is a construction worker, and another works in a massage shop.  Mr. Hot H. pays for his sons to get to work everyday, but this is too expensive to keep up.  He will use this loan to buy a motorbike that his sons can use to get to and from work.  He knows that this will be a much cheaper option in the longrun.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport his children to and from work

loans.name: Tara

texts.en: Mrs. Tara S., 28, lives in Dholko, Kathmandu, with her husband and a son. Her husband, Mr. Rabi S., works in a furniture factory and her son is studying in grade 6. She opened her grocery shop 5 years ago. Now she seeks $150 to invest in the grocery shop for a better income. She needs the loan to purchase grocery items such as rice, biscuits, chocolates, mineral water, and other things to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Sahib

texts.en: Sahib Q. is a 30-year-old farmer who has a garden and raises vegetables. Sahib is an internally displaced person who fled from the Jabrail region to Bilasuvar during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993.  Currently Sahib lives with his big family in Bilasuvar 4th IDP Settlement. He has three sons. Sahib engaged in raising vegetables seven years ago when hunger knocked on his family's door. Sahib used to live in the IDPs campus, without the normal conditions for life, but seven years ago the government built settlements and provided them to IDPs with the free land for raising crops. Since that time Sahib began raising watermelon and melons and selling them in the local bazaar. Later he started to raise tomatoes, cucumbers, pepper, guinea squash (eggplant) and other vegetables. It brought him good income during those years and his family's needs were covered enough. But two years ago living in the village become harder.  His sons are growing up, they need more things every year; school supplies, clothes and shoes. Sahib has worked very hard to improve his family life, but it has not been easy. He decided to develop his business and start raising potatoes and onions. These vegetables are in very high demand all across Azerbaijan, and Sahib believes that 900 USD he has applied for, will help him to overcome his difficulties.

loans.use: Going to start raising potatoes and onions

loans.name: Teresa Venâncio

texts.pt:
Teresa Venâncio S. is 39 years old. She is a single mother of 3 children. They live in Corumana, a district of Moamba in Maputo. She joined the program in November 2006. Her first loan was of 4.000mt. She sells fish in Corumana and Malhapswene. She is in the 3rd cycle of the credit program and is requesting a loan of 10.000mt to be repaid in 6 months. Teresa plans on buying and reselling goats with this loan.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Teresa Venâncio S. tem 39 anos de idade e é mãe solteira de 3 filhos.Vive em Corumana no distrito da Moamba em Maputo. Entrou para o progrma em Novembro de 2006 com um empréstimo inicial de 4.000MT. Vende peixe em Corumana e também em Malhapswene. Está no terceiro ciclo de empréstimo, tendo se comportado bem nos ciclos anteriores.Vai tomar 10.000MT para pagar em 6 meses e pretende investir o valor do presente empréstimo na compra e venda de cabritos.

loans.use: To buy Goats

loans.name: Nodiramoh

texts.ru:
Nodiramoh H. is 33 years old, has a high school education, is married and has 6 children. She sells peanuts. She purchases unprocessed peanuts, processes them and then sells them. Nodiramoh plans to use the loan to purchase a large amount of peanuts in order to save travel time required to constantly replenish her supply. After processing them she will sell them.

Peanuts are a delicacy that hosts serve to guests and they are in high demand. This loan will help local residents to purchase this product in processed form at lower prices. Nodiramoh will pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Хазраткулова Нодирамох, возраст 33 года, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 6-х детей. Клиент занимается продажей фисташек. Она закупает фисташки в необратонном виде, после чего обрабатывает их, придает товарный вид и продает. На полученный кредит она планирует приобрести большое количество фисташек, чтобы часто не ездить за ними. После их обработки, часть она будет продавать их. Так как фисташки это одно из тех угощений, которое ставится на стол во время приезда гостей и пользуется большим спросом, данный кредит поможет местным жителям приобретать этот продукт в обработанном виде по более низким ценам, чем на центральном рынке данного района. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of peanuts

loans.name: Tursunali

texts.ru:
Tursunali B., who is 68, has 5 children. He mainly works as an electrician. Tursunali owns a small piece of land next to his house. Because this time is a season for planting certain types of produce, Tursunali needs to purchase potato seeds that he could plant on his land. This loan will help to do just that - plant potato seeds on his land. He will sell part of the crops to the local residents and leave the rest for himself. He is planning to pay off the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Байбалаев Турсунали, возраст – 68 лет, образование – среднее специальное, по профессии – электрик, женат, имеет 5-х детей. Турсунали имеет небольшой приусадебный участок возле своего дома. Так как сейчас начался посевной сезон для некоторых видов сельхозкультур, Турсунали необходимы закупить семяна картофеля для засева своего участка. Данный кредит поможет приобрести семена картофеля и засеять приусадебный участок. Часть полученного урожая он планирует продать местным жителям, а оставшуюся часть оставить для собственных нужд. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds

loans.name: Kabumbi V B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Harriet N.. She is currently in the business of fresh food sales and is requesting a loan to increase stock. Harriet is 38 years old and is married. Her husband is a commercial motorcyclist for work. She has 3 children ranging from age 4 to 7 and her children go to school.
