Each week, Harriet makes approximately UGX 25000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to re-invest in her business. Harriet has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to purchase more fresh foods and the loan was paid back on time.

Harriet is joined in her small group by Farida N., Agnes N., Lukia N., and Justine N.. Farida N. has a business in charcoal selling and wants to add stock. Agnes N. is currently operating a business in cosmetic sales and wants a loan to increase inventory. Lukia N. operates a business of selling fresh foods and wants to increase capital stock. Justine N. is currently in the business of charcoal selling and is requesting a loan to increase stock and construct a charcoal store.

loans.use: To expand food business

loans.name: Sat

texts.en: Mrs. Sat P. is a 63-year-old widow who lives in Rom Lech Village in Kampong Cham Province. She earns $1.50 per day planting dry season rice and growing soybeans. Five of her seven children are married. One daughter is a garment weaver in Phnom Penh, while another is a worker harvesting tobacco in Kampong Cham Province. P. requests a loan of $250 to rent plots of land for her soybean crop, as well as to purchase seeds for planting. She hopes this loan will improve her finances and expand her business. The photo is of Mrs. Sat P. and her daughter.

loans.use: To rent plots of land for her soybean crop, as well as to purchase seeds for planting

loans.name: Chhum

texts.en: Mrs. Chhum S. sells cosmetics near her home and makes about $4 per day. She lives with one child in Tuol Chambork Village, Kampong Cham Province. S. requests a loan of $300 to purchase cosmetics to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics to sustain and develop her business.

loans.name: María Pabla

texts.en:
Maria Pabla Gonzales is a single mother of four school-age children. They all live in San Roque Gonzales de Santa Cruz in Carepegua. She needs to work very hard since she has to raise four children on her own.

In the morning Maria Pabla goes door to door selling vegetables. In the afternoon, she and her children prepare natural medicines to sell in a well-known market in Carapegua.

Maria Pabla makes a lot of efforts to bring benefits to her extensive family. She admits it is not easy because she is alone and has many children. She tries harder and harder every day to lift her family out of poverty. She needs the money to buy vegetables.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables

loans.name: Neida

texts.es:
Neida P. D. Rios is a member of the “Santa Isabel” community bank, she lives in the San Martin region, province and district of Picota. She makes and sells bread, she makes them at home to sell them in a local market.

Neida used to sell “anticuchos” (meat skewers) and sodas, but she thinks that bread is a basic element on the table of every family and she decided to start making it.

With the loan of $700 USD (S/.2,000), which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy sacks of flour, cases of eggs, liters of oil, packages of butter and other ingredients necessary for bread making and this way satisfy the demand of her clients, who live in the community.

Neida is 44 years old, she is separated, has 4 children of whom only one lives with her and 3 that are doing their professional studies in the capital city of the country, reason why she has to keep fighting, hoping to achieve her dream of owning her own bakery where she can offer a variety of the breads she knows how to make.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Neida P. D. R., es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Isabel”, vive en la región San Martín provincia y distrito D. Picota, se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. panes, los elabora en su casa para llevarlos a vender en su puesto que tiene en el mercado D. abastos D. la localidad.

La señora Neida anteriormente D. dedico a la venta D. anticuchos y refrescos, cree que el pan es un elemento esencial en la mesa D. todas las familias y decidió iniciarse en esta actividad.

Con el crédito recibido D. S/.2,000.00 que será pagado en 6 meses compró sacos D. harina, huevos en javas, aceite en litros, mantequilla en paquetes y demás insumos para la elaboración del pan y D. esa manera satisfacer la demanda D. sus clientes que son los pobladores D. la localidad.

Neida tiene 44 años, ella es separada, tiene 4 hijos solo uno vive con ella y que 3 realizan sus estudios superiores en la capital del país, razón por lo que ella tiene que seguir luchando, espera alcanzar todos sus sueños que es tener un local propio para su panadería donD. oferte la variedad D. los panes que ella sabe preparar.

loans.use: Purchase flour and wholesale ingredients to make bread.

loans.name: Mahadia's Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Mahadia is 33 years old. She is a married woman with 2 children, ages 10 and 7. She became a vegetable seller in 2007. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 12:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

Mahadia now hopes for a loan to buy more vegetables for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with clothes and food sales.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for her business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes A., 49 years old, is a wife and mother of three kids who are currently in school.  She operates a clothing shop and has been selling jeans, clothes, blouses and skirts, women slippers and dressing bags for the past eight years.  

Agnes is constrained by funds to run the business.  She needs the loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress.  She believes the loan will help her to have more resources to purchase good quality and large quantities to upgrade her inventory.  She says she would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To purchase jeans, clothes, ladies' wear and slippers.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok K., 38, is married and has four young children. The family lives in the Kampong Cham province. She grows sugar cane, typically making $1 USD each day. Her husband, Nan Oeun, is a construction worker who typically makes about $3 USD each day. 

Sok K. would like a loan of $300 USD to purchase a cow to breed. This loan would allow for their family to increase their profits from raising the animal along with their daily income.

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 45-year-old Lucy S. from Mbeya. She is widowed with four children between the ages of 15 and 27. Lucy has been running a phamacy since 1993 and business is good. Lucy currently earns about $200USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400USD in order to purchase additional medicine. In the future, she plans to open another business. Lucy thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Lending. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a lending microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microlending is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Lucy would like to purchase additional medicine for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther A. prepares rice and sauce for sale to her costumers who are too busy to cook. She lives in Kakumdo, near the Cape Coast. Esther received a primary school education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is an electrician.

Esther has been preparing rice and sauce for sale for six years. She is responsible for paying school fees, and other family expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more rice and other ingredients. This will enable her to increase production. She hopes to use the new profits to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: To buy more rice and other ingredients to increase production.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora María del Carmen es originaria de Michoacán y vino a Piedras Negras buscando una estabilidad económica  por ello ya tiene establecida aquí diez años, ahora ella tiene su propio negocio de abarrotes, cerca de su negocio no existen otras tienditas, esta solicitando este crédito para la inversión de mas mercancía y asi incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
María del Carmen is from Michoacán and came to Piedras Negras to seek economic stability. She has been settled here for ten years and now has her own grocery business. There aren't any other shops near her business. She is requesting this loan to invest in more merchandise and to increase her sales.


Translated from Spanish by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in merchandise for the business

loans.name: Keyla Patricia

texts.es:
La seoñra Keyla Patricia R. ha sobresalido por ser buenísima cocinera la cual se dedica a elaborar deliciosos platillos para venderlos en su casa de habitación ubicada en el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega.


Ella elabora los platillos y los vende en el desayuno, en el almuerzo y en la cena, todos los días lleva a cabo esta actividad y la realiza gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel el cual le ha beneficiado grandemente por medio de la entrega de los créditos. La razón por la cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un nuevo crédito que le permita la compra de la materia prima para la elaboración de los deliciosos alimentos que solo ella sabe preparar.
texts.en:
Keyla Patricia R. stands out as an excellent cook. She prepares delicious dishes to sell from her home in the municipality of Somotillo in Chinandega. She prepares her dishes daily and sells them for breakfast, lunch and dinner. She is grateful for Ceprodel's support as she has benefited greatly from the loans she has received. She has approached Ceprodel for a new loan to purchase the foodstuffs she needs to prepare the delicious meals which she alone knows how to make.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to prepare meals with.

loans.name: Rechelle

texts.en:
Rechelle B. (the lady in white) is 31 years old and presently residing in Buenavista District, Pagadian City, Zamboanga Del Sur. She has 2 kids and her husband is a mechanic. Her eldest child is 11 years old, and her youngest is a 1-year-old girl. They've been married for 12 years, and through the years they've struggled and lived happily but full of dreams and hopes that someday they will own a restaurant with 12 employees so that they can help their neighbors who have no income or work.

She started a hanging rice business, through the encouragement of her sister-in-law, for income. She can make 100 and sell them to carenderias in the city. Hanging rice is composed of the leaves of the coconut tree and rice, and she supplies 2 carenderias daily with 300 pieces of cooked hanging rice, and also gets occasional orders, like for fiesta celebrations of the city, municipal activities, Christmas, Valentines Day and other celebrations.

Through the loan and skills assistance of Paglaum Cooperative, she applied for a loan worth Php 10,000.00, and expanded her hanging rice business. She started to look around for a potential area for display. She was inspired to start a carenderia for more income, as a stepping stone to achieve her dream, which included owning a restaurant. In this way she can give jobs to unemployed neighbors, and most of all, she provide for the needs of her 2 kids. Hopefully her husband can have a welding shop, too.  With her determination and guidance, nothing is impossible.

loans.use: for expansion of her hanging rice business

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda Y. is a single parent and has 2 children. She has received no formal education. Linda sells clothing at Coronation near Cape Coast, which she has done since 2004. Linda uses her income to pay for rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. Linda will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to buy more clothing to increase sales to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Linda plans to save towards acquiring a piece of land for the building of the family house so that they can stop paying rent and also get a comfortable shelter for the family.

loans.use: Linda will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to buy more clothing to increase sales to meet the increase in demand by her costumers.

loans.name: Mama

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier de tokoin gbadagbo, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale dans son quartier. Elle est la seule à exercer ce commerce dans  son quartier  et elle à beaucoup de demande, elle doit rehausser son stock pour faire face à la demande c’est pour cela qu’elle demande à wages un crédit  pour acheter des marchandise pour son commerce. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants
texts.en:
This is a lady who lives in the Tokoin Gbadagbo district. Her income-generating work involves commerce in grocery items. She is the only one in this business in her area, and she is in high demand. She must replenish her inventory in order to cope with the demand. That’s why she’s asking WAGES for a loan to buy merchandise for her commerce. She is married and the mother of three.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Bikadi Group

texts.fr:
Composé de six femmes, les  membres du groupe BIKADI sont tous des femmes mariées. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans et de 4 enfants et vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles avec leurs enfants, frères, sœurs et époux  dans le village de TINGOLE, sous préfecture de FANA, dans la préfecture de DIOÏLA région de KOULIKORO, république du Mali. 
A travers es liens sociaux et de voisinage, elles se sont connues et exercent en générale le commerce de céréales. 
Dans le souci d’augmenter leur chiffre d’affaire et de faire plus de stock, elles ont adhéré à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur septième prêt de groupe dont quatre prêts de campagne. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, 2 tonnes de maïs, 500 kg de sorgho, 700 kg de haricot. Toutes ces céréales seront achetées avec les producteurs de TINGOLE et ses villages environnants. Une partie des produits sera stockée jusqu’aux périodes de soudures, l’autre partie sera vendue en détail et au comptant sur le marché de TINGOLE à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent obtenir chacune avec ce prêt un bénéfice par cycle de 47 000 FCFA qui les servira à appuyer leurs époux dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Composed of six women, the members of the group BIKADI are all married and average 31 years of age and 4 children. They live in traditional conjugal families with their children, brothers, sisters, and spouses in the village of TINGOLE in FANA sub-prefecture (DIOÏLA prefecture in the KOULIKORO region) in the Republic of Mali. Through social and community ties, they came to know one another. They in general do the same work selling grains.

Concerned about increasing their turnover and to build a bigger stock of goods, they've joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their seventh group loan, which included four rural loans. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid.

With this loan, the group members intend to buy 2 tonnes of corn, 400 kg of sorghum, and 700 kg of beans. All these grains will be purchased from producers in and around TINGOLE. A portion of the goods will be stored until times of shortages. The other portion will be sold retail in cash transaction to customers composed of men and women at the TINGOLE marketplace.

The group members each plan to earn a profit of 47,000 francs CFA per cycle that will serve to support their spouses in covering family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grain

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice C. has worked as a trader in Elmina and Takoradi since 2002, dealing in such goods as porridge and donuts. She is married with 2 children and received an education through Senior High School. While Beatrice works as a trader, her husband is employed as a security officer.

Her loan will be used to buy more maize, sugar and flour for the preparation of porridge for sale at the roadside for her customers who don't normally take their breakfast before leaving their homes. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build another house.

loans.use: For maize, sugar and flour

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr:
A. Marie est née vers 1972 à Lokokoukoumè, un quartier populaire de la ville de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. A. Marie est originaire de Xwla dans le Département de l'Ouémé. Marie est mariée à SEFOU Wassi électricien à GASA FORMATION, un école tertiaire de Cotonou. Marie a deux enfants, une fille et un garçon. La fille Zéchiath a onze (11)ans et est en première année du lycée; le garçon Massoume a six(6)ans et est en deuxième année du cours primaire. Marie est dans la restauration. Marie a un maquis dans lequel elle vent la sauce de mouton avec différentes pâtes de maïs et de caussette d'igname, ainsi que les boissons de la brasserie. Pour élever le niveau de son activité afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle sans cesse croîssante, Marie a besoin de moyens financiers. C'est la raison pour laquelle Marie sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.  

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
A. Marie was born around 1972 in Lokokoukoumè, a working-class district of the city of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. She traces her roots to Xwla, in Ouémé County. She is married to SEFOU Wassi, an electrician at GASA FORMATION, a tertiary school of Cotonou. She has two children, a girl and a boy. The girl, Zéchiath, is 11 years old and is in her first year of middle school; the boy, Massoume, is 6 years old and is in his second year of elementary school.

Marie works in the restaurant business. She has an eatery in which she sells mutton soup with different mashes (cornmeal or yam chips), as well as pub drinks. To raise her business level in order to do better in satisfying her customers, who are ever-growing in number, she has a need for funding. This is why she’s requesting a loan from Alidé.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cases of pub drinks and mutton, as well as condiments for making soups and sauces

loans.name: Mecedes

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes es socia del banco comunal “Las Fronterizas” en el distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de  31 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y posee estudios de secundaria incompleta (segundo de secundaria).
Trabaja desde hace tres años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos e inicio su negocio de preparación de jugos con su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos  soles y se siente contenta porque le permitió ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles podrá ampliar su negocio de venta de jugos, comprará nuevos equipos y accesorios; así como insumos, comprará frutas como naranjas, plátanos, piñas, papayas, y otros insumos como azúcar, algarrobita, huevos; de esta manera contribuirá a mejorar la calidad educativa de sus hijos,
texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of the community bank “Las Fronterizas” in the Desaguadero district, in the province of Chucuito, in the Puno department. She is 31 years old, has two children, and has an incomplete secondary education. She has worked for three years with the Manuela Ramos Movement and started her juice business with her first loan of 300 soles. This made her happy because it helped her cover her household expenses. With this loan of 3,000 soles, she will be able to grow her juice selling business by purchasing new equipment, accessories, and fruit such as oranges, bananas, pineapple, and papaya. She will also purchase other ingredients such as sugar, carob, and eggs. This will contribute to improving the quality of education of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new equipment and accessories, such as necessary ingredients to grow her business like bananas, pineapple, papaya, sugar, oranges, carob, and eggs

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: K. Mary, 60, is a widow. She has a house for rent, and she has involved in a beverage selling business since 2005. She has only one child, a son, whose job is buying and selling used motorbikes. She plans to take the loan from Kiva of $1000 to facilitate her son’s business of buying more motorbikes since his business can be more profitable than hers. She plans to buy a house with a convenient location for him to do the business. (Her son fixing his used motorbike is presented in the picture because Mary is not available.)

loans.use: To buy a house from which to do business

loans.name: Penty Hecky

texts.en:
Penty is 29 years old. He is married with three children. He is a tailor in Uthiru, Nairobi. His business is located in a busy market center in a one-room rented house. Penty has been in the business for five years and feels that he needs to expand. With this loan, he hopes to buy a buttonhole sewing machine, more fabric, and other sewing materials.

He has walk-in clients and regulars. He wants to expand his business to include selling clothing materials to other tailors, and he wants to open other branches of his business in other market centers.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy a buttonhole sewing machine and other materials for making clothes

loans.name: Charyn

texts.en:
Charyn N. is from the village of Purok 23, Tu-od, Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 25 years old. Charyn is single. To make a living, Charyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Charyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In July 2009, Charyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Charyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Фарходчон

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan
       Фарходчон молодой мужчина 1982 года рождения. Женат и имеет 1-го ребенка. У него среднее образование. Фарходчон занимается откормом и продажей скота, а его жена занимается переработкой и продажей молока. Фарходчон пришел брать кредит в первый раз. У него пока малое количество скота. Фарходчон надеется увеличить количество мелко рогатого скота с помощью кредита. У его жены только одна дойная корова. Фарходчон планирует купить для своей жены еще одну дойную корову с теленком, и он благодарен нашим кредиторам за помощь в осуществлении его планов.

loans.use: Закуп скота

loans.name: Rano

texts.en: U. Rano is 45 years old and is married with three adorable children. She sells perfumery and cosmetics in the store that she rents. She has been in this business for sixteen years. Rano dreams of expanding her business and opening her own store, establishing contacts with the constant suppliers of well-known products. Rano and her husband are working hard in order to have sufficient funds for educating of their children so that they become highly-demanded experts in future. Today Rano requests 1,000 USD in order to purchase new perfumery and cosmetics such as hair color, nail varnish, lipstick, etc. with the purpose of increasing her range of goods. She would like to thank everybody supporting her and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase the range of goods she sells

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann P., 27 years old mother of two childrenn is selling bananas for a living. She started her business since April 2009 to be able to send her children to school and buy them a book and their other needs.

After she heard about CEVI, she was delighted to joined in the program because her friends are also CEVI borrowers. She would like to request a loan of Php 4,000. She will use the loan to purchased more banas to resell.

She said that her dream is to have a basic store. She wished to make her bana selling click so that she will have enough capital to start a store.

loans.use: To buy banana for her bananacue selling business

loans.name: Juan David

texts.es: Juan David M. M. de 27 años de edad, vive en Soyapango municipio del departamento de San Salvador. Juan se encuentra casado  vive con su esposa, su hija de 6 años de edad y su suegra. Juan posee una panadería donde trabaja el y su esposa, el negocio de Juan ha ido creciendo poco a poco, son cuatro años los que lleva dirigiendo su negocio el cual ahora tiene mucha demanda, es por ello que solicita un crédito, para compra de insumos utilizados en la elaboración de pan.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: Originaire d'Abomey, ville historique du Bénin, A. Antoinette est née vers 1947 à Savè au Nord du Bénin. Antoinette est mariée à LISSA Placide, un agent retraité des Postes et Télécommunication du Bénin, et a six enfants tous scolarisés. Cela fait plus de douze ans que Antoinette exerce le commerce de charbon de bois. Antoinette achète le charbon de bois au Nord du Bénin et le revend à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Antoinette a bien remboursé les deux crédits qu'elle a eu à ALIDé antérieurement. Pour accroître son stock actuel  et diversifier son activité par la vente de maïs, Antoinette sollicite un troisième crédit à ALIDé. Antoinette espère ainsi mieux tirer profit de son commerce.

loans.use: Achat de  charbon de bois et de maïs

loans.name: Jo-An

texts.en: Jo-an H., 24, is the mother of a 3-year-old child. Her family lives in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato, and has a hog raising business. She started this business in 2004. She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to ask for financial assistance to help make her business grow. She's requesting a loan amount of 6,000 PHP to buy feed.

loans.use: To buy feed

loans.name: Srey Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Mom N. lives in Trapaing Svay Village, in the Takeo Province of Cambodia.  She is a grocer and her husband, Khat Bun Thorn, is a farmer.  He owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice and breeds pigs.  His pig breeding business is going well, and he wants to expand it.  Srey Mom N. is asking for a loan to buy more piglets and feed for the breeding business.  She is 29 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school.  Her husband is also presented in the photo.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feed for the breeding business

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a Palestinian man living in Al-Thahria Village near Hebron city in the south of West Bank. He works at Alia Hospital, a government hospital, and works as head of all gophers, cleaners and janitors.

Mohammad has four sons and one daughter, two of whom are working while his daughter is studying at Abudees University and the youngest son is at high school.

Mohammad has requested 3,000 USD to pay for the tuition of his fourth son since he has been accepted by the medical college in Egpyt and this been his dream since he was a child. So Mohammad decided to take the loan to pay for his son’s tuition.

Mohammad appears in the photo at the FATEN office.

loans.use: To pay for his son's university tuition

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, age 44, sells groceries and shoes. She is excited to be receiving her first Kiva loan through LAPO, where she is a member of a group called the Royal Mothers Group. Mary is married and has four children.

She started her business four years ago and reports that her major challenge has been insufficient capital to expand her business. She is therefore requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000. She will use this loan to buy shoes and groceries in bulk in order to get a better price. She sends a big thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy shoes and grocery items in bulk for sale

loans.name: Mame Dior

texts.fr:
-Madame Mame Dior L. est une femme âgée de 33 ans .C’est une habitante de Camberene, parente bénéficiaire, societaire de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC depuis janvier 2004 .Elle a déjà bénéficié d’un prêt antérieur qu’elle a rembourse correctement. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle exerce l’activité de commerce depuis plus de 5 ans et s’adonne à la vente de tissus et khartoume qu’elle fait souvent confectionner. Actuellement elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs pour augmenter son stock de tissus pour bien répondre a la demande de sa clientèle et diversifier son choix de tissus a offrir. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices lui permettra d’augmenter son fond de roulement pour mieux développer son activité.
Madame L. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit à des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires.  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs.
texts.en:
Madam Mame Dior L. is a 33 year old woman. She lives in Camberene, recipient parent, member of the U-IMCEC Fund since January 2004. She has already benefitted from a previous loan which she repaid. She is married and the mother of 2 children. She 's been in the trading business for more than 5 years and is devoted to the sale of fabrics and Khartoume which she often makes. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 150 000 frs to increase her stock of fabrics inorder to meet the the requests of her clientele and diversify her fabrics for sale. The increase in profits will enable her raise her working capital in order to grow her business. Madam L. is a beneficiary of a protocol arrangement between U-IMCEC and the Program for the Development of the Child and Family(PDCF), Seydina Issa Laye. PDCF tries to reduce poverty within the community and to protect especially children from destitute families. Thanks to this cooperation, parents of these destitute families can benefit from loans on more soft terms with regard to standard loans. Since the takeoff of this protocol arrangement in December 2008, 120 parents have received funding for amounts which varies between 50, 000 and 150, 000 frs.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increae in working capital

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert has owned an air conditioning shop since 1988. He’s a 37-year-old single man. He specializes in selling and repairing air conditioners. Today, Robert is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy new tools and additional spare parts in order to expand his business and make a good income.

loans.use: To buy new tools and additional spare parts

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Orcasitas II.
Nancy es casada, tiene 33 años y 3 hijos, Nancy junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales, sus ventas los realiza en el mismo lugar.
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago de los peones.
El sueño de Nancy es salir adelante.
texts.en:
Nancy, 33, is a member of the Orcasitas II communal bank. She is married and has three children. Together with her husband, Nancy manufactures bricks, which she sells from the same location. Nancy needs a 900 sol loan that she will use to pay her laborers. Nancy's dream is to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay her laborers.

loans.name: Mrs. Malis Phai Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has fourteen people who all live in Preak Traeng village in Kandal province. Each member will use the loan for a different purpose. Mrs. Malis P. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members.

Mrs. Malis P. is a fish breeder and her husband, Mr. Thy Orem, is a fisherman. This family has a problem because their fish are too small to sell, but they did not have enough money to support them. Thus, in order to improve their family’s living conditions, Mrs. Malis P. decided to ask for a loan to buy fish food for her fish.

Mrs. Malis P. is the mother of a child who is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fish food for her fish

loans.name: Lafia Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq  membres du groupe Lafia quatre femmes mariées et une veuve, ont  en moyenne  35 ans, 5 enfants et  vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kamalen Sirakoro, un des villages de la commune de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur douzième  prêt solidaire.  Tous les précédents prêts ont été  remboursés sans difficulté.
Elles font l’achat et la  vente  de tasses, de pomme de terre,  de tomates et de tissus.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 5 douzaines de tasses en plastique, 5sacs de 100kg de pomme de terre, 12 paniers de tomates fraiches et  une vingtaine de complet pour hommes et femmes en tissus. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Sikasso ville, dans les villages avoisinants et au Burkina faso. Elles vendent aux marchés de Kamalen Sirakoro, de façon ambulante  et à domicile, au comptant et  souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The five members of the Lafia group, four married women and a widow, are on the average 35 years old, have 5 children, and mostly live in polygamous marriages in Kamelen Sirakoro, a village in the Sikasso community, the 3rd administrative district in Mali. They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better satisfy their customers’ demands, and this would be their 12th joint loan. All previous loans have been repaid without any issues. They purchase and resell cups, potatoes, tomatoes and fabrics. With this new loan, they plan to purchase five dozens of plastic cups, five bags of potatoes (100 kg or about 220 lbs each), 12 baskets of fresh tomatoes and fabric for about 20 outfits for men and women. They purchase their supplies in the market of the town of Sikasso, in the villages nearby and in Burkina Faso. They sell their goods at the markets of Kamalen Sirakoro, on the street or in their homes, for cash and often on credit, to a customer base composed of both men and women. They plan to reach a medium monthly income of approximately 35,500 West African Francs for each member of the group; a part of that income would be used for their families’ needs and for savings, and the rest invested in the business.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing various articles for resale

loans.name: Muniran's Group

texts.en:
Anwari and Kaniz Fatima and Razia each want a loan to buy material (leather, glue and nails) for their shoe-making business.

Muniran is the group leader for the above-mentioned ladies. They all reside in a city named Arifwala, in Pakistan. Muniran's husband's name is M. R. and he runs a grocery shop in the community. He has been in this business for over 5 years. 

Muniran is a very hard-working lady. She makes thread rolls to order and earns income. She utilizes her income to pay the utilities. She is applying for a loan to buy groceries to diversify her husband’s grocery shop into a store.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Nandani

texts.en:
Nandani is a 27-year-old married woman living with her husband and baby son in Dangedara, Galle district of Sri Lanka.

Nandani manages retail businesses which involve general goods sales as well as vegetables.  Her husband and brother help to support her ventures as she sells vegetables at the local fair, or marketplace.  She has been doing this business for 15 years now, and she is known to be a very hard worker.

This is Nandani’s second loan with BRAC, and she is seeking 30,000 LKR from BRAC.  She settled her first loan without any repayment delinquencies or problems. She is hoping to give good education to her children and hopes to open a second retail shop quickly.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: to help build a shop for vegetable selling

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: LA SEÑORA MARIA DE LOS ANGELES ELLA ES PROFESORA Y ELLA ESTA PASNDO POR UNA SITUACION DE SALUD LO CUAL ELLA SOLICITO UN CREDITO DE 3,000 PARA COMPRA DE MEDICAMNETO YA QUE SU SALARIO LO LE JUSTABA. ELLA DICE QUE PRIMERO ES LA SAUD PERSONAL,
texts.en:
LA SEÑORA MARIA DE LOS ANGELES ELLA ES PROFESORA Y ELLA ESTA PASNDO POR UNA SITUACION DE SALUD LO CUAL ELLA SOLICITO UN CREDITO DE 3,000 PARA COMPRA DE MEDICAMNETO YA QUE SU SALARIO LO LE JUSTABA. ELLA DICE QUE PRIMERO ES LA SAUD PERSONAL,

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMPRA DE MEDICAMENTO

loans.name: Tajeu Ole

texts.en: Tajeu Ole has made a living as a wheat farmer for the last 10 years.  He is 37 years old, married to Margaret Thoo and has three children, all of whom are  in school. He was introduced to KADET by a friend and is applying for his first loan. He plans to use the money to buy pesticides and pay his workers. Tajeu also plans to buy his own tractor, which will help him a great deal when harvesting and planting.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and pay his employees

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El Señor Luis B. M. es casado desde hace varios años, y vive en su propia casa que está situada en el Barrio San Miguel distrito de Cambyreta. Tiene varios hijos pero ya todos independientes, quienes les ayudan económicamente.

El señor Luis se dedica a realizar servicios de Taxi desde hace varios años, el tiene su vehículo propio con el cual realiza su actividad. Además el trabaja como sereno de un Hotel. Mediante estas actividades que realiza el puede mantener su hogar y solventar los gastos que se le presenten. Algunos de sus hijos actualmente están trabajando en España, los cuales le ayudan enviándole dinero de forma mensual. 

El hoy día está solicitando el crédito para el mantenimiento de su vehículo ya que cada seis meses lo realiza para que siempre este en optimas condiciones.
texts.en:
Luis B. M. has been married for several years. He lives in his own house, which is located in the San Miguel neighborhood in the Cambyreta district. He has several children, but they are all independent. They help them economically. Luis has been providing taxi service for several years. He has his own vehicle to do this activity. He also works as a night watchman for a hotel. Through these activities he is able to support his household and pay the expenses they have. Some of his children are currently working in Spain. They help by sending him money on a monthly basis. He is now requesting a loan for maintenance on his vehicle. He does this every six months so that it is always in optimal condition.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance on his vehicle

loans.name: Mrs. Sokhom Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of 17 people wH. are villagers I. Ta Reap Doun Sar village I. Kandal province. Mrs. Sokhom C. is the village president, selected by the other members wH. will each use a small piece of the loan for a different purpose. She was born I. 1968 and her position is a vegetable seller at her local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. So to improve this business, Mrs. Sokhom C. is requesting a loan to buy more vegetables for resale. Her husband, Mr. Davy On, is a construction worker. She is a mother of three children all attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for resale

loans.name: Fanny Lorena

texts.es:
Fanny es una madre de familia de 45 años de edad que vive en el distrito de Ciudad Eten, una zona conocida a nivel regional por sus sombreros elaborados artesanalmente en base a juncos. Se encuentra ubicada a más de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Fanny es una mujer que ha trabajado incansablemente para sacar adelante a sus hijos, empezó vendiendo ropa a sus vecinos y con las ganancias de esta actividad fue instalando un pequeño negocio de venta de golosinas. Luego, con mucho esfuerzo ha ido instalando un negocio de cabinas de internet con el cual se genera actualmente una fuente estable de ingresos queutiliza en solventar los gastos familiares.

El negocio tiene muy buena acogida en la zona y sus principales clientes son los jóvenes y estudiantes de la zona que acuden a utilizar sus servicios. Actualmente Fanny ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en brindarle mantenimiento a sus equipos.

Fanny es una mujer responsable y trabajadora, en la zona se ha vuelto muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Fanny is a 45 year-old mother who lives in the Cuidad Eten district, an area known at the regional level for its hats that are handmade out of reeds. It is located half an hour from the city of Chiclayo. Fanny is a woman who has worked tirelessly to provide the best for her children. She started out selling clothing to her neighbors, and with the earnings from this activity she set up a small store selling sweets. Later, with a lot of effort, she established an internet cafe business which currently generates a stable source of income that she uses to cover the household expenses. The business is well accepted in the area, and its main customers are the youth and students in the area who come to use her services. Now Fanny has requested from Edpyme Alternativa a loan of 2,000 Peruvian soles that she will use to provide maintenance for her equipment. Fanny is a responsible and hardworking woman. She has become very well-known and respected by her neighbors. She has worked with our institution previously, and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to maintain the computers in her internet cafe

loans.name: Arco Iris ( Cuenca ) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Arco Iris esta formado por un grupo de 9 mujeres quienes  luchan  día a día en sus trabajos para mejorar la economía de sus hogares, viven en la comunidad de 3 Marías la misma que es reconocida por su producción en la agricultura, mucha de su población joven sale a la ciudad en busca de un mejor trabajo y también han migrado para buscar una mejor estabilidad económica para sus familias.

La Señora. Mariana vive en la comunidad de 3 Marías, es nuestra socia hace 4 años y  los créditos le han beneficiado en su negocio, el mismo que es la cría de pollos y cuyes, inicio este negocio cuando se caso y ha sido la manera de ayudar en la economía de su hogar, también se dedica a cultivar sus tierras, en donde siembra verduras que son para el consumo de su hogar y también las vende en su comunidad.

Nuestra socia tiene 53 años de edad, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 29, 27, 23, 21 y 19 años de edad, sus cuatro hijos son solteros, trabajan y ayudan a la economía de su hogar, solo su cuarto hijo es casado y vive independientemente, su esposo es jubilado y  gracia al trabajo conyugal han logrado tener su casa propia. Nuestra socia va ha invertir su nuevo préstamo en la  compra de alimento para sus pollos, su meta es  crecer  en su negocio.

La Señora. Lourdes  vive en la comunidad de 3 Marías, nuestras socia es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos quienes se encuentran de 17, 11 y 8 años de edad, su primer hijo está en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en la escuela, con el esfuerzo de su trabajo ha logrado construir su casa propia.

Nuestra socia trabaja en el bar de una escuela de la comunidad por 10 años, ahora se encuentra de vacaciones y esta muy ansiosa que retomen las clases los niños para volver al trabajo,  también se dedica a la cría de pollos y cuyes actividad de ha empezado hace un año y le va muy bien ya que hay mucha demanda.

La Señora. Lourdes se encuentra reingresando al banco comunal, ya que extrañaba a sus compañeras del bankito,  su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento, su meta es  seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
The community bank Arco is made up of a group of 9 women that work hard every day in their businesses, to improve the finances of the family. They live in the community 3 Marias, the same community that is well known for its agricultural products. Much of the young members of the population leave the city in search of better work and they also migrate to look for greater financial stability for their families. Mariana lives in the 3 Marias community. She has been a member of the community bank for the past 4 years and the loans have greatly benefitted her business. She raises chickens and guinea pigs. She started out the business when she married and it has been her way of contributin to the family's finances. She also cultivates the land, where she sows vegetables for their own use and for sale in the community. This member is 53 years old, she is married, and she has 5 children, aged: 29, 27, 23, 21 and 19 years old. Her four sons are all single and they all work. They contribute to the family's finances. Only their fourth child is married and lives independently. Her husband is retired and it was in working together that they are able to have their own home. The member will be investing her new loan in the purchase of chicken feed. Her goal is to make her business grow. Lourdes lives in the community of 3 Marias. She is a single mother of three children, aged 17, 11 and 8 years of age. Her eldest child is in college and the other two are schooled. With hard work and with the help of her business she has managed to build her own home. She has worked for the past 10 years in the community school cafetaria. She is currently on holidays but she is anxious to have the kids go back to school so that she can go back to work. She also raises chickens and guinea pigs. She started this out last year and it has been going well, as there is a great deal of demand. Lourdes has rejoined the community bank after having missed her colleagues. This loan will be invested in the purchase of chicken and their feed. Her goal is to keep her business growing.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Susy Eva

texts.es:
Susy de 23 años, Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales), ella vende productos químicos, como shampoo, desinfectante, etc. 

Empezó con los productos químicos hace años atrás, por el consejo de uno de sus amigos el cual le enseño a preparar productos químicos desde ese tiempo a continuado con el negocio de químicos que los dos habían empezado, trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 16h00pm todos los días. Ella hace shampoo, desinfectante, aromatizante, y los llena en envases plásticos. 

Ella quiere comprar con el préstamo mas químicos para hacer sus productos, en el futuro quiere tener su propia distribuidora de químicos y terminar de construir su casa
texts.en:
Susy is 23 years old and lives in Suburbio de Guayaquil (an urban area where most of the residents are informal merchants). She sells household chemical products such as shampoos, disinfectants, and other items.

She started her business several years ago after one of her friends taught her how to prepare the products. Since then she has continued the chemical business that the two of them started. Susy works from 8am to 4pm every day. She makes shampoos, disinfectants, and air fresheners and packages them in plastic containers.

Susy wants to use her loan to buy more chemicals for making her products. In the future, she wants to have her own distribution center and finish the construction of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase household chemicals

loans.name: Aganess

texts.en: Aganess L. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Aganess is 41 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. She has 6 children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a motor bike to transport charcoal to her home foe resale.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jessica Jahaira

texts.es:
Jessica de 28 años, vende ropa y cosméticos para poder solventar sus gastos, desde muy joven comenzó con la ayuda de su mama porque no tenia aun un ingreso fijo. Por ahora sigue viviendo con su familia, en una zona periurbana llamada “Perimetral” ya que aun no gana lo suficiente. 

Vende por catalogo ropa y maquillaje, en ocasiones va a recorrer las calles para encontrar clientes que le compren su mercaderia, pero el estilo de venta que ella tiene es venderles a sus amigas y vecinos. No tiene horario fijo para vender la mercadería porque sale a toda hora. 

Ella quiere continuar con sus ventas por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa y perfumes para tene mas variedad. Uno de sus sueños es termina de construir su casa y ya establecer un local para su negocio.
texts.en:
Jessica is 28 years old and sells clothing and cosmetics in order to pay her expenses. She started with the help of her mother, because she did not have a fixed income. For now, she continues to live with her family in a peri-urban zone called "Perimetral." She sells her clothing and makeup by catalog. Sometimes she goes out to find customers to buy them, but usually her sales style is to sell to her friends and neighbors. She does not have a fixed schedule for selling her merchandise because she goes out at all hours. She wants to keep up her sales, which is why she is requesting a loan to buy clothing and perfumes. One of her dreams is to finish building her house, and to establish a fixed location for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing and perfumes

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene, de 38 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive independientemente en la casa de su madre, junto a su esposo Andrés de 41 años, quien trabaja de obrero en una mina y sus 2 hijos, a quienes desea dar una buena educación. El arduo trabajo que Marlene realiza en sus chacras, ha hecho que sus cultivos sean muy productivos y abundantes. Sus productos, los lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde obtiene buenos precios por sus productos, ya que tiene clientes muy fieles, quienes le compran todo al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de la plaga de insectos que pueden afectar en la producción, lleva 26 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado, puesto que el transporte es muy escaso. Para más adelante, desea tener un puesto de ventas en el mercado mayorista, donde pueda vender ella misma sus cultivos. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y solidaria. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de gladiolo y de arveja, también comprará abono para sus chacras.
texts.en:
Marlene, 38, is a loving and hard working mother. She lives independently in her mother’s house with her husband, Andrés, 41, who works as a laborer in a mine, and her two children for whom she wants to provide a good education. The hard work Marlene puts into her fields has resulted in productive and abundant crops. She sells her products in Tarma’s wholesale market where she gets good prices for her goods because she has regular customers who buy everything at wholesale. What she likes best about her work is safeguarding her crops from insect infestations that can affect yields. She has been farming for 26 years and considers the most difficult part of it having to transport her products to market because transportation services are very scarce. For later on she’d like to have a sales stand in the wholesale market where she can sell her products herself. This is her 4th loan with MFP. She knows that she must make every installment payment on time and is willing to do so. She is a cheerful and mutually supportive member of her communal bank. She will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy gladiolus and pea seeds as well as manure for her fields

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pea and gladiolus seeds as well as sacks of manure.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa B. is from the village of Sagrada, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 55 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Celsa owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting, harvesting, and selling rice. She has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Celsa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be Celsa’s sixth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

location.town: Sagrada Familia, Tambulig, Zamboanga del sur

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
el sr. Guadalupe A. C. tiene 34 años de edad,  esta casado con la sra. Sandra Cristina Aguilar
con quien a procreado dos hijos, en su casa de habitacion tiene su pequeño taller en donde hace trabajos de balconeria, ademas tambien se dedica a la recolecion de botellas plasticas para reciclaje, producto que vende a clientes que lo compran para transformarlo en materia prima que se utiliza para fibra. 
 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de electrodos, hierro y pintura.

su meta en estos momentos es terminar los trabajos que tiene en una iglesia en donde el asiste.
texts.en:
Mr. Guadalupe Álvarez C., 34, is married to Mrs. Sandra Cristina Aguilar.  They have two children.   He has his small metal shop located in their home.  He makes iron railings but also collects plastic bottles to recycle.  He sells the plastic bottles to customers that buy it to use as raw material in fiber making.

He will use the loan to buy electrodes, iron and paint.

His present goal is to finish projects he has for the church he attends.

loans.use: To buy electrodes, iron and paint.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José Antonio R. F.  es una persona trabajadora que quiere ir mejorando su calidad de vida; es por ello que ha ido construyendo su vivienda poco a poco para ofrecer a su familia comodidad y un buen patrimonio para el futuro. El señor quiere terminar un baño que empezó hace tiempo y por otras cosas que se le han presentado no ha podido terminarlo; por eso es que pide el apoyo para terminar su proyecto ya que necesita pintar el baño y comprar accesorios.
texts.en:
José Antonio R. F. is a hardworking individual who wants to improve his quality of life. For this reason, he has gradually built a home to provide his family comfort and a valuable asset for their future inheritance.

José wants to finish a bathroom he started some time ago and other projects that have not been completed. For this reason, he is requesting assistance so that he can buy paint and accessories needed to complete this project.

loans.use: Purchase paint & accessories needed to complete a bathroom

loans.name: Agustina De Los Angeles

texts.es: Agustina De Los Ángeles tiene 25 años, su actividad es la venta de calzado. Hace más de 4 años, que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que ha sido difícil este continuar con este negocio, por los diferentes desafíos que ha enfrentado pero esto no la detiene a salir adelante es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora. Este negocio lo aprendió de su esposo ya que anteriormente él se dedicaba a vender de manera ambulante pero con el paso del tiempo consigue un trabajo y fue así como Agustina se hace cargo del negocio. Este crédito es para la compra de una gran variedad de calzado. Actualmente se acerca una muy buena temporada y desea aprovecharla.
texts.en:
Agustina De Los Ángeles is 25 years old.  She has worked for more than four years selling shoes.  It has been difficult to continue her business because of different challenges she has faced, but they haven't prevented her from getting ahead, because she is a very hardworking and enterprising person.  

She learned this business from her husband, who previously worked as a street vendor, but now has another job, and now Agustina takes care of the business.  

She is asking for this loan to purchase a variety of shoes.  A busy season is approaching, and she would like to take advantage of it.

loans.use: Purchase shoes

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LLANKACHINAPAC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Juan; el tiene 24 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1hijo; el socio tiene un negocio de venta de celulares de diferentes marcas como claro,movistar,nextel entre otros , el socio trabaja conjuntamente con su esposa en su casa ya que el   

El  socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de nuevos equipos de celulares.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan is a member of the Communal Bank “Llankachinapac”, which is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

He is 24 years old, in a common law marriage, and has one child. Juan has a business selling mobile phones of different brands such as Claro, Movistar, Nextel, and others. He and his wife work together from their home. Juan is requesting a loan to buy new mobile phone equipment.

He is grateful to those who have helped fulfill his dream and promises to complete his payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase new mobile phone equipment

loans.name: Beathe

texts.en: Beathe is 33 years old, married, and has three children, one of who attends school. Her husband works as a mason. Beathe sells a variety of items in her shop. She has been in this business for seven months. She is requesting a loan to buy clothes and she believes that the profits will be re-invested for the growth of her business. She hopes to have a big shop in the future.

loans.use: To purchase clothes

loans.name: Nurjamal's Group

texts.en:
Nurjamal A. is a resident of Kerben, a small town in the south of Kyrgyzstan.  She is the leader of this group. She is 39 and married to a driver. Together with her husband, they are bringing up two daughters, and both daughters are in school.  

Four years ago, with an initial investment of 5,000 soms, Nurjamal started to sell fruits and vegetables at the market. In this way she earns 7,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Nurjamal wants to purchase more fruits and vegetables in order to resell them at the higher price and make some profit.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Diana Anabel

texts.es:
La Señora. Diana C. es socia del banco comunal Medio Ejido, vive por el sector de Medio Ejido en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió y es reconocida por la belleza arquitectónica de su centro, su gente es muy amable y mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

Doña Diana se dedica a la venta de comida, actividad que desempeña hace 5 años, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde y también se dedica  a la elaboración de empanadas, tamales y dulces que realiza solo bajo pedido.

La Señora. Diana tiene 34 años, es casada y tiene  2 hijos  de 11 y 9 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en un colegio de la ciudad y su segundo hijo estudia en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer particular y también labora como arbitro, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace un año y le gusta  ya que tiene muy buenas amigas y han formado un grupo solidó y alegre,  el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres, ollas y más productos para su negocio. Su meta es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Diana C. is a member of the communal bank "Medio Ejido" and she lives in the Medio Ejido neighborhood of Cuenca.  This city has a cold climate and is known for the arquitectual beauty of its downtown. The people of Cuenca are nice and maintain their culture and traditions.  

Mrs. Diana has sold food for five years from 8 in the morning to 5 in the afternoon.  She also makes empanadas, tamales, and sweets on order.

Mrs. Diana is 34-years-old, married, and has two chiddren ages 11 and 9.  Her first child is in high school and her second child goes to the local grade school.  Her husband is a driver for private clients and also works as a referee; they don't have their own home, so they rent.  
 
She has only been a member of the communal bank for a year and she likes it becuasee she has made many friends and they have formed a solid and happy group.  She is going to invest the loan money in the purchase of supplies, pots, and other products for her business.  Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: To purchase supplies, pots, and other products for the business.

loans.name: Florina

texts.en:
Florina M. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 47 years old. Florina is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Florina owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & toothpaste in the local community. Florina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Florina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Florina is requesting a new loan of 21,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Florina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods

loans.name: Bibihaticha

texts.ru: Самадова Бибихатича проживает в Гиссарском районе. Возраст, 35 лет. Вдова, имеет троих детей. Образование - среднее. Работает на центральном рынке района. Арендует торговую точку, где продает рыбу. В этой области более 10 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Bibihaticha S. lives in the Gissar district.  She is 35 years old, a widow and has three children.  She has a secondary education and works at the district's central market.  Bibihaticha leases a retail stand, where she sells fish.  She has been in this business for over 10 years.  She is requesting this loan in order to increase product turnover.

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Cerenia

texts.en:
Cerenia lives in the village of Taguima, Tudela Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old, married and has one grown child. For the last two years, she has made a living by selling food to people who live in her community. She earns about PHP 4,000 a month from her work.

Cerenia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC and is applying for a new one, for 14,900 PHP, to continue improving and expanding her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To improve and expand a small food-selling business

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Chinchero, provincia de Urubamba, Departamento de Cusco.
 
La socia Elsa; tiene 43 años y es casada, ella tiene 4 hijos y aún dependen todos de ella, la socia es artesana de profesión y elabora bellos bordados, carteras, chompas de alpaca, ponchos, chullos, correas en lana con bordados de flores y otros, monederos, y mucho más, la socia pertenece a la asociación artesanal Virgen de las nieves, ella trabaja en este oficio desde hace más de 15 años, la socia realiza sus tejidos con óxidos naturles ella tiñe las lanas con plantas naturales de dan diversos colores. La socia desea implemetar su negocio y comprar materiales y también parte de este prestamo lo invertirá en los estudios de sus hijos para que pueda estar pagando las cuotas pocoa  poco con el producto de las ventas de la artesanía. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de materiales y de útiles escolares.

La socia agradece el prestamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir co el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Elsa belongs to the “Nueva Victoria (New Victory) – Chinchero” Communal Bank, located in Chinchero district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Elsa is 43 years old, married, and has 4 children, all of whom still depend on her.  She is an artisan by profession and makes beautiful embroidered purses, alpaca sweaters, ponchos, decorations, wool runners embroidered with flowers, and other things like coin purses, and much more.  She belongs to the Virgen de las Nieves (Virgin of the Snows) Artisan Association and has worked in their office for more than 15 years.  Elsa makes her textiles with natural dies and decorates wool cloth with natural plants of diverse colors.

Elsa wants to expand her business and buy materials and, also, part of this loan will be invested in her children's studies, paying fees little by little with the money she earns from sales of her artisan work. She is requesting the loan to buy materials and to pay school bills.

She appreciates the loan and promises to make her payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: TO BUY MATERIALS FOR EMBROIDERING ARTISAN TEXTILES AND TO PAY HER CHILDREN'S SCHOOL FEES

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita, who is 62 years old, is a married woman with ten children. Nelita said that she and her husband work hard to provide for their big family.

Nelita makes a living growing and selling rice. She and her husband, who are both farmers, till their land and prepare it well for planting. Nelita wishes to have better living conditions.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna A. is from the village of Dalirig, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 53 years old. Edna is separated her spouse and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Edna owns & operates a computer & videoke services to local community members. Edna has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Edna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Edna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide computer and videoke services. Edna is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the business. 

This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Edna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the computer and videoke business.

loans.name: Kamoliddin

texts.en: Kamoliddin is married with four children. He is a businessman from Kurgantyube. He offers car-repair services in his hometown. Kamoliddin launched this venture more than 20 years ago. He is an experienced technician who always tries to introduce newer equipment for a quality outcome of his work. His serious and responsible business approach has helped his business grow over many years. Kamoliddin is seeking a loan of $1,500 to purchase spare parts for the different vehicles he repairs in his workshop. A broader assortment of necessary parts will help Kamoliddin attract more customers to his venture; thus, increasing his monthly income. Kamoliddin is very serious about loan repayment. He has repaid previous loans without any delinquencies. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair vehicles.

loans.name: Mohamad
