texts.ar: محمد متزوج عمره 37 سنة اب لخمسة اولاد يعمل في بيع الهواتف النقالة وخطوط التعبئة وقطع الغيار له في عمله 4 سنوات يحب العمل هو اولى اهتماماته يريد ان يطور العمل وان يجدد حتى يتمكن من تحسين الوضع المادي والاجتماعي يريد ان يعتمد على نفسه في زيادة المدخول حتى يستطيع ان يؤمن لاولاده التعليم الجيد والعيش الكريم ماديا واجتماعيا هو رجل طموح محب للعمل يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة هواتف نقالة وخطوط تعبئة للهواتف النقالة وقطع غيار للصيانة يتميز بالذكاء في العمل والدقة والمثابرة على التطور والتجديد له زبائن يقصدونه من محيطه وجيرانه لكن بعض الصعوبات المادية هي التي تعيق تطور العمل وتأمن المنافسة المتوازنة مع غيره في محيطه العملي
texts.en: Mohamed is a 37-year-old married father of five children. He works in the business of selling mobile phones, mobile phone parts, and top-up cards and has been doing this for four years. He loves his work and it is one of his foremost priorities.  He would like to develop and rejuvenate his business so that he can improve his financial and social situation and be independent. He would also like to increase his income in order to be able to provide his children with a comfortable standard of living financially and socially, as well as give them the best education possible. He is an ambitious man who loves his work and with this loan he wants to buy new inventory. He is distinguished for his intelligence, precision and his perseverance in seeking development for his business. He has many loyal customers from his neighbours and local area, but lack of financial capital hinders his progress as well as some balanced competition from others in his local area.

loans.use: to purchase new mobile phones, mobile phone parts (for repair) and mobile. phone top-ups for his shop

loans.name: Daniel Bautista

texts.es:
Daniel de 43 años de edad, es soltero, tiene casa propia con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de San José a unos 15 minutos de la provincia de Chiclayo.   En la cual los pobladores desarrollan como actividad principal la pesca, comercialización de pescado y crianza de aves de corral.

Daniel se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado fresco en forma ambulatoria,  desde hace algunos años, su producto lo oferta por las calles de la ciudad de Chiclayo, ya que cuenta con clientela que le hace pedidos fijos.  La venta de sus productos le ayudan a cubrir sus necesidades  diarias.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para comprar más pescado fresco y a la  vez  pescado  salado, lo que le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos para poder pagar su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida.  La meta que se a propuesto Daniel es tener en un futuro un negocio que se dedique a la venta al por mayor de pescado a  empresas grandes (como mercados y supermercados) con esfuerzo y trabajo lo podrá lograr.
texts.en:
Daniel is 43 years old, single, and owns his own home which has water and electricity.  It is located in San José district, some 15 minutes from Chiclayo province.  The main business activities in this district are fishing, selling fish and raising poultry.

Daniel's business is buying and selling fresh fish as an itinerant vendor.  He has been in this business for some years.  He sells his products in the streets of the city of Chiclayo since he has customers who make regular orders with him.  The sale of his products helps him to cover his daily needs.

Daniel has requested a loan for 800 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can buy more fresh and salted fish which will allow him to increase his profits.  This will enable him to repay his loan and improve his quality of life.  Daniel's goal for the future is to own a business selling fish wholesale to large companies (such as markets and supermarkets).  With effort and hard work, he will be able to achieve this.

loans.use: to buy more fresh and salted fish

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 42 years old.  She is married and has 8 children, 4 of whom are in school.    Concepcion is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 8 years.  

Concepcion has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.  She has successfully repaid 13 previous loans in the past from NWTF, loans taken out to sustain her business.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rwenkuba  Bakyara Tukole Group, Rukungiri

texts.en: Ireen leads the Rwenkuba Bakyara Tukole group, Rukungiri. She is 56 years old, married and has four children, one of whom is still in school. For the last seven years, she has made a living by running a retail shop in the Katerera Trading Centre where she sells basic items such as sugar, salt, soap and cooking oil. Most of her customers live nearby. In a typical month, Ireen makes 200,000 UGX, which she has used to pay off a previous loan and expand her shop. She also runs a business on the side raising pigs and owns several rental properties, and all her work has allowed her to dramatically improve her life and her family's. She is determined to educate her children and increase her sales. She is applying for this loan to pay her child's school fees and restock her shop with goods.

loans.use: to pay school fees and restock a store.

loans.name: Ariuntuya

texts.en: Ariuntuya is 28 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Sansar Area, Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son who is 6 years old goes to a kindergarten while her husband manages a taxi service business. She conducts a hair salon at a rented apartment. She started her business in 2007 and gained much experience. Recently she bought a plot of land to build a house for her family. She is a polite woman who says, "I want to finish construction work of my house soon." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to increase her working capital and to buy  construction material for her house.

loans.use: To buy construction material for her house

loans.name: Magart

texts.en: Magart is married and has three children. She sells food items such as cassava, maize, canned tomatoes and onions at Kokoado near Elmina, which she has done for eight years. Her husband is a farmer. She supports him in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Magart will use the loan to purchase a sack of onions and canned tomatoes for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Magaret plans to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of onions and canned tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, vive junto a una nieta de 11 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace dos años aproximadamente, este oficio lo aprendió desde muy pequeña, pero hoy en dia lo realiza como un medio de subsistencia para ella y le permite también ayudar a su nieta.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz y leña, esta compra le ayudara a tener los materiales necesarios para preparar la venta de tortillas, el riesgo de este negocio es que el maíz suba de precio y no le permita generar ganancia.
Ella quiere mantenerse en el negocio, que a través de financiamientos pueda aumenta la producción y generar una mayor estabilidad para su nieta y que también pueda apoyarla para estudiar.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with her 11 year old granddaughter.  Rosa has been selling tortillas for approximately two years.  She learned this trade when she was very little.  However, now she does it as the means to her livelihood.  It also allows her to help her granddaughter.

She is requesting a loan to buy corn and firewood.  This purchase will help her to have the necessary materials to make and sell tortillas.  The risk in this business is that the price of corn goes up, and it does not allow her to generate income.  She wants to stay in the business.  With the loan she is able to increase production and generate greater stability for her granddaughter.  She will also be able to support her education.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood for her business of making tortillas.

loans.name: Johana De Jesus

texts.es: Johanna De Jesus tiene su negocioq que es ofrecer el servicio de nintendos. hace mas de 6 años que tiene esta actividad, la ubicacion de su local es frente al paque en donde llegan una gran parte de niños, que son quienes mas visitan su negocio. ella es una joven muy resposanble pues tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo de 18,14 y 9 años respectivamente. el credito que solicita es para la compra de cables, consolas, discos y nuevos juegos.
texts.en: Johanna De Jesús’s business is providing Nintendo games services.  She’s been in business over 6 years.  Her business is located across from the park where a great number of children come to play; they are the ones that most visit her business.  She is a very responsible young woman because she has three minors who are 18, 14 and 9 years of age in her care.  The loan she’s requesting is to buy cables, consoles, discs and new games.

loans.use: to buy cables, consoles, discs and new games.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy varnish and wood for his furniture business.

loans.name: Khoren

texts.en: Khoren is engaged in the agricultural business. He lives with his wife and two sons, one of whom is presently in the army. Agriculture is the family's main source of income, but it is barely enough to make ends meet. Khoren would like to obtain more livestock and develop his agricultural business. With the requested loan, he plans to purchase livestock. Khoren will expand his business and increase his income, ensuring a better future for his family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials for making improvements to her kitchen.

loans.name: Anne Marie

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme qui a perdu son mari depuis sept ans.Elle vit seule avec ses 9 enfants dont 3 sont à l'école.Elle vend des tissus et des compléments alimentaires.Elle fait également de l'aviculture.Elle est assistante villageoise et appuie les femmes qui font des activités génératrices de revenus.Elle sollicite un pret de 500000F pour acheter des tissus "thioub", du vax, de la crépe soie, du basin qu'elle revendra à l'occasion de la fete de la Tabaski.Elle ambitionne de se lancer plus tard dans l'importation de produits vestimentaires.
texts.en:
Anne Marie was widowed 7 years ago and lives together with her 9 children, 3 of whom attend school. She sells fabrics and food supplements and is also a poultry farmer. She is her village´s "assistante villageoise" - a position traditionally held by a woman trained to function as a support for women's advancement groups - and helps the other businesswomen of her village.

Anne Marie is requesting a 500 000 franc loan so that she can buy fabrics including "thioub" (dyed indigo fabric), "vax", crimped silk and "basin" (African brocade) which she will resell to customers preparing for the festival of Tabaski. In the future, she would like to become an importer of clothes.

loans.use: to buy fabrics including "thioub", "vax", crimped silk and "basin".

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 34-year-old Lebanese man. He lives with his wife and three children who are still attending school. He has been working as a blacksmith since 2008. He has more than nine years of experience working in the same field. His work is specialized in home manufacturing. Today, Ahmad is requesting to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renew his business tools. In the future, he plans to open his own manufacturing business.

loans.use: to renew his business tools.

loans.name: Carmelino

texts.es: Carmelino, tiene la edad  de 21 años, está soltero y vive con sus padres y hermanos actualmente. El con el crédito va comprar lechones para su desarrollo y se su engorde posterior. El cuenta con los locales donde desarrollara la actividad de buena manera. El quiere implementar su proyecto de nuevo y poder desarrollar sus cerdos de buena manera para su posterior venta y complacencia a su clientes con la calidad vendida. El quiere generar o tiene como su meta prioritaria aumentar las ganancias de la venta de sus cerdos y así a su vez ayudarles a sus padres con las responsabilidades del hogar. El espera poder cambiar su nivel económico de vida y su bienestar familiar para un futuro de mayor prosperidad. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Carmelino is 21 years old. He is single and lives with his parents and siblings at this time. With the loan he is going to buy piglets to later develop and fatten up. He has the space to do the activity well. He is going to do the project again and develop his pigs well so that he can sell them later and please his customers with their quality. He wants to generate income and his main priority is increasing his earnings by selling pigs so he can help his parents with the household expenses. He hopes to change his financial situation and his family's wellbeing for a more prosperous future. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He hasn't had loans before from government banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered the loan with ease of payment and much lower interests.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten up.

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor has been managing his corn field for ten years. He is a responsible husband and father to his three children. His family is currently living within the village of Pinto Alfonso Lista, Ifugao. 

He is determined person since farming is the main source of their income. Nestor is aiming to improve their living status and educate all his three children. Through planting of additional crops, he hopes to increase his profit. 

Nestor doesn't have enough capital. That's the reason why he would like to borrow additional capital amounting to PHP 12,000, which will be used in buying farm supplies needed to improve his corn field. 

Nestor says that through this additional capital he can make his farming business more productive and give his family a better future.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies needed to improve his farming business.

loans.name: Njete Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from the Njete SHG Group in Western Kenya! Metrine is the facilitator of the Njete SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Metrine takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to have access to fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and because of one acre fund's new technology in planting. In the recent 2011 season, Metrine had a good maize yield harvesting 15 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Metrine was only able to harvest three bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Metrine and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Metrine will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing. 

Metrine is pictured in the photo with her group members; standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Felipa Manuela

texts.es:
La señora Felipa Manuela es casada, tiene 53 años de edad, estudio la educación primaria, tiene 8 hijos de los cuales 2 estudian, se dedica a costuras delantales y cortes típicos, aprendió este oficio siendo operaria, hasta ahora lleva 30 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien la apoya económicamente.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de telas típicas e hilos de diferente colores y clases, como también la compra de adornos para los delantales que ella costura. espera en el futuro  contar con mas capital.
texts.en: Felipa Manuela is married, 53 and studied up to primary school.  She has 8 children, 2 of whom are students.  She sews aprons and typical garments, operating a sewing machine, and has 30 years of experience.  Her husband helps her economically.  She seeks this loan to buy cloth and thread of different types and colors, as well as adornments for the aprons that she sews.  She hopes to grow her business capital in the future.

loans.use: to buy thread for sewing

loans.name: Kalikwa Group

texts.en:
Electine is the facilitator of the Kalikwa group. Electine and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Electine and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Electine joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Electine had a very good maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Electine was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Electine will invest in livestock rearing and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Kalikwa group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Electine with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Marebel

texts.en:
Marebel is married with 4 children. She is 36 years old and lives in Mangidkid, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.

Marebel has a general store to earn a living and has had this business for 1 year. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase products such as shampoo, sardines, noodles, sugar and salt.

Marebel has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.  In the future, Marebel hope to succeed in her new business.

loans.use: To purchase assorted products such as shampoo, sardines, noodles, sugar and salt

loans.name: Aboudou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Aboudou est un homme marié de 52 et père de 6 enfants qui réside avec sa femme et ses enfants à Zantièbougou, village situé à 30 kilomètre de Bougouni.
Il a fréquenté l’école coranique pendant des années puis il abandonne au profit des activités génératrices de revenus.
Il avait tenté plusieurs activités notamment la vente de chaussures et tissus, mais sans réussite. Alors il décida  de rapprocher son oncle pour apprendre la vente de céréales.
Avec une expérience de plus de 20 années, il maîtrise son activité.
Afin d’agrandir son entreprise, il décida de collaborer  avec Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui il est à son quatrième prêt après avoir correctement remboursé les trois précédents. Il compte ce nouveau prêt pour acheter, 1 tonne de maïs, 1 tonne de petit mil et 1 tonne de riz.
Il s’approvisionne à Zantièbougou et dans les villages  environnants.
La vente se fait a Zantièbougou mais aussi au grand marché de Bougouni et dans les différentes villages les jours de marché hebdomadaire.
Avec ce prêt il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et subvenir aux dépenses de la famille. Il envisage agrandir son entreprise..
texts.en:
Mr. Aboudou is a married man, 52 years of age, and the father of six, living with his wife and children in Zantièbougou, a village 30 km from Bougoni.

He used to go to a  Qur'anic school for some time, but later he dropped out in order to make a living.

He has tried several business activities, such as selling shoes and cloth, but without success. And so he decided to ask his uncle to train him in selling cereals. Now, with over 20 years of experience, he masters his work well. In order to expand his business, he decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso, and is now on his fourth loan, having properly repaid the prior three. He plans to use this new loan to buy one ton [about 2205 lbs] of corn, one ton of millet and one ton of rice.

He stocks up in Zantièbougou and nearby villages. He sells in Zantièbougou and also at the big market of Bougoni and at weekly markets in various villages. With this loan, he plans to achieve a monthly income of 40,000 West African Francs, which will be used to repay the loan and cover family expenses. He plans to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Nery Liduvina

texts.en:
My name is Nery H., and I produce and sell tortillas. I have had my business for 5 years, and I have the help of my daughters to sell them. I have loyal customers, who are mostly people in my neighborhood. My business generates an income that supports my family. My goal is to expand my inventory in order to increase sales and with the profits, I can remodel my home( business) and give a better education to my daughters.

Loan Use: Purchase cornflour, lime, salt, water, firewood, lights.

Mi nombre es Nery H., me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tengo mi negocio hace 5 años, en el cual tengo el apoyo de mis hijas que me ayudan a venderlas, tengo mis clientes fijos, ya que son los vecinos de mi colonia, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia. Mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para poder vender mas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi casa (negocio) y darles un mejor estudio a mis hijas.

loans.use: Compra de harina de maiz, cal, sal, agua, leña, fosforos

loans.name: Teuila

texts.en: Teuila, 39, married, specializes in producing and harvesting peanuts to sell to local businesses and local people. The business is successful, as families living in New Zealand or Australia usually take peanuts overseas. She sells her produce at the market, already packed, for a reasonable price. She also delivers so because of this she gets to more businesses than having the buyers come to her.

loans.use: To purchase peanut seeds, organic fertilizers, pesticides and additional farm implements

loans.name: Natavan

texts.en: Natavan B. owns and operates a salon in the town of Devechi, located on the North East coast of Azerbaijan. Natavan is looking for funding so that she can modernize her salon by purchasing new and better equipment.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment for her salon

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok S. is 53 years old and works as a seamstress in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. This job gives her a daily income of a little over $1. Her husband is a carpenter and a construction foreman. Their two children have already started their own families.

Mrs. Sok S. would like this loan so that she and her husband can build a house to rent out. They are confident that this will give them additional monthly income. Mrs. Sok S. also hopes to use their rental income to start a small tailoring shop of her own.

loans.use: To build a house for renting out

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Savy married in 2005 and has one son. He learned to weave silk from his sister and started his silk production business in 2006. In addition to his regular silk production, he also plants rice during the season. He was unfortunately never able to finish primary school.

Savy has already taken out and repaid three loans from MAXIMA. He is currently asking for a loan in the amount of US$ 400. He will use this loan to purchase silk material and sewing thread and pay for selecting and preparing thread on the loom.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials, sewing thread, and paying for selecting and preparing thread on the loom

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is 26 years old, and lives in Baalbeck, Bekaa with his family. Mohamad is a car electrician, and the inhabitants of the town fix their cars at his shop. For more efficiency and productivity, Mohamad would like to purchase new and more adapted materials for his business. He would like a loan of $1200 to purchase the required tools. Mohamad needs to keep up with the local competition in order to sustain and further develop his own business. Mohamad has already borrowed three times, and has a very good history of timely repayment.

loans.use: Buy material for fixing cars

loans.name: Behruz Group

texts.ru:
Ahmad A. is the leader of the group. He was born in 1974, is married and has a child. He has been working on the market for the past 6 years. This is his main occupation and for this reason he transports the goods himself. Uguloi sells groceries and other household items. She is married and has 4 children. Another member of the group is "Behruz", Mahroma. She sells groceries as well. She has 4 children and is forced to sell coals in order to supplement her family income. She has been working on the market for the past 5 years. Zilola sells candies. She is married and has a child. She used to sell many different small items, but currently is specializing in candy. Momokiz is another member of the group. She sells small items. She is just starting her business. She has been working on the market for a year now. She has three children.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Ахмад Ашурматов является лидером группы. Он 1974 года рождения, женат имеет одного ребенка. На рынке торгует уже 6 лет. Это его основная его деятельность, поэтому, он сам привозит товар. Улугой также торгует продуктами питания , кроме того она продает промышленные товары. Она замужем, имеет 4 детей. Еще один член группы "Бехруз", Махрома. Она также продает продукты питания. Мать 4-х детей, дополнительно что бы поркармить семью она вынуждена продавать уголь. На рынке 5 лет. Зилола торгует конфетами. Замужем имеет одного ребенка. Раньше Зилола торгавала различные мелкие товарами. Сейчас конфеты ее основной бизнес. Момокиз также член этой группы. Она торгует мелочью. Она только начинает развивать свой бизнес. На рынке 1 год. Мать троих детей.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of food products

loans.name: Amanda Del Socorro

texts.es:
Amanda S. is a hard working woman, single mother to two children.

She sells household electronics in Chinandega city, selling televisions, sound systems, dvd, etc. Her work begins very early in the morning in the Chinandega market and finishes at sundown when there are no more customers in the locale.

Amanda is aware that it is necessary to invest in her business, and she decided to affiliate herself with Ceprodel which has supported her with loans to invest in her business. Today she is very satisfied and grateful for the support that Ceprodel has provided, for having bettered her business by increasing her inventory. Her wish is to become the best household electronics vendor in the Chinandega market.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Amanda S. es una mujer muy trabajadora, madre soltera con dos hijos a su cargo donde ella es madre y padre a la vez.

Se dedica a la comercialización de electrodomésticos en la ciudad de Chinandega vendiendo televisores, equipos de sonido, dvd, etc. Su labor inicia desde muy temprano por la mañana en el sector de los electrodomésticos en el mercado de Chinandega y termina hasta que oscurece el día cuando ya no hay compradores en el local.

La señora Amanda al estar consiente de que es necesario invertir en su negocio, decide afiliarse a Ceprodel el cual la ha apoyado con créditos que los ha invertido en su negocio. Hoy en día se encuentra muy satisfecha y agradecida del apoyo que le ha brindado Ceprodel, por haber mejorado su negocio el cual ha incrementado sus artículos y son sus deseos convertirse en la mejor comerciante de electrodomésticos en el mercado de Chinandega.

loans.use: Purchase household electronics

loans.name: Kuvvat

texts.ru:
Kuvvat A. is 56 years old and has a college degree in education. He is married and has six children. Kuvvat currently works as a teacher in the local school in the Yavan region. To supplement his salary he has also been raising cattle for sale for the last 15 years. Kuvvat is planning to use the loan to purchase cattle for fattening. Every 40-45 days he will sell the animals and purchase new calves. He will use the income from the animal sales to support his large family, since the salary of a teacher is not always enough. Kuvvat is planning to pay back the loan in the next 18 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Адинаев Кувват, возраст – 56 лет, образование – высшее, по специальности педагог, женат, имеет 6-х детей. Куват в настоящее время работает в средней школе Яванского района. Помимо этого он также занимается разведением крупного роагтого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 15 лет. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать на приобретение крупного рогатого скота. Через каждые 40-45 дней после откормки он будет покупать откормленный скот и приобретать вдругой. Прибыль он будет использовать на содержание семьи, так как не всегда заработная плата преподавателя хватает. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 18 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase and sale of cattle

loans.name: Pin

texts.en:
Mrs. Pin A. is a widow with four children who stays at home looking after the house and cooking food for her family members.

After her housework, she takes time to braid cotton scarves, which normally earns her around $1 a day in profit.

Two of her daughters work in the factory and earn $4 a day. Another one sells sugarcane juice in front of the factory and typically makes $5 of income.

Now Mrs. Pin A. is looking for a loan from Kiva for about $900 to purchase a motorbike and a machine (this machine people use to squeeze sugarcane in order to extract the juice) to help cover the living expenses.

loans.use: She will use this loan to purchase a motorbike and a machine to squeeze sugarcane.

loans.name: Sili 2 Centre - Group 3

texts.en:
For these 10 women of Sili 2 on the island of Savaii, these are their first loans from SPBD. They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business, maintaining a savings account and then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and to guarantee on-time payments.

Faanimo Tuua (43, married, 5 children) for puletasi (dress) and t-shirt business: sewing machine, thread and material.

Loketi A. (45, married, 4 children) for fish and chips business: a stove, a fryer, oil, a sack of potatoes, 2 pots and tongs.

The following women will use their loans to purchase the below items for their taro plantations:

Leu F. (56, married, 4 children): 10 laborers, 4 knives, 2 knife filings, 3,000 taro roots and pesticides.

Paepae M. (28, married, 4 children): 2 knives, filing, wheel barrow, spade, axe and 1,000 taro roots.

Pelepesite Tafu (45, married, 8 children): knife, filing, 2,500 taro roots and laborers.

Siaana Tsang Y. (29, married, 3 children): 3 bush knives, 3 filings, 3 laborers, 3,000 taro roots, wire and a spade.

Lufi Leuelu F. (43, married, 5 children): 5 bush knives, 5 filings, 5 workers, 2,000 taro roots and a spade.

Tufaina F. (45, married, 6 children):2 knives, an axe, a filing, a spade, weed killing sprayer and 7 workers. She also produces bananas.

Matavai T. (44, married, 5 children): 2 bush knives, 2 filings, a spade, an axe, 5 workers and 3,000 taro roots.

Foloi F. (36, married, 3 children): 4 knives, 4 filings, 4 spades, 6 workers, 2 boots, 1,500 taro roots.

loans.use: Purchase knives, laborers, filings, taro roots, etc.

loans.name: Mwanahamis

texts.en:
Mwanahamis is 30 years old and is a married woman with 1 child, age 2 years old. Mwanahamis sells maize. Every day, she works from 9am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more maize for her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize for her business.

loans.name: Carmen's Group

texts.en:
Six months ago, the committee “Santo domingo” was formed. Some of the original founding members still belong to the committee and they are now very proud to be in the second cycle. The group receives financial assistance and has saved 750.800 guaranies so far.

The ladies of the committee are involved in different type of business such as running grocery stores, sales of clothing, chicken, fruits, honey, bijouterie (trinkets and ornaments) and lingerie among others. The money provided by this Kiva loan will be used to purchase merchandise in some members' cases and raw materials in others.

These ladies have one important thing in common: they all want to bring benefits to their families by working very hard and generating income. They all want to give their sons the opportunity to go to school or college.

loans.use:
To buy

(i) ingredients to cook traditional Paraguayan meals

(ii) fruits such as oranges, bananas, pineapples, apples, pears

(iii) cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Prum

texts.en: Prum S., 29, lives in the Prey Veng province with her husband, Nut Piseth, and their two children. She is a teacher making US$1.60 each day, while her husband is a farmer. Her husband owns a small tractor and frequently rents it out to earn an extra profit. The family has asked for a loan of US$500 to purchase gas to fill up the tractor’s tank. This investment will allow the family to rent out the tractor to many new customers and increase their income. This has been a difficult year for farmers in Cambodia because weather patterns have been inconsistent and inflation has been high, therefore Prum S. and her family have lacked capital to increase their business.

loans.use: Purchase gas for a tractor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve her pig raising business

loans.name: Jesus Del Pilar

texts.es:
Jesús is a member of the Mujeres Productivas (Productive Women) Communal Bank, situated in AA.HH Héroes del Cenepa Mz.D Lt. 6, in the Calleria District of Ucayali. She is 29 years of age, and is the mother of three children. Her husband is a laborer. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of S/. 300, she decided to invest in the sale of food. Jesús currently sells sodas and frozen treats.

With this loan of S/. 1.000, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase 3 cases of small sodas, 2 cases of large sodas and ingredients to prepare her frozen treats.

Jesús is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for the opportunity of offering a loan for her business, and as such, she is very happy because she can help with her household’s expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Jesús, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Productivas, ubicado en AA. HH Héroes del Cenepa Mz.D Lt. 6, del Distrito de Calleria, del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 29 años es madre de 3 hijos y su esposo es obrero. Blanca con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en la venta de comida.

Jesús, en la actualidad cuenta con venta de gaseosa y chupetes.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1.000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 3 cajas de gaseosa chica, 2 paquetes de Gaseosa grande y ingrediente para que prepare su chupetes.

Jesus, esta muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por la oportunidad de brindarle un crédito para su negocio y de tal manera se siente muy contenta porque apoya en los gastos que tiene en su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase sodas of several sizes and ingredients to prepare frozen treats.

loans.name: Mirela

texts.en: Mirela M. was born in 1981. She comes from the little city of Gračanica, which is known as agricultural area. She is married and the mother of one son. Her husband works in a local company and he earn 700 KM. Mirela has a small orchard which produces apples and pears. She sells her products to small local shops and sometimes in the marketplace. Mirela needs some place to store her products and she will use a loan in the amount of 600 KM to build it. Her aspiration is to rent one orchard to sow and that way produce and sell more.

loans.use: To build a place to store products

loans.name: Juana Soledad

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro en quechua. Juana es casada, tiene 50 años y 7 hijos, Juana se dedica confección de ropa típica, tiene un taller de confección de prendas de vestir ubicado en su casa, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo e hijos, sus ventas lo realiza en el mercado de la ciudad de Ayacucho y también en su misma casa.

Juana necesita un préstamo de 1800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas, hilos. Los sueños de Juana son que todos sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean profesionales, tener otro negocio y su familia sea feliz.
texts.en:
Juana is a partner in the Ccori Ayllu Communal Bank, whose name means “Family of Gold” in Quetchua. Juana is 50 years old and married, with 7 children. She sews traditional clothing in her workshop, located in her home. She manages her business with help from her husband and children, and sells her products in the Ayacucho markets and in her home. Juana needs a loan of 1800 soles, which she’ll invest in fabrics and thread. Juana dreams of her children finishing their studies and becoming professionals, of having another business and of her family being happy.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Juana needs a loan of 1800 soles, which she'll use to invest in fabric and thread.

loans.name: Giegbefu

texts.en: Giegbefu A. is 28 years old and married without children. He sells bags of cement to build houses. His shop is strategically located in a busy area in Benin City, which has boosted his business. He is requesting a loan of N50,000 ($425) to purchase more bags of cement to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders and LAPO.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of cement to sell

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es: Lorenza tiene 28 años, vive con sus 4 hijos y su madre. Trabaja elaborando diversas mantas textiles que realiza desde 7 años, junto a su madre, quien la ayuda en la confección y a venderlos en los centros mineros de  la región. A Lorenza le agrada elaborar diversos tipos de mantas de colores, porque  ahí puede usar su creatividad, darle color y sentido a su trabajo, además estas  mantas son muy solicitadas en la sierra del Perú, ya que gracias a que son abrigadoras, la gente las compra para cubrirse en sus noches de frío. Aunque el confeccionarlos es muy tedioso, por el proceso de hilar el tipo de lana que le mandan los ganaderos. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, y hasta la fecha no tuvo problemas de pago. Con le dinero solicitado invertirá en la compra de mayor cantidad de lana de carneros para luego hilarla y fabricar mayor cantidad de mantas.
texts.en:
Lorenza is 28 and lives with her four children and her mother. For seven years she has made a variety of blankets. Her mother helps her weave the blankets and sell them in the region's mining communities. Lorenza really enjoys making many styles of colorful blankets, because she can use her creativity and add her personal style to her work. Her blankets are very sought-after in the Peruvian highlands, where people buy them to use as ponchos on cold nights. The process of making the blankets is very tedious due to the kind of wool that is available for her to make into yarn.

This is Lorenza's third loan from Kiva's partner MFP, and she has not had any problems with repayment. She will invest this loan in the purchase of more wool to be able to weave more blankets.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more wool

loans.name: Chandy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chandy S. is a farmer in Prey Chum village in Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. She is 23 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school while the younger one is only five years old.  Her husband, Mr. Mao Phon, is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm sugar and wine. Although they have different businesses, they still cannot support their family well. 

They now are building a house, but unfortunately they have insufficient money to build the staircase. In order to achieve their purpose, Mrs. Chandy S. decided to ask for a loan to build the staircase.

loans.use: To build the staircase for a new house.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
El Banco Virgen del Carmen inicia su 17 ciclo con  19 socias, las socias son del distrito D. Pacaycasa que se ubica a 30 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como fabricación D. ladrillos, ventas D. animales, abarrotes en general, frutas, cochinilla, tuna, tara y cosméticos. 

Como es el caso D. Zosima es casada, tiene 39 años y 2 hijos, Zosima junto a su esposo compran y venden ganados que compran en las diferentes ferias y pueblos, luego los comercializan en la feria D. San Juan, Zosima necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en al compra D. ovejas. 

Por otro lado Petronila es casada, tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, Petronila junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación D. ladrillos artesanales, sus ventas los realiza en la misma comunidad. Además Petronila en época D. producción D. Tuna lleva esta fruta a la ciudad D. Lima.

Mientras que Francisca es casada, tiene 60 años y 7 hijos, Francisca viaja  a los diferentes pueblos en donD. compra cuy, gallina que luego comercializa en los restaurantes. Además Francisca cosecha tara que venD. a intermediarios.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, 1000 soles haciendo un total D. 13,250 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. oveja, arena, cuy, gallina, azucar, arroz, fideos, animales menores, tara, tuna y pago D. peones.

Los sueños D. las socias son tener capital propio, brindar una buena educación alimentación a sus hijos, sacar adelante su negocios y vivir bien con su familia.
texts.en:
The bank Virgen del Carmen begins its 17th cycle with 19 members. The associates are from the district of Pacaycasa, located 30 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. The members have different businesses such as the production of bricks, animal sales, general groceries, fruit, cochineal insects, Tuna (a form of cactus), tara powder and cosmetics. In the case of Zosima; she is 39 years old, married and has 2 children. Zosima and her husband buy and sell livestock, they buy it in the various fairs and towns and then sell in the San Juan fair. Zosima needs a loan of 600 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of sheep. On the other hand, Petronila is 38 years old, married and has 3 children. Petronila and her husband make a living manufacturing handcrafted bricks, and sell them in their community. Additionally, Petronila during Tuna cactus season, takes this fruit to the city of Lima. In the meantime Francisca is 60 years old, married with 7 children. Francisca travels to the different towns where she buys guinea pigs and chickens that she later sells to restaurants. Also, Francisca grows tara, which she sell to intermediaries. The partners need different loan amounts such as 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles 1000 soles, totaling to a loan of 13,250 soles in the Community Bank. Their loan proceeds will be invested in the purchase of sheep, sand, guinea pigs, chickens, sugar, rice, noodles, small animals, tara, tuna and pay to the workers. The dreams of the members are to have their own capital, proviD. a good education and good nutrition for their children, grow their businesses and live well with their families.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of sheep, sand, guinea pigs, chickens, sugar, rice, noodles, small animals, tara, tuna and pay for the workers.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en: Evans O. sells poultry fowls at Ntabetil near Abura. Evans has received junior high level education.  He is married and has 2 children. His wife is a trader. He buys the day-old chicks and rears them until they mature for consumption and then sells them. He has been doing this business for about 3 years now. He is responsible for paying rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. His loan will be used as additional capital to enable him to increase the sale of fowls to meet the increase in demand by his costumers. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest back for the expansion of his trade.

loans.use: His loan will be used as additional capital to enable him to increase the sale of fowls to meet the increase in demand by his costumers.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Mrs. Tessie C., 40 years old, married, lives at Lower Langcangan, Oroquieta City. She has 3 children. Her husband started the idea of mango production many years back.  They also have an existing business of selling fresh farm eggs but due to financial problems, Mrs. C. joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to access their loan facility. She has  received loans several times already. Now, she is applying for PHP 10,000 to buy pesticide and fertilizer to revive their mango production. She has many plans for the future. She dreams that one day she will be the one to supply mangoes to Oroquieta City.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and fertilizer for mango production

loans.name: Sindjiya Group

texts.fr:
Composé de cinq femmes, les membres du groupe Sindjiya de l’association Dabawara sont tous mariées et ont une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et de 5 enfants. Elles vivent en majorité dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles  dans le village de TINGOLE, sous préfecture de FANA, dans la préfecture de DIOÏLA région de KOULIKORO république du Mali. 
A travers des relations voisinage et de commerce, elles se sont connues et font le commerce de céréales. 
Dans l’objectif de renforcer leurs activités elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles  sont à leur septième prêt de groupe dont quatre prêts agricoles. Les précèdent prêts ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter 1,5 tonnes de maïs, 900 kg de sorgho et 400 kg de haricot. Les produits seront achetés auprès des producteurs de TINGOLE et ces villages environnants pour être revendus en détail et au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles  envisagent d’obtenir  chacune avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de  8 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé dans d’autres activités génératrices de revenues.
texts.en:
The Sindjiya group is composed of five married women, who average 34 years of age and 5 children. Most of them live in traditional conjugal families in TINGOLE, a village in the FANA subprefecture (DIOÏLA prefecture, region of KOULIKORO, Republic of Mali). They sell cereals, and got acquainted through bonds of neighborhood and business. In view of bolstering their businesses, they decided to join Kiva's partner, the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their seventh solidarity loan. The previous loans included four agricultural loans, and were all repaid without problems.

With this loan, they intend to buy 1.5 ton of corn, 900 kg of sorghum, and 400 kg of beans. The products will be bought from producers in TINGOLE and in the surrounding villages, to be retailed for cash, to a clientele comprising both men and women. They foresee turning a monthly profit of XOF 8'000 (ca US$ 16) each, to be invested in other money-making businesses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 1.5 ton of corn, 900 kg of sorghum, and 400 kg of beans

loans.name: Mairam

texts.ru: Азизова Майрам проживаетв городе Яван. Возраст  31 год, замужем и имеет четверых детей. Муж работает дехканином и занимается земледелием, а она в свою очередь занимается животноводстовм. Обратлась к нам за кредитом . для того, чтобы купить молодую дойную корову. Это поможет ей получать молоко . и использовать его для своих детей. Кроме того, если будет лишнее молоко она сможет его продавать соседям . И таким образом зарабатывать деньги.Это улучшит семейное , финансовое положение.
texts.en:
Mairam A. lives in the town of Yavan. She is 31 years old, married and has four children. Her husband works as a supervisor and is in agriculture and also does animal husbandry. She has come to us for a loan so that he can buy a young milk cow. This will help her get milk and provide it to her children. Besides she can always sell the extra milk to the neighbors. This way she will be making money. It improves their family financial situation.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Ricardo Paulo's Group

texts.pt:
Ricardo Paulo M. é natural de Namaacha um distrito fronteiriço com Suazilândia, tem 24 anos de idade, casado maritalmente e pai de um filho com 4 anos de idade. 

Ricardo estudou até 5ªclase e parou por falta de condições, em 1999 mudou se do distrito de Namaacha para Boane na companhia da família. A 2 anos que gere um negocio próprio que consiste na compra e venda de produtos diversos com destaque aos refrigerantes. Deste negócio consegue um rendimento semanal de 1800,00mt.

Para Ricardo este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva, tendo conhecido Hluvuku através da sua irmã que já é cliente a bastante tempo, com empréstimo pretende aumentar o seu estoque ampliando assim o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Ricardo Paulo M. is from Namaacha, a region on the border with Swaziland. He is 24 years old, and is married with a four-year-old son. Ricardo went to school through the 5th grade, when he had to give up his studies. In 1999 he moved with his family from Namaacha to Boane. For two years he's had his own business buying and selling a variety of products, especially soft drinks. He earns 1800 mt a week from this business. This is Ricardo's first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva. He heard about Hluvuku from his sister, who's been a client for a long time. With this loan he intends to increase his stock, and thus expand his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase his stock

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza, age forty-nine, is a married woman with five children who are in school. Eliza lives with her family in Kasoa, Ghana. She runs a grocery shop in her neighborhood. She also sells food items, such as pepper, fish, eggplants, spices, and tomatoes, on a table-top in front of her shop. She has been in business for fifteen years.

Eliza buys her goods from wholesalers in the city and sells them retail to her customers. She wants to buy the goods in bulk to save her the problem of frequent trips. Eliza is in a group called “Best.” The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loans and provide assistance to one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To purchase groceries.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona O. is from the village of Danao. She is 46 years old. Chona is married. To make a living, Chona owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Chona has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Chona joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Chona is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a fishing boat. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Chona from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Manuela Candelaria

texts.es:
La señora Manuela tiene 53 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. Salaverry, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios D. secundaria completa, tiene 3 hijos y ninguno depenD. económicamente D. ella.
Manuela tiene su peluquería que se encuentra ubicada en la avenida los incas D. la ciudad D. Trujillo, en donD. se dedica a la atención D. sus clientes, realizando cortes D. cabello, pintado, peinados, manicure, etc
Con su primer crédito D. 300 soles lo utilizó para comprar líquidos para ondulaciones, tijeras para el corte D. cabello, vidulis para ondular el cabello, etc.
Con este crédito D. S/. 800.00 soles, lo invertirá en comprar mas liquido D. ondulación, una  secadora y tijeras.
Manuela   tiene como sueño aumentar su clientela y posteriormente colocar otro salón D. belleza en Trujillo.
texts.en:
53-year old Señora Manuela lives in the district of Salaverry, Trujillo province, in the department of La Libertad, Peru. She is a businesswoman, has completed her high school education, and has three children, all of whom are financially independent. Manuela owns a hairdressing salon located on Avenida Los Incas in the city of Trujillo. She offers her clients services such as hair cuts, make-up, hair dos, manicures etc. With her first loan of 300 soles she bought perm solution, hairdresser’s scissors, curlers etc. With this loan of 800 soles, she will buy more perm solution, a hair dryer, and scissors. Manuela’s dream is to increase her number of clients and some time in the future open another beauty salon in Trujillo.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy items for her hairdressing salon

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea B. is from the village of Magting, Mambajao Camiguin. She is married and has four school-age children. To make a living, Irenea owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily snacks, candies and other delicacies, in the local community. Irenea has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $52 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Irenea joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Irenea has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Irenea is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is forty-one years old. He is married and has two children: a son and a daughter, both of whom are still in school. He works very hard to be able to provide for his family. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the Central region of Ghana.

Paul is a tailor by profession. He sews both men’s and women’s designs for clients and also for sale. He buys fabrics and other sewing accessories from Kumasi. He has a number of apprentices who are currently under training.

Paul has been in business for over eighteen years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy fabrics in bulk

loans.name: Tim

texts.en: This woman, who is employed as a commune officer in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, is requesting a loan of $400 to renovate parts of her house and invest in her general store, where she sells food ingredients, plastics, and some other kitchen accessories, assisted by her nephew.

loans.use: To invest in her store, and renovate parts of her house

loans.name: Atumane

texts.pt:
Atumane A. nasceu na província de Nampula, no distrito de Angoche, tem 49 anos de idade, separado e pai de 7 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 12 e 27 anos. Todos estudam nas escolas publicas de boane. Vivem na casa própria com os filhos, 7 netos e 3 irmãos sob sua responsabilidade. Estudou ate 8 classe tendo parado quando saiu o seu nome para cumprir o serviço militar obrigatório.

Cumpriu a tropa nas províncias de nampula e zambezia e saiu a maputo (boane) e com sua família (esposa e filhos) a procura de melhores condições de vida. Separou se da esposa por motivos sociais e mandou a de volta à terra natal. Trabalha na companhia de desminagem como sapador, mas também é comerciante no mercado central de boane. Vende arroz, açúcar, farinha e outros.

Rende aproximadamente 5.000,00MT por mês proveniente das vendas que efectua com ajuda dos filhos. Na empresa de desminagem recebe cerca de 1.650,00MT em 5 dias por mês ou em função da necessidade do trabalho.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos e este é o seu terceiro credito com a Hluvuku-Adsema no valor de 12.000,00MT para compra de produtos (arroz, açúcar, farinha e outros). Os primeiros empréstimos foram de 8.500,00MT e 10.500,00MT respectivamente para pratica da mesma actividade.

Conheceu a instituição na através de amigos e residentes, também clientes da instituição. Espera reembolsar sem problemas para poder aceder a mais créditos com objectivo de comprar uma camioneta para facilitar no transporte de mercadorias que adquire na cidade de maputo
texts.en:
Atumane A. was born in the province of Nampula, Angoche District, Mozambique. He is 49 years old, divorced and the father of seven children with ages between 12 and 27. They all go to public school in Boane. The 7 children, plus 7 grandchidlren and 3 brothers all live at his house, under his responsibility. Atumane had to drop school in 8th grade when he was drafted to the army. He served in Nampula and Zambezia then left for Maputo with his wife and children searching for a better life. He later divorced his wife and she went back to her hometown, leaving him with the children. He works at a mine clearance company as a sapper, but he's also a salesman at Boane's central market. With the help of his children, he sells rice, sugar, flour, and other items, which brings them approximately 5.000,00MT (U$175) per month. At the mine clearance company he makes about 1.650,00MT (U$60) for 5 days of work, depending on the amount of work available. He has never taken loans in other banks and this is his 3rd loan with Hluvuku-Adsema. He asks for 12.000,00MT (U$450) to buy more products (rice, sugar, flour, etc). His first two loans where for 8.500,00MT and 10.500,00MT, for the same purpose. He hopes to pay the loan back within reasonable time so he can apply for other loans, in order to buy a truck to help the transportation of merchandise he buys in Maputo.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: food products (rice, sugar, flour)

loans.name: Say

texts.en: Say R., 46 years old, is a grower from the Siem Reap Province. She runs her business on her own farmland where she grows different kinds of crops like, rice, cabbages, potatoes, and morning glories. She currently earns an average of $2 a day and has been running the business for more than twenty years. Say R. is married to Mr. yeb Youn who works fishing. She has now six children: one is single and the other five are married and live away from the family home. Say R. will be using her loan to hire the carvers to cut her matured crop.

loans.use: To hire the carvers to cut her matured crop

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long Y., 54, is married and lives with four of her children in the Takeo province. She works as a farmer together with her husband and they typically make US$1.50 every day. They are also supported by their children who work in the garment factories, casino and blacksmith. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also forced food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians. In light of these times of economic difficulties, Long Y. is asking CREDIT for a loan of US$1000 to aid her son’s business. He currently works as a blacksmith, and could make a lot more money if he opened up his own shop. She sees this loan as a way to increase her income and is confident that the business venture will be successful.

loans.use: Open up blacksmith shop.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is an industrious mother and wife.  One of her guiding principles is "patience is the key to success and productivity."  She manages a hog-raising livestock business.  When she sells a hog, her net income is PHP2,000.00.   Natividad wants a loan of PHP5,000.00 to purchase some hog feed, and some hogs to raise.  She needs a lot of encouragement to pursue her business in productive way. She is grateful to those people who supported her in financial aspects, especially to her children. 

Natividad is married to Juan Sr and they have ten children: Rosemarie, 39, elementary; Anabelle, 36, a midwife; Juan Jr., 34, a college graduate; Cynthia, 32; Ceasar, 30; Rosita, 27, a recording artist for almost 1 year; Rowena, 26, a nursing student; Josephine, 23, a criminology student; Marites, 21, at college level; and their youngest is Reylon,17, who is a college student. Natividad and her husband peacefully reside in the village of Nungnungan, Cauayan City, a semi-urban area, and their house is located along the highway. She said that she's happy with what she has right now, because she feels a lot of contentment in her life.

loans.use: To purchase feed and additional piglets.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann P. is 25 years of age and is married to Romulo. The couple are blessed with two children; Roldan-eight years old, an elementary school pupil, and Princess Joy who is four years old. Through sacrifice and patience, the couple they are able to sustain their basic needs. They are engaged in a recycling business. They own a junk shop where they buy recyclable materials from their neighbors and nearby villages.Wanting to have additional capital for buying empty cans, bottles and other junks, Mary Ann is requesting a loan of Php5,000 from KIVA lenders. By expanding the business, Mary Ann hopes that the family's income will increase.

loans.use: For additional capital for business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria B. is currently in the business of selling maize flour and sorghum in the market and is requesting a loan to buy more bags of maize flour and sorghum.  Maria is a 45-year-old widow.   She has six children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a wholesale shop.


 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize flour and soghum.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida, 38 years old, is married and a mother of three children who are currently in school. She works hard to support her husband in providing food, health and other support for her children. She is determined to provide for her children through hard work and commitment. Vida has been selling cosmetics in the market center of the community where she lives, and also sells during market days in the surrounding communities. She has been in business close to three years now. She says selling of cosmetics is very lucrative.  She wants to expand her inventory, which will make a good income, enabling her to sponsor her children's education. Also, as we enter into Christmas season, she believes the loan assistance will help increase her sales. She is so sure that your loan support will bring her the results she wants.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cosmetics and baby products.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es: Leticia de 56 años es una mujer muy responsable y alegre, vive sola en su casa propia  y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.En un pequeño cuarto Leticia a logrado adecuar  su taller de manualidades, todos los días trabaja desde muy temprano para cumplir con los pedidos que le realizan, su trabajo es muy solicitado por sus clientes, ya que las manualidades que realiza son de muy buena calidad, actualmente se encuentra trabajando para una  empresas de taxis, a las cuales les realiza los adornos por sus aniversarios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede realizar sus manualidades en la tranquilidad de su hogar, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es realizar los pequeños detalles en los acabados de los adornos. Con el tiempo, espera aperturar una amplia  tienda por el centro de la ciudad, ya que actualmente solo trabaja a pedido.Este es su  sexto préstamo con  MFP, y esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no desea causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy querida por la alegría que demuestra.Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más materiales, para elaborar nuevos adornos, para que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Leticia is 56 years old. She is a very responsible and happy person. She lives alone in her own house and what she wants most is to improver her quality of life. In a small room, Leticia has created her craft studio. Everyday, she starts work very early to fulfill requests. Her work is very sought after by her clients, since the crafts she makes are of very good quality. Currently, she is working for a taxi business, making decorations for their anniversary. What she likes most about her work is that she can create her crafts in the peace and quiet of her home. She has been doing this work for 20 years and she considers that the most difficult part is to make the small details in finishing touches. With time, she hopes to open a large store in the center of the city, since currently, she only works through requests. This is her sixth loan with MFP. She is committed to make all the payments on time, since she does not want to cause problems for the members of her communal bank, where she is well liked for the happiness she shows. With the 800 nuevos soles (PEN) requested, she will buy more materials in order to make new decorations, so that her business continues to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy materials for her business

loans.name: Afde Group No.3

texts.en:
L'Association des Femmes pour le Developpement d'Entreprises  (Association of Women for Business Development) is a cooperative of small-scale traders working in Thies, a city about 70km from Dakar.  The association was founded in 1993 by 20 entreprenurial women as a cooperative to increase their purchasing power and organize a tontine.  A tontine is a revolving group loan in which each member contributes a small amount to a daily fund, with a different member financed each day.  The tontine has evolved to more formal group loans through UIMCEC.  For such loans, the members are split into five-member groups, with a designated president and treasurer.  These sub-groups may be the same for many years, but often change members depending on financing needs and other considerations.  The AFDE organizes monthly member meetings and runs a cooperative for its members, allowing them to buy rice and other staples at a better price. The association's President is Ms. Mame Diarra Mar.  

All five of the women of AFDE Group No. 3 work in the main market of Thies.  Ms. Penda N., 42, is the group's president.  She has been a merchant for 22 years. She sells vegetables.  She is married and the mother of four children.  She lives with her family in the Cité Lamy neighborhood.
The other four members all sell fish, which is transported from the fishing towns along the coast.  Each member will receive a 100,000 credit for her business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Alicia C. le está haciendo falta una losa de concreto al frente de su casa.
Desea mejorar su vivienda ya que es el patrimonio de su hijo, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poder realizar la mejora, ya que en este momento no cuanta con el dinero necesario. 
Con el  ingreso que obtiene de su  empleo en una clínica en el aria de enfermera,  planea pagar el crédito, ya que su esposo el señor José Alonso Méndez se encargara de los gastos familiares con el sueldo que obtiene como empleado de un súper mercado, en el departamento de mercancía. 
Quieren que su pequeño hijo tenga lo mejor y que no le falte nada. La persona que aparece en la foto es el señor José Alonso Méndez esposo de la señora Alicia C. ya que ella se encontraba en su trabajo el día de la visita.
texts.en:
Alicia C.' house needs concrete paving stones in the front yard. She hopes to improve her home, which is her son's estate. She is requesting funding to carry out this improvement because she currently lacks sufficient funds to do so. She plans to repay the loan with her earnings as a nurse in a clinic. Her husband, José Alonso Méndez, who works in the stock department of a supermarket, is in charge of paying for family expenses with his salary. They want their young son to have the best and lack nothing. The person in the photo is José Alonso Méndez, Alicia C.' husband, because she was at work the day of the home visit.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy concrete paving stones.

loans.name: Alrie Quinimon Group

texts.en:
Alrie Q. is from the village of Pan-ay Diot, in Tudela, Misamis Occidental Province. She is 32 years old. Alrie is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Alrie is single. To make a living, she owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling dried goods in the local community. Alrie is just starting this business.

In 2010, Alrie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan Alrie has taken from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: The Women´s Bank Of United Women (Banco Mujer Mujeres Unidas) Group

texts.en:
The Women´s Bank of United Women (Banco Mujer Mujeres Unidas) Group is comprised of eight women members from Bratsi, Limón, a rural area located in the Caribbean region of Costa Rica. Each member has applied for a loan of 200,000 colons which will be used to make general investments in the expansion of their productive activities.

The women of this group are engaged in various entrepreneurial projects including plantain harvesting, the rearing and sale of livestock (poultry products) and the purchase of catalogue products for resale.

Specifically, this loan will be used to finance the purchase of all necessary materials, nutrients, and equipment that are used to plant and harvest plantains. Additionally, this loan will be used to increase working capital and facilitate the purchase of various household and clothing products which will be sold at a later date in the Bratsi community. Finally, this loan will enable group members to buy livestock (chickens) and animal feed to ensure the good health of animals and, in turn, guarantee a high quality final product.

According to the group, a common goal is to secure a steady stream of revenues in order to maintain a constant level of working capital. This will allow the women to continually re-invest in their businesses and attract new clients. The women hope to increase sales so they will be able to use the revenues to help pay for their children´s studies.

The women of this group face many obstacles. The lack of job opportunities in Bratsi has led the members to take it upon themselves to create a way to make a living. The hot and humid climate of the Caribbean region creates an environment where livestock become susceptible to diseases. Maintaining the health of their animals has been a constant struggle for the members of this group. For the women involved in the planting and harvest of plantains, flooding has caused problems. As they cannot predict when a flood might occur, their livelihoods are at the mercy of Mother Nature.

A major obstacle for all the women of this group has been a lack of financial resources to develop their entrepreneurial activities. This loan will help extend the reach of financial services to a poor community of hardworking women.

The name of this group, ¨United Women¨, symbolizes the philosophy of solidarity and support expressed amongst members. These women have banded together because, they say, ¨individually it would be more difficult for us.¨

Sara M. G. is the president of this group. This will be her second loan with Fundación Mujer. Sara is in the business of rearing and selling chickens and eggs. She plans to use this loan to invest in the purchase of livestock and animal feed in order to expand her business and sell more poultry products.

loans.use: To invest in plantain harvesting, catalogue products and the purchase of livestock and animal feed.

loans.name: Adela Maria

texts.es: La señora Adela Maria tiene su negocio que es la venta de rosquillas, cacao, semilla de jícaro. La ubicación de su negocio es  a orillas de la carretera, por lo que es aquí donde vienen muchas desde hace 20 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que se ha esforzado mucho por mejorar sus ingresos. Esta solicitando un financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio, ya que se acerca la semana santa y ella requiere de más producto para el negocio. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y al crédito. Su deseo es tener más ingresos para sufragar todos sus gastos.
texts.en:
Sra. Adela Maria has a business selling donuts, cacao, and the seeds of the calabash gourd. Her business is located on the edge of the road. Adela has been managing her business for twenty years and has worked hard to improve her earnings.

Her loan will be invested in her business since Holy Week is approaching, thereby needing to acquire more products. Her sales are made for cash or on credit. She hopes to have more income so that she can cover all of her expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire more merchandise

loans.name: Roya Morsal Group

texts.en:
Morsal is the daughter of S. B.. She is 26 years old and the leader of the Roya Morsal group. She is married with five children: three sons and two daughters. Her youngest son is a college student in his first year and the others are students in school. Now she wants to take a loan for her husband who has a fresh fruit shop in the city of Kabul, He needs a small loan for his business to become strong and to help with his family in a better way. Therefore, she requested a loan for her husband who wants to expand and progress his business. He wants to complete his stock for his shop and start working hard.

She is very happy with this process of small loans in Afghanistan and wants to thank the Kiva lenders around the world.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her husband's fruit shop

loans.name: Florinda Del Carmen

texts.es: Florinda del Carmen R. D. R. D. 38 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Osicala, ubicado en el departamento D. Morazán. Vive junto a su esposo y dos hijas D. 5 y 8 años D. edad. Florinda se dedica a la venta D. ropa para hombre, mujeres y niños, la cual comercializa D. forma ambulante, por las calles D. Osicala, así mismo todos los domingos se establece en el parque del mismo lugar, en el cual sus ventas se incrementan por ser el día D. la semana con más comercio en el lugar. Ella trabaja muy duro D. lunes a viernes con el enorme deseo D. poder tener una vida mejor, es por esto que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. ropa sobre todo juvenil, ya que es la que más se venD., así mismo ella quiere contar  con más inventario debido a que se acercan las fiestas municipales D. Osicala y en esta temporada sus ganancias suben ya que coloca sus ventas en la feria que se celebra. Es por estas razones que Florinda desea obtener el préstamo con Integral el cual le permita mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Florinda del Carmen R. D. R. is 38 years old and lives in the city of Osicala, in the Morazán department. She lives with her husband and their two daughters, 5 and 8 years of age. Florinda works as a street vendor, selling clothing for men, women, and children. She sells on the streets of Osicala and on Sundays in the park, which is most profitable as Sunday is the day with the most commerce. Florinda works very hard Monday to Friday with a great desire to have a better life. She is seeking a loan to buy more clothing, especially children’s clothing which is her most popular product. She also wants to increase her inventory as the municipal festivals of Osicala are approaching and this is a time of increased sales.
