For these reasons, Florinda wants this loan which will allow her to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is married to a timber contractor. They are blessed with 10 children. She sells groceries and roasted roasted beef. Having 15 years experience in this business has really helped her in getting more customers and more profit. 

Roseline hopes for a loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro, de 56 años, es un padre de familia muy trabajador y responsable, que vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Justa de 52 años y sus 3 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.Con el apoyo de su esposa, Alejandro decidió comprar, hace 35 años, unos terrenos en los cuales pudiera trabajar y así mejorar la economía de su familia. Actualmente esos terrenos los sigue trabajando, pero ahora son mucho mas productivos que antes, ya que con el paso del tiempo aprendió  a obtener la mayor producción de sus chacras. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la relación tan cercana que tiene con la tierra, además disfruta mucho viendo sus sembríos crecer, lleva 40 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que cuidar sus campos de las inclemencias del clima, ya que cualquier descuido puede afectar la cosecha. Para más adelante, espera que los costos de las verduras suban, ya que de lo contrario su capital de trabajo se vera afectado.Este es el quinto préstamo que Alejandro tiene con MFP; esta muy contento por obtenerlo, ya que lo necesitaba  urgentemente para mejorar su negocio. En su banco comunal es un socio muy querido, ya que siempre pone mucho orden en las reuniones.Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para fortalecer sus sembríos, y  también invertirá en la compra de ganado.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 56 years old. He is a hard working and responsible husband and father who lives in his own home with his wife, Justa, 52, and their 3 minor children to whom he wants to offer a better quality of life. With his wife's support, Alejandro decided, 35 years ago, to buy some plots of land in which to work and thus improve his family's finances. At present, he is still working the land, but it is much more productive now than before. Over time, he learned how to have greater production from his fields. What he likes the most about his job is the close relationship he has with the earth, and he also enjoys watching his plantings grow. He has been doing this for 40 years and he considers the hardest thing to be taking care of his fields in inclement weather, since any oversight can affect the crop. Looking ahead, he hopes that the price of vegetables goes up, since his working capital will be affected if the opposite happens. This is the fiftth loan Alejandro has had with MFP. He is very happy to have obtained it, since he needed it urgently for his business. He is a well liked member of his communal bank, since he always brings order to the meetings. With the two thousand nuevos soles he has asked for, he will purchase more fertilizer for his plantings and he will also invest in purchasing cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He will purchase fertilizer and some heads of cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta E. is from the village of Magsaysay Baliangao Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old and married with 5 school-aged children. To make a living Julieta sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Julieta joined GDMPC to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC which she used to to expand her business. She is requesting her fourth loan, for 15000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia pertenece al Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua, durante el tiempo que es socia los prestamos le ayudaron mucho en el crecimiento D. su negocio.
Emilia es casada y tiene 2 hijos que estudian en la ciudad D. Lima, Emilia tiene un puesto en el mercado Central D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho en donD. venD. carne variada, los animales los adquiere en las ferias D. la región, actividad a la que se dedica todos los días. Emilia solicita un crédito D. 1250 soles para la compra D. una vaca. El sueño D. Emilia es mejorar y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Emilia belongs to the Wiñarisun (meaning 'we will grow' in Quechua) Communal Bank. Since she became a member, her loans have helped her business to grow a great deal. Emilia is married and has 2 children who study in the city of Lima. She has a post in the Central Market in the city of Ayacucho, where she sells a variety of meat. She buys her animals in regional fairs, an activity she is involved in every day. Emilia is requesting a loan for 1,250 sols to buy a head of beef. Emilia's dream is to improve and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING A HEAD OF BEEF FOR HER BUTCHER SHOP

loans.name: Deolinda

texts.en:
Deolinda N. is from the town of Banga. She is 57 years old. Deolinda is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Deolinda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She also manages a sari-sari store located at their house. She dreams of a bigger store and a productive rice farm.

Deolinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Deolinda has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Deolinda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure, and additional store inventory. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Deolinda from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure, and additional store inventory.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is divorced and has one son. She owns a small business that sells clothing at the central market in Novomoskovsk and has been in this business for fifteen years. She has always offered high quality products and excellent client service. She has many repeat clients that make her business a success. Irina has an active life that encourages her business neighbors and friends. 

Irina has used micro-loans before and found them very helpful. This time, she would like to borrow 15,000 UAH to increase her inventory. She hopes to increase her sales and receive additional income to take better care of her family as well as help her son pay for college.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of clothes for sale

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es: Edelmira, de 37 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Abel de 41 años, quien trabaja junto a ella en el cultivo de sus tierras y sus 2 hijas Yanilin de 18 y Yasmin de 16 años y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. El negocio de Edelmira esta ubicado en el mercado modelo de la ciudad de Tarma, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras como, arvejas, zanahorias, tomates. Su puesto es muy concurrido, ya que vende verduras muy frescas y a un buen precio, lo cual ha hecho que se vuelva una de las vendedoras más solicitadas por los clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus compradores que acuden a su puesto, de esa manera se hace más amena sus largas jornadas de trabajo, lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto cuidándolo. En adelante, desea seguir trabajando duro y mejorar su negocio poco a poco. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte la ayudara bastante en el desarrollo de su negocio, dentro de su grupo comunal trabaja muy duro, para que las cosas le salgan muy bien. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más verduras, para implementar mejor su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Edelmira, 37, is hardworking and unassuming woman. She lives in a rented home with her husband Abel, 41, who works with her cultivating their land, and their 2 daughters: Yanilin, 18, and Yasmin, 16. What she wishes for the most is to improve her quality of life. Edelmira's business is located in the Modelo market in the city of Tarma. She sells vegetables such as: peas, carrots and tomatoes. Her stall is very busy, since she sells very fresh vegetables at a good price, which has made her one of the most sought after vendors by the customers. What she likes most about her job is chatting with the buyers who come to her post; this provides her with entertainment during her long working days. She has been doing this work for 7 years now, and what she considers most difficult is to have to remain at her post all day long. In the future, she wants to continue to work hard and improve her business little by little. This is her 4th loan with MFP, and she feels that this support will help her to develop her business. Within her communal bank she works very hard so that things will go well. With the 1,500 Peruvian soles that she requests, she will buy more vegetables to better stock her selling post.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy vegetables to restock her business

loans.name: Alia

texts.en: Alia S. is from the village of Batinay, Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 29 years old. Alia is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Alia runs a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies, especially banana kabob, in the local community. Alia has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,700 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Alia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional ingredients for the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Alia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for the business

location.town: Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene M., 59 years old, is a joyful but hardworking mother of 6 children. Because of poverty she was compelled to stop schooling and enter the life of marriage at an early age. During the early stage of their marriage their income was only sufficient for their daily consumptions and that’s why her 3 eldest children never reached college. However, she works hard and awith patience and perseverance she was able to send her children to college. Her other 3 youngest children were able to graduate from college and ASHI was part of this success. Because of her loans she was able to finance her business and earn a living. As a member she did her best to become active and performs her duties and responsibilities with dignity. 

She is again applying for a loan of Php 20,000.00 pesos to buy additional fruits, vegetables, meat, fish and kitchen utensils for her food vending project and grocery products for her store. Her profit from this additional capital will be used to support the school expenses of her grandchildren. She will also save for the construction of a much more convenient store and food stall for her customers. Irene also dreams of renovating their house with the help of her husband and children. She really admires the service that ASHI and KIVA provide with poor but worthy families who are full of hopes and dreams but limited by bureaucracy. According to her, the opportunity of becoming a member of ASHI and KIVA really is a privilege that she will always cherished.

loans.use: to buy meat, fish, fruits and vegetables products

loans.name: Donata

texts.es: Donata de 50 años, convive con Marco, de 51 años de edad, ambos trabajan con un buen equipo, de esa manera sacaron adelante a su 5 hijos de los cuales, solo viven con uno de ellos, Roqui, de 14 años, en su casa propia ubicada en la selva peruana (comunidad de Las Palmas). Sus años de esfuerzo y sacrificio, dedicados a la agricultura dieron su resultado, hace ya 2 años que abrió un pequeño restaurante, donde ofrece los ricos potajes de la selva peruana; a los pobladores de su localidad le gusta su comida y todos los días saborean sin falta sus ricos platos. Le va tan bien que ahora dejó de sembrar para dedicarle más tiempo a su restaurante. En su casa propia que esta ubicada en una zona céntrica, Donata encontró una gran oportunidad, por ello instaló una tienda de comestibles, donde vender gas por balones, arroz y diversos productos de primera necesidad; que por la lejanía del lugar, no pueden viajar constantemente a la ciudad para adquirir dichos productos. Ahora ella quiere expandirse más y está planeando surtir más su bodega de comestibles. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, y desea seguir trabajando con su banco comunal, porqué le demostró apoyo y progreso. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más mercadería para su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en: Donata, 50-years-old, lives with Marco, 51-years-old, and together they work with a good team, which is how they've gotten themselves and their 5 children ahead. They live with one child, Roqui, 14-years-old, in their own house in the Peruvian jungle (the community of Las Palmas). Her years of hard work and sacrifice working in agriculture paid off two years ago when she opened a small restaurant where she offers delicious vegetable soups popular in the Peruvian jungle. The people in her area like her food and every day without fail they savor her delicious dishes. It's going so well that she's left her agriculture job to dedicate more time to the restaurant. In her home, which is centrally located, Donata found a great opportunity. She installed a food store where she sells gas for balls, rice, and various essential items. Because of the distance she's not able to travel constantly to the city to purchase her products. She wants to expand more and is planing to stock up her store with more food. This is her third loan with MFP and she wants to keep working with her communal bank because it has shown her support and progress. With this loan she will buy more merchandise for her food store.

loans.use: Purchase of products to stock her store

loans.name: Dexy Elizabeth

texts.es:
Dexy tiene 30 años de edad, es separada y reside junto a sus dos hijos en casa de sus padres ubicada en el distrito pesquero de San José, una zona que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra situada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a la confección y venta de prendas de vestir en su domicilio. Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y conocidos del distrito donde reside. El negocio le brinda los ingresos suficientes para hacerse cargo del mantenimiento de sus hijos y de apoyar a sus padres en el sostenimiento de su economía diaria.

Dexy desea adquirir más material y mercadería para poder satisfacer la demanda que suele incrementarse por presentarse la temporada navideña. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante responsable y entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer luchadora y emprendedora.
texts.en:
Dexy is 30 years old, separated, and lives with her two sons in her parents' home, which is located in the fishing district of San José, an area that belongs to the province of Lambayeque and is located at more than twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She has been working for three years making and selling clothes at home.  Her main customers are her neighbors and acquaintances in the district where she lives.  The business provides enough income to provide for her children and support her parents in their daily expenses.

Dexy wants to acquire more material and goods to meet demand that tends to increase in the Christmas season.  She has therefore seen fit to apply for the first time to Edpyme Alternativa, for a loan of 1500 soles to achieve her goal.

She is a very responsible woman who is devoted to her family.  Her greatest wish is to continue growing as an entrepreneur to be able to raise her children.  People who know Dexy regard her as a fighter and hardworking woman.

loans.use: To buy clothing to expand her business.

loans.name: Agueda

texts.es:
La señora Águeda es socia del banco comunal El Arenal, del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos, su primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos fue de S/.300.00 soles, con el cual comenzó su negocio.
Águeda es costurera  pero también tiene su negocio de venta de bebidas gaseosas, lleva 14 años trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos y asegura que le va muy bien, porque puede aportar algo de dinero a su hogar y ayudar a su esposo, que es empleado de una triplayera (elaboran triplay). 
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 soles, invertirá en la compra de 10 metro de tela y una recubridora, que necesita para dar mejor acabado a sus prendas de vestir y también comprará 5 cajas de gaseosas de diferentes sabores.
La señora Águeda  confía en que Manuela Ramos le siga apoyando con los préstamos y le agradece porque puede dar una buena educación a sus menores hijos y por  todo lo que ha logrado hasta el momento.
texts.en:
Agueda is a member of the communal bank El Arenal in the Callería district of the Ucayali region.  She is 45-years-old, is married, and has four children.  Her first loan with Manuela Ramos was for 300 soles, with this loan she opened her business.  
Agueda is a seamstress, but she also has a business selling sodas.  She has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos for 14 years and says that it has gone very well for her because she can use some of the money to support her home and help her husband, who is an employee in a plywood factory.
With this loan of 2000 soles, she will invest in the purchase of 10 meters of fabric and a coating that she needs to give a better finish to her garments.  She will also purchase five boxes of sodas in different flavors.  
Agueda trusts that Manuela Ramos will continue to support her with loans and thanks her because she has been able to give a better education to her younger children and for everything else that she has achieved up until now.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric and threads

loans.name: Mussarat's Group

texts.en:
Mussarat lives in Jaranwala, a small city in the Punjab region of Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She lives with her family in the area of Anwerabad in a 2-room brick house. Mussarat has 3 children: 2 sons and a daughter. All of them are getting their education from a nearby school. Mussarat is a housewife. She is a very active lady and always shows full support to her husband in difficult times.

Mussarat has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah for her husband’s fruit selling business. With the loan, he will buy more seasonal fruits to sell to his customers. Mussarat is hopeful that through the loan investment her husband will be able to increase his sales and earn more income. Mussarat is a regular lender with Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan years, she has paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.

Note: In the photo, Mussarat is holding a book (the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits

loans.name: Gyulnara

texts.en:
Gyulnara A. was born in 1967 in Ijevan city. She is married and has a school aged son. 
Gyulnara is a pharmacist, but since 1987, she has rented a stall where she manages her own business. Her business consists of selling clothes, underclothes, bedclothes and towels. She says children's clothes are always in popular demand, so she makes an emphasis on it at her business. 
The profits from the sales allow her to take care of the needs of her family and support her trade. 
Before the New Year’s holiday, Gyulnara wants to increase her shop’s assortment and therefore requests a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy winter clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy winter clothes for resale

loans.name: Margen

texts.en:
Margen S., 35, is from Ozamiz city. She is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Margen owns and operates a business venture operating motor transportation services. Margen has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Margen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to repair an existing vehicle in order to provide better service. This will be her fifth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a vehicle in order to provide better transportation services.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MAMA SIMONA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Poroy, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Estela; ella tiene 32 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de chicha de jora esto (hecho a base de maíz), la socia lo elabora para luego distribuirlo a sus clientes que son especialmente las chicherías que se encuentran ubicados en Poroy, la socia es una persona muy emprendedora que lleva años en este negocio, y de esta forma saca a su familia adelante.  

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más insumos  para su negocio como maíz azúcar entre otros más, y también para la compra de bloquetas para la construcción de su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Estela is a member of the "MAMA SIMONA” which is located in Poroy district, in Cusco province and department.

Estela is 32 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 3 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling 'chicha de jora' (a corn-based drink).  She makes her 'chicha' and then distributes it to her customers, including chicherías located in Poroy.  Estela is a very enterprising person who has been in this business for years.  This is how she gets her family ahead in life.

Estela is requesting this loan to buy more supplies for her business such as corn, sugar, etc.  She will also buy blocks for building her home.  Estela is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her business such as corn, sugar, etc.  She will also buy blocks for building her home

loans.name: Enrequita

texts.en:
Enriquita M. is from Surallah. She is 64 years old and married. Her family is engaged in hog raising and farming as their means of livelihood. But as far as their capacity to create capital for their small business venture is concerned, they still lack money to acquire piglets and farm improvements, so she is applying for a loan to buy for two (2) piglets and fertilizers for her farm.

Enriquita has been working very hard to support her family. She is happy that CEVI’s program includes insurance and hospital assistance.

loans.use: To buy for two piglets and fertilizers

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, who is 27 and cares for one child, has operated a business selling spare car parts for the past two years. Employing one person to help her, her shop is open from 6:30 am to 9 pm every day of the week. Alice will use her loan to purchase more spare parts for the store and plans to reinvest all of her profits into her shop.

Alice thanks Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: To buy more car spare parts to sell

loans.name: Alvin John

texts.en:
Alvin John B. is from the village of Villa Fermin Echague. He is 19 years old. Alvin John is single. To make a living, Alvin John raises pigs for fattening and sale. Alvin John has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP when he sells one of his raised pigs.

In 2011, Alvin John joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alvin John is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Alvin John from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed & other supplies

loans.name: Martha Luz

texts.es:
La señora Martha es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Edén, del Distrito D. Yarinacocha, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 52 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos.
Lleva 6 años en este banco comunal.  Ella se dedica a dar servicio D. fotocopias, elaboración D. sellos y fotografías, su negocio está creciendo, antes se dedicaban solo a sacar copias.
Su esposo es el que se encarga D. hacer los sellos y sacar las copias y ella en las fotografías, el trabajo lo tienen compartido y ambos se apoyan.
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: una maquina digital, 5 millares D. papel  A4 para copias, 1 millar papel para fotografía y otros insumos.
Su negocio está yendo muy bien gracias a la dedicación que le ponen, con cada uno D. sus préstamos ha ido comprando las cosas que le hacían falta y D. esa manera ha logrado mejorar la atención a sus clientes. Manuela Ramos ha sido D. gran ayuda para su familia.
En la foto la vemos retocando una foto.
texts.en:
Martha, 52, is a member of the “Nuevo Edén” (New Eden) communal bank in Yarinacocha district, Ucayali department.  She’s married and has two children.

She’s been in this communal bank for 6 years.  She provides photographic services, manufactures stamps and photographs.  The business is growing because they used to just make photocopies. Her husband makes the stamps and copies and she does the photography.  They share the work and support each other.

She will use the new, 2000 new sol, loan to buy a digital camera, two reams of A4 paper for photocopies, 2 reams of photographic paper and other supplies.

She is doing well in the business thanks to the effort they put into it.  She has used each one of her loans to buy the things she needed thus attaining better customer service.  Manuela Ramos has been of great help for her family.

In the photo we can see her retouching a photo.

loans.use: To buy a digital camera, 10 reams of A4 copy paper and 2 reams of photographic paper.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is 39 years old and has seven children between 1 and 14 years old, all of whom are in school except the infant. Francoise’s husband is a driver, while Francoise owns a shop in which she sells rice, sugar, salt, cooking oil, soap, toothpaste, tea, books, and other items. 

She has had this business for eleven years, and she is requesting a loan in order to reinvest in her business by buying more sugar,rice,salt etc. With the profits, she wants to pay for her children’s school fees. Francoise hopes to grow her shop into more of a wholesale business.

loans.use: Buying more sugar,salt.,rice etc for her general store.

loans.name: Karla Sugey

texts.es: Karla Sugey tiene 22 años. Tiene 3 hijos pero solamente 1 está a su cargo. La actividad económica es la compra y venta de cerdos, hace más de 6 años que posee este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda, por lo que sus inicios surgen con muy poco capital, pero con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Por lo que tenía que pagar las cuentas de su vivienda y además proporcionarles a sus hijos estudios y alimentación. El financiamiento que solicita es para comprar de 2 cerdos grandes y también para comprarle alimento. Su mayor sueño es seguir incrementando su negocio.
texts.en:
Karla Sugey is 22 years old.  She has three children but only one is in her care.  Karla's business is buying and selling pigs.  She has been in this business for more than 6 years and the business is located on her property.  She started out with very little capital but a great desire to get ahead in life as she had to pay her household bills and provide her children with food and an education.

The loan that Karla is requesting will be used to buy two big pigs and also some animal feed.  Her biggest dream is to continue increasing her business.

loans.use: to buy two big pigs

loans.name: Isaack

texts.en:
Our newest agent, Isaack B., has managed to save a substantial amount of money on his daily expenses by using Solio. He enjoys the light given by the Solio and his children are able to study longer into the night. 

With the money that he saves and the weekly reactivation fees, he has been able to set up a grocery business. The reactivation key has given him the status of ‘Mr. Stima’ (Mr. Electricity) in his community as he is in charge of 10 pieces of the Solio Kit which he reactivates for all clients under him for a fee. 

Solio has also helped Isaack in managing different people and making sure that they reactivate, which is both a challenging and enjoyable experience for him.

loans.use: to buy solar powered kits for others in his community to use

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to reconstruct his barber shop building

loans.name: Nazira

texts.es:
La Sra. Nazira es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, es madre de una hija y cuenta con su propio negocio el cual consiste en la venta de ropa nueva y prendas de plata la cual la ejerce de manera ambulante desde hace mucho años donde ofrece a los habitantes de dicho municipio sobre todo a las personas asalariadas.
Desde que inició su negocio se ha caracterizado por dar una buena atención a sus clientes y gracias al esfuerzo propio ha podido diversificarlo en productos y a bajos precios lo que atrae la atención de los mismos, también le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia y construir su propia vivienda. Una de las necesidades que tiene esta señora es contar con más capital para adquirir los productos que le encargan sus clientes por acercarse la festividad de las madres, por tal razón decidió solicitar su cuarto crédito en Ceprodel con el objetivo de satisfacer la demanda de tales clientes.
texts.en: Nazira is originally from the municipality of El Sauce. She is the mother of one daughter and she has her own business. She has been selling new clothing and silver jewelry itinerantly for many years to the inhabitants of the municipality, especially to those who are employed. Since the start she has been known to provide her clients with good service and thanks to her efforts she has diversified the products and lowered the prices to attract their attention. This has also permitted her to support her family and to build her own home. One of the needs she faces is that she doesn't have more capital funds to acquire the products that her clients request, especially as Mother's Day approaches. For this reason she decided to request her fourth loan from Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner). Her objective is to satisfy her clients' demands.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, men's shirts, towels, skin lotions, and silver jewelry for resale.

loans.name: Joyce Wambui

texts.en:
Joyce Wambui is 44 years old. She is married to David, who contributes to the family income. She has three children, 20, 17 and 10 years of age. She does dairy farming and grows tea. She has been in the agriculture business for a period of about six years, with an income of 18,000 per month.

This is her second loan with the KADET LTD, after repaying the previous one successfully. She wants the loan to buy fish feed and daily feed and also to buy farm inputs.

She hopes to own a big farm and to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish feed and daily feed and also buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 57 years old. She is married and has five children. She has been in quarry mining for the past 11 years.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET staff in her place of habitat. She has applied for her third loan, which she intends to use to employ more temporary workers in her quarry. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her mining activity.


She dreams of educating her children to a higher level of education. She is a thorough woman who is determined to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to employ more temporary workers in her quarry

loans.name: Mahulolo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHULOLO est formé de cinq personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Micheline, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Micheline est âgée de 40 ans environs et est mariée à Vincent, un comptable. Le couple a deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés et qui vivent ensemble avec eux. Micheline et son mari supporte ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Micheline a très peu fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et s'impliquer dans les diverses charges du ménage, Micheline prépare de "Atassi" (aliment local fait à base de riz et de haricot) et aussi de la bouillie de maïs, qu'elle vend à son domicile depuis une vingtaine d'année. La demande de sa clientèle devient de plus en plus grande et compte tenu de ses moyens limités, Micheline n'arrive plus à bien répondre à leurs exigences. Eu égard à cela et compte tenu de leurs ressources limitées, Micheline et les autres membres du groupe MAHULOLO sollicitent ensemble un  crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Group Mahulolo is composed of five residents of the same district in Benin. The group's representative, named Micheline, is raising her hand on the picture. This is the second time that this group is requesting AliDé's financial support in order to increase their level of activity.
Micheline is about 40 years old and is married to Vincent, an accountant. The couple has two children who both attend school and live together with them. Micheline and her husband provide for the family together. Micheline had very little schooling. To support herself and participate to the household expenses, Micheline prepares "Atassi" (a local dish made from rice and beans) and corn porridge, which she has been selling from her home for about twenty years. Customer demand is growing, and given her limited means, Micheline no longer manages to satisfy it well.
In view of this and taking into account their limited resources, Micheline and the other members from group Mahulolo are requesting a collective loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase cereals, condiments for sauces, and peanut oil.

loans.name: Rahim

texts.ru: Рахим проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 28 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Рахим занимается торговлей на рынке "Саховат". У него имеется торговая точка, где он продает мужскую одежду и обувь. Этим видом деятельности Рахим занимается уже пять лет. Он берет кредит для покупки мужских рубашек и осеней обуви. Он хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Rahim lives in the city of Kulob.  He is 28 years old, married and has two children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Rahim is involved in retail sales at the "Sahovat" market.  He has a retail outlet, where he sells men's clothing and shoes.  Rahim has been involved in this type of business for five years.  He is requesting this loan to purchase men's shirts and fall shoes.  He wants to increase his merchandise selection.

loans.use: to purchase men's shirts and fall shoes

loans.name: Jose Abdubar

texts.es:
José, tiene 22 años de edad, vive con su esposa y una hija de 10 meses de nacida, él es agricultor y actualmente tiene una siembra de maíz en 2 manzanas de terreno.
Él solicita un préstamo para comprar fertilizantes para aplicarlos al cultivo, ya que es bastante el terreno, también deberá pagar mano de obra, para que le ayuden a realizar la tarea.
Su objetivo es que a través del financiamiento pueda pagar los insumos necesarios y la mano de obra, para poder fortalecer el cultivo y recibir al final una buena cosecha para comercializarla.
texts.en:
José is 22 years old.  He lives with his wife and their 10 month old daughter.  José is a farmer and he currently has corn planted on 2 blocks of land. 
José is requesting the loan in order to purchase fertilizers to apply to his crop.  Since he has quite a bit of land, he will need to pay laborers to help him with the work.
José's objective is to use the financing to pay for his necessary supplies and for labor in order to strengthen his crop and get a good crop to sell.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to apply to his crop.

loans.name: Nicacia

texts.es: La señora Nicacia trabaja en limpieza de casas y también tiene una pequeña tienda donde vende carne y otros productos de consumo diario; su esposo es electricista. El crédito lo requiere para su aumento de capital, pues necesita comprar una heladera para mantener la carne en buen estado y comprar en mayor cantidad; también necesita comprar otros productos para mantener su tienda con un buen stock de mercadería y así hacer crecer su negocio. Vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Valle Hermoso  en la ciudad de La Paz; es casada y tiene un  hijo. Es la quinta vez que  IMPRO aprueba un préstamo para Nicacia y la segunda vez que se canaliza a través de KIVA.
texts.en:
Nicacia works cleaning houses and also has a small store where she sells meat and other daily use items; her husband’s an electrician.  She needs the loan to increase working capital because she needs to buy a refrigerator to keep her meat in good condition and to be able to buy in larger amounts.  She also needs to buy other merchandise to keep her store well stocked and thus help it grow.  

She lives in her parents’ house in the city of La Paz’s Valle Hermoso zone.  She’s married and has a son.  This is the fifth time IMPRO has approved a loan for Nicacia and the second time it’s been channeled through KIVA.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Joaquim

texts.pt:
Nasceu em  Inhambane tem 33 anos de idade é solteiro pai de 4 filhos, dos quais dois vao a escola. Fez a 9ª classe , responsabiliza se pela sua cunhada que vive com ele em sua casa

Muda se de Inhambane para o Distrito de Namaacha com seu tio para continuar com os estudos. Comeca a trabalhar na empresa G4S como seguranca. Trabalha das 7h as 14h no periodo da manha e das 14h as 22h no periodo da noite auferindo mensalmente 4.199.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa e conseG. poupar 1.000.00mt por mes.

Conhece a hluvuku atraves dos seus colegas que sao clientes da instituicao, nunca trabalhou com outros bancos. Este e o segundo emprestimo na hluvuku no valor de 12.000.00mt para compra de material de construcao da sua casa ( blocos, areia e pedrinhas). O emprestimo anterior  foi de 10.000.00mt usado para a legalizacao do seu terreno. 
 Pretende adiquirir mais emprestimos para concluir a sua obra.
texts.en:
Joaquim was born in Inhambane. He is a 33-year-old single father with four children. Two of the children go to school. Joaquim finshed ninth grade. He supports his sister-in-law, who lives with him in his house.

He moved from Inhambane to Namaacha District with his uncle in order to continue his studies, then began to work at G4S as a security guard. Joaquim works from 7:00 am until 2:00 pm on the morning shift and from 2:00 pm to 10:00 pm on the night shift. He earns 4,199 meticais per month, which he uses for household expenses. He is able to save 1,000 meticais per month.

Joaquim learned about Hluvuku through coworkers who are also customers of this institution. He has never worked with other banks. This is Joaquim's second Hluvuku loan, and he is asking for 12,000 meticais to buy construction materials for his house (blocks, sand and small stones). The previous loan was for 10,000 meticais and was used to register the title to his land.

Joaquim intends to get more loans in order to finish his house..

loans.use: to buy materials for home construction (blocks, sand and small stones).

loans.name: Adila

texts.en: Adila is a responsible and loving mother who is always thinking of the well-being and security of her family. She is 54. She is dedicated to poultry breeding  as well as cultivating agricultural products, which she sells at the market. In this way, she also feeds her family with vegetables and fruits. Her monthly profit is about $250. She usually sells her agriculture products and raised geese in the central Bilasuvar market. Adila's hope is to purchase more poultry, seeds and fertilizers to expand her business. To reach this goal, she is requesting a loan of 1000 AZN.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and organic seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YUNCAYPATA”; este banco muy simpático está ubicado a 30 minutos de la Ciudad del Cusco en el poblado llamado Yuncaypata, este es un típico pueblito en el que se conserva toda la herencia andina pura, y viven todos en comunidad apoyándose en la época de siembra y cosecha, cuidando a sus hijos y a sus animales, es un pueblo muy bonito y es quechua hablante, está en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia Ana ; es casada y tiene 35 años de edad; la socia es natural de Yuncaypata, la socia tiene 6 hijos;  de 17, 15, 12, 8, 5 años de edad; la socia se dedica  a la agricultura y a la crianza de vacas y animales menores como chanchos, cuyes, aves de corral,  la socia lleva a vender sus productos a uno de los mercados en la ciudad de Cusco, ella vende tarwi, trigo, papa, alverja, cebada. La socia desea seguir trabajando en lo que conoce, por lo que en esta ocasión desea el crédito para la compra de semillas para sembrar y mientras espera la cosecha ella trabaja con sus animales menores con la compra crianza reproducción y venta final. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas para sembrar papa, cebada, trigo.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente como lo ha ido haciendo con sus anteriores créditos.
texts.en:
Ana belongs to the Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata Bank. This friendly bank is located 30 minutes from Cusco in the town of Yuncaypata. It is a typical small town that preserves its Andean heritage. The whole community supports each other whether by helping out during planting and harvesting time, caring for children, or watching over animals. It is a beautiful Quechua-speaking town in the department of Cusco. 

Ana is 35 years old and married with six children, ages 17, 15, 12, 8, 5 respectively. She was born and raised in Yuncaypata. Ana works in agriculture and raises livestock including cows, pigs, guinea bigs, and chickens. She sells her products at the market in Cusco. She sells tarwi (an Andean bean), wheat, peas,potatoes, and barley. She hopes to continue working in the area where she has expertise. She will use the loan to purchase potato, barley, and wheat seeds to sow, and while she waits for harvest time she will work caring for her animals, which she purchases, raises, breeds, and then sells. 

She appreciates and is thankful for the loan made available by this medium. She pledges to be disciplined in making her payments just as she has been with her previous loans.

loans.use: to purchase potato, barley, and wheat seeds.

loans.name: Talibe

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune marié sans enfants.Avec des économies tirés de sa première activité de vente à la sauvette de vetements, il achéte à son oncle une alimentation qu'il paie mensuellement.Il y vend des denrées de consommation courante et arrive avec ses bénéfices à épargner tout en participant à l'alimentation de la famille.Il sollicite un pret de 300000f pour acheter 6 sacs de riz et 200 litres d'huile.Son ambitionest d'ouvrir un magasin de vente en gros de produits alimentaires.
texts.en: The borrower is a recently married man without children. With his savings derived from his first business venture, selling clothing, he has bought a food stand from his uncle  and makes monthly payments to cover  the cost. He sells staples food and manages to put some money aside while supporting his family. He is  requesting a loan of  300,000 West African francs in order to buy six bags of rice and 200 liters [about 53 gallons] of vegetable oil. His goal is to open a wholesale store of food products

loans.use: to buy six bags of rice and 200 liters of vegetable oil

loans.name: C9360 Abisunganye Group

texts.en: Davorose, 44 years old, is married and has three children between 3 and 7 years old. She is the leader of this group, which is called Abisunganye in the local language. Davorose has four years' experience selling various goods like beans, cassava, and sweet potatoes. In the photo, she is in the middle of the group. Davorose and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to expand their businesses and purchase more goods like beans, cassava, and sweet potatoes to sell. With profits from the loan, Davorose and her team would like to satisfy their families' basic needs and start saving for their future.

loans.use: to purchase more beans, cassava, sweet potatoes, and so on

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, 51, is married and has six children, two of whom are in school.

Maria is in the agricultural business, raising chicken in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Maria requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more feed and vitamins for her chickens.

In the future, Maria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more feed and vitamins for her chickens.

loans.name: Janna's Group

texts.en:
Janna is the leader of this group. She is 43 and married to a builder. Together with her husband, she has raised three sons. Two older sons live independently from their parents and the youngest son studies at school. 

A year ago Janna saved some money to rent a store. She started to sell different products such as beverages, chewing gum, and chocolate. She invests the profits gained from the trade back in her business, purchasing goods to increase the commodity turnover in her store. With money received from the loan she will mostly purchase beverages. In the future, Janna wishes to have her own store.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase beverages.

loans.name: Flor De Canela Group

texts.es:
Benito tiene 34 años el es parte del grupo Flor de Canela y dice que le pusieron ese nombre por que a uno de sus compañeros se le ocurrió ese nombre. El  es casado y tiene 3 niños los cuales estudian la primaria, el se dedica a cultivar nopales, chiles manzanos, duraznos, aguacate, zanahorias, papas, lechugas y mas vegetales, el tiene cultivando sus legumbres desde hace 15 años dice que su padre fue que le enseño el amor por la tierra y  dice que le gusta mucho su trabajo, abecés dice que también trabaja en la construcción en su localidad y en la capital de su país donde gana un poco mejor. Plática que el va a vender sus legumbres a la central de abastos de una población cercana a la de el y esta pidiendo un crédito para comprar abonos orgánicos e insecticidas para que sus vegetales se den de mejor calidad. La meta que tiene Benito es comprar planta de aguacate y hacer un huerto grande para vender por mayoreo ya que el tiene muy pocos árboles, dice que el esta muy agradecido por el crédito que le darán por que así la calidad de vida de su familia mejorara.
Los otros tres integrantes del grupo son Reynaldo, Mariana, Virginia ellos invertirán sus créditos en una peletería, en antojitos y en venta de frutas y legumbres de temporada.
texts.en:
Benito is 34 years old and is part of the group "Flor de Canela" or "Cinnamon Flower."  He says that they took that name because it struck one of the members of their group.  Benito is married and has three children who study in elementary school.  He works planting edible cactus, manzano chile peppers, peaches, avocado, carrots, potatoes, lettuce and other vegetables.  He has been cultivating vegetables for the past 15 years and says that his father was the one who taught him his love for the land and he says that he likes his work a lot.  He says that at times he also works in construction in his town and in the capital of his country where he can earn a bit more.  He notes that he is going to sell his vegetables in a central market in a town close to his own and he is asking for credit to purchase organic fertilizers and insecticides so that his vegetables will be of better quality.  Benito's goal is to purchase avocado plants and make a large garden in order to sell in bulk since he currently has very few trees.  He says he is very thankful for the credit that he will be given because it will help him improve the quality of life for his family.  

The other three members of his group are Reynaldo, Mariana and Virginia.  They will invest their loans in a fur shop, in appetizers, and in the selling of seasonal fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to plant and sell fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Abdul Rahman

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Abdul Rahman. He is married and has two children, aged 1 and 4 years. In 2006, Abdul Rahman established his used clothing business. He began his business by selling for a friend. He acquired enough experience and business skills from his friend's business, which lead him to establish his own business. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 3,941,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Abdul Rahman has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy bales of used clothing for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Abdul Rahman plans to own a store as he now has a stall, and also to expand to other areas in the township. Most of the suppliers are located in Freetown.  

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for bales of used clothing for his business.

loans.name: Sikimbilo Shg Group

texts.en:
Cleophas is the facilitator of the Sikimbilo SHG group. Cleophas and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Cleophas takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Cleophas had a very good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Cleophas was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Cleophas and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Cleophas will educate his children.

In 2012, the members of Sikimbilo SHG group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Nzingo

texts.en:
Nzingo is a 50-year-old hotel owner in Mariakani area. She is a married mother of six children and has been in this business for the past eleven years. She says that the business is doing great, and she is able to cater to her family's needs. 

Nzingo was introduced to KADET by another client, and this marks her first time borrowing to expand her business. She plans to purchase more stock of assorted foodstuffs such as beans, maize flour, and cooking oils for her hotel. 

She will use the anticipated profits to repay her KADET loan. She dreams of having a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of assorted foodstuffs such as beans, maize flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Maginda

texts.en:
52-year-old Maginda is a married woman with 7 children aged between 10 and 32. She is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. Maginda primarily grows rice crops to sell. Maginda works hard to help her husband provide for their needs and send their kids to school.

Maginda has requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Maginda hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Chin

texts.en:
A dweller in a rural village of the Sa Ang district of Cambodia, Chin is 54 years old. She and her husband are farmers in the village, and this business has been their main source of income for almost twenty-five years. Chin supplements her income by running a small grocery store in front of her house, selling eggs, detergent, soap, shampoo, biscuits, and other items. 

Chin received a loan from VisionFund one year ago, and she completely repaid her loan. Now she is applying for another loan with VisionFund. She wants to use this loan to buy more grocery items for her store, such as detergent, shampoo, cooking oil, eggs, and soap. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her grocery business and generate a larger income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for her store.

loans.name: Veni

texts.en:
Veni is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail stall where she sells school uniforms, especially sweaters. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located at a strategic place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of a permanent place to operate from. 

Veni will use the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more school uniforms to sell. Veni's hope and dream is to  run a well-stocked boutique within five years.

loans.use: To buy more school uniforms to sell.

loans.name: Pater's Group

texts.en:
Peter, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 14 farmers in Webuye District. He is 52 years old, is married, and has nine children.

Peter likes to think of himself as a very hardworking individual. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to consistently feed his family. Peter plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Peter’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 6.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Hello, world! Meet Jackson, an aspiring farmer from Manaret village. At a tender age, Jackson has embraced the spirit of entrepreneurship and is in farming to feed the rapidly growing population of Kenya. 

Jackson's main income source is milk. This year, he is exploring other opportunities in the agricultural sector. Moses is seeking a KES 30,000 loan from Kiva lenders to venture into poultry farming. Poultry farming has so many products and byproducts to offer. Poultry industry growth is also driven by the expanding hotel and tourism industry. 

Jackson believes there is so much to expect from this business move. Profits from this investment will be rolled back into the business to fuel growth.

loans.use: To diversify into poultry farming.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
ENGLISH

Araceli is from Veracruz and has 7 years living in Monterrey. She changed her city looking for a better life for her family. She is married and has three children, her husband currently works as a driver in a company. Araceli started her business because she wants to obtain an additional income for her home and to help her husband with the family expenses. At the beginning, she just had a few merchandise but with the pass of the time, her business has grown and transformed into a little store. Looking at the needs of her neighbors, she started to sell fruits and vegetables. Now she needs a credit to invest in her inventory and so she can have more merchandise to offer to her clients.

SPANISH

La Sra. Araceli es originaria de Veracruz y tiene 7 años viviendo en la ciudad de Monterrey, ella cambio su lugar de residencia para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, es casada y madre de tres hijos, su esposo trabaja como chofer en una empresa. Ella inicio su negocio para generar un ingreso adicional a su hogar y ayudar así con los gastos familiares, al principio solo tenia poca mercancía pero con el paso del tiempo noto que su negocio iba creciendo hasta que se convirtió en una tiendita, y debido a las necesidades de sus vecinos comenzó a vender frutas y verduras. Ahora ella requiere el crédito para incrementar su inventario y tener mayor mercancía que ofrecer a sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Alasgar

texts.en: Alasgar is 52 year old local. Since 2001 he has rented a booth in local market. He borrowed 4 loans from Normicro Beylagan branch and he has a good repayment history. His first loan was in amount of $400 and the last one was in the amount of $800. Now he needs $1000 to build his own shop and not to pay the rent for the booth in the market.

loans.use: To build his own shoe shop

loans.name: Guloysha

texts.en: Guloysha is 51 years old, and a resident of the Beylagan region of Azerbaijan. She breeds cattle in the house yard. Cattle breeding is traditional for rural areas. She currently has two cows and two calves. She sells livestock when they are grown, and meets the needs of the family for dairy products. She lost her husband and she has one son. She earns a living for the family this way. She wants to expand the business and have more cows. Therefore, she has applied to Normicro Beylagan branch. She needs to borrow $400 to buy one more cow.

loans.use: To buy one cow

texts.en: Mrs. T. is 32 years old, and her husband is 35 years old and has is own grocery shop in Hanoi.  She lives in Ninh Giang, a rural district in Hai Dung province, approximately 50 miles south east of Hanoi.  Her husband's shop opens before 7am and closes after 9pm.  This means that her husband is rarely at home because traveling 50 miles on a motorbike on bad roads takes time.  He comes home every 20 days.  They have 2 children, 4 and 13 years old, and they are both at school.  Besides raising ducks and pigs (although due to an epidemic she has no pigs anymore), she also has rice paddies.  She uses the rice to cook rice wine and then sells it.  She makes a profit of $31.00 per month.  To increase their income, she is requesting a loan to invest more in her husband's shop, so he will be able to create a bigger inventory, which will help them to increase their income.

loans.use: To invest in her husband's grocery store

loans.name: Zinab

texts.en: Zinab lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is young and talented. She is happy. She lives with her family. She is not married, and she helps her family. She is a tailor, and she learned tailoring from her mother. She started this business because there is no tailoring shop where she lives. She wants to take a group loan to buy new sewing machines so she can work hard and support her family and make a good future for herself.

loans.use: To buy new sewing machines

loans.name: Cryspian

texts.en: Mr. S. is a 33-year-old resident of Vituka in the Dar Es Salaam area. He has been doing business for the past 3 years and has recently received entrepreneurship training organized by the Youth Self Employment Foundation, which has greatly increased his business skills. Mr. S. owns a grocery store in the Vituka area, but wants to expand it into a larger wholesale store. He is needs a loan of $450 to help him achieve this goal.

loans.use: To expand his grocery business into a larger wholesale store

loans.name: Luisa María

texts.en:
Luisa María, 47, is married, with twelve children (eleven girls and one son). They all attend the secondary school of the town.

Luisa María and her husband are butchers. Her husband’s works in breeding the animals. Luisa dedicates herself to the sales of the animals. She has fitted out a space next to her house and there she operates the business. She also sells fried maniocs and fried chickens.

She explains that she had been running that business for more than ten years, but she was obliged to stop the operations because of health issues. Fortunately, she recovered her health and she could restart the business two years ago. Now the business generates a weekly profit of USD 70.00.

Luisa María is asking for funds to make the business progress. She wants to improve the hygienic conditions of the space where her husband and she run their business. Given the loan, Luisa María will be able to remodel the location where the shop is operated, offer better services to her customers, and will assure the quality of the goods she is selling to people.

loans.use: Remodel the location where business is operated in order to improve the hygienic conditions of the place.

loans.name: Claudia María

texts.es:
Claudia T. has a business selling fish in the city of Chinandega. She is the mother of two daughters who attend school in the community. She began her business 8 years ago with a small investment, making periodic trips to the sea to buy the best fish, and later selling it in the Chinandega central market. These travels have meant higher costs for Claudia, and she realized the need for a loan from Ceprodel to grow her business. For the last two and a half years now she's had much better results with her business.

From the moment she began to utilize the loans, she's had many benefits, including the acquisition of her own space in the central market from where she sells her seafood.

Claudia T. es una dama que se dedica a la venta de mariscos en la ciudad de Chinandega. Es madre de dos niñas que actualmente cursan su primaria en un colegio de esta comunidad.

El negocio de la señora T. inicia hace 8 años con una inversión de C$ 1000 utilizando la forma de trabajo la cual consiste en realizar viajes esporádicamente al mar en donde compra los mejores mariscos para luego venderlos en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega. Esto ha causado que la señora T. incurra en gastos de transporte por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de realizar prestamos en Ceprodel (13 créditos) desde hace dos años y medio obteniendo mejores resultados para su negocio.

Desde el momento que comenzó a utilizar los créditos que le brindara Ceprodel ha obtenido numerosos beneficios siendo el principal de ellos la adquisición y construcción de un local propio en el mercado Central de Chinandega que es donde actualmente se mantiene vendiendo en el sector de los mariscos.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE FISH FOR HER SEAFOOD BUSINESS IN THE CENTRAL MARKET.

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
Karla V. lives on the outskirts of the city of Managua in a community called Los Cuarezma. She was born on March 25, 1972 to a humble family. With a lot of sacrifice, she managed to earn her teaching certificate. She is currently working as a teacher and has 15 years of experience in the profession.

Karla is 35, married, and has two children - a 13-year-old daughter and a 10-month-old baby. Her husband is a sales executive at a business that sells staple grains. This couple supports each other in their subsistence, and has managed to get ahead. Her goal now is to invest in her home to make it more comfortable for her children. She needs the loans to rebuild the kitchen and laundry area that are in poor condition.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Karla V. habita en las afueras de la ciudad de Managua, en una comunidad llamada Los Cuarezma. Nació un 25 de marzo de 1972, proviene de una familia muy humilde y con mucho sacrifició logró forjarse como Licenciada de Pedagogía y actualmente se desempeña como docente, teniendo 15 años de experiencia en esta profesión.

Karla tiene 35 años, es casada, con 2 hijos, una niña de 13 años y un bebé de 10 meses. Su esposo es Ejecutivo de ventas en una empresa que comercializa Granos Básicos. Esta pareja se apoya mutuamente para lograr subsistir y han logrado salir adelante. Su meta ahora es invertir en su vivienda para hacerla más cómoda para sus dos pequeños, requeiren el préstamos para reconstruir el area de cocina y de la lavandería, que no se encuentra en muy buen estado.

loans.use: Rebuild her home's kitchen and laundry area

loans.name: Nabweru North Ii Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Margret S.. She is currently in the business of poultry farming and is requesting a loan to buy more poultry feed. Margret is 44 years old and is married. Her husband is a farmer. She has 6 children ranging from age 7 to 28 and three of her children go to school. Each week, Margret makes approximately UGX 55000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to add to the business. Margret has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to buy poultry feed and the loan was paid back on time.

Margret is joined in her small group by Safina N., Grace K. and Nansamba K.. Safina N. has a business selling fresh foods and wants to increase stock. Grace K. is currently operating a business trading goats and wants a loan to purchase more goats from villages. Nansamba K. operates a drug shop business and wants to purchase more drugs to sell.

loans.use: To add working capital to poultry business

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
Ernestina N. sells stationery and cosmetics. She is married and has no children. Business is going very well and she plans to increase sales, which will improve her income and enable her to support her family.

She is asking for $225.00 as additional capital to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more stationery and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Halima

texts.ru:
Halima B. is 42 years old, she has 7 children. Her husband is working in Russia. Halima sells homemade kefir and milk. Now, she has 4 cows, and she gets from them 5 liters of milk per day; she milks the cows twice a day. Halima's daughter helps her take care of the animals.

Halima decided to purchase more cows. This is why she came to Microinvest.

Халима Бобомуротова женщина в возросте 42 года замужем, имеет 7 детей, муж на заработках в России. Сама Xалима занимается бизнесом по продаже домашнего кефира и молока. Oна имеет сейчас 4 коров с которых получает в день с каждой по 5 литров молока, доит их в день 2 раза , утром и вечером. По уходу за скотом ей помогает дочь. Поэтому Халима решила увеличить колличество скота в кредит. Для чего она и обратилась в Микроинвест.

loans.use: To purchase more cows

loans.name: Yenni

texts.es:
Yenni is a mother who is very dedicated to the care of her children. One year ago, she decided to start a business producing bricks as a source of income that would allow her to maintain her 2 children, who are still small, and support her husband so that he may become the best engineer in their city. She wishes to increase production and expand her market for which she requests a loan that will be invested in the purchase of basic materials needed for the production of bricks.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Yenni, es una madre de familia muy dedicada al cuidado de sus hijos. Desde hace un año decidió incursionar en la fabricación de ladrillos como fuente de ingreso que le permita sostener a sus 2 hijos que son todavía pequeños y apoyar a su esposo para convertirse en el mejor ingeniero de su ciudad. Ella desea incrementar su producción y expandir su mercado para lo cual solicita un préstamo que será invertido en la compra de insumos necesarios para la fabricación de los ladrillos.

loans.use: Purcahse materials for the production of bricks.

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Bun S. is 29-years-old and lives in Cambodia with her only child. To support her family, S. sells roast beef, pork, and chicken in her town. With hopes of growing her business and making it more efficient, she is now applying for a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike.  With this motorbike, she will be able to have her own means of transportation and increase the sales area for her food products. S. is pictured here preparing some of those products.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike in order to transfer and sell food products

loans.name: Helen Ruth

texts.es:
Doña Helen is a 41-year-old single woman living in her own home 4-1/2 blocks from the municipal theater. She has two children, a married son and a daughter living with her who is in her third year of secondary school. Doña Helen has worked with Fundacion Leon 2000 for 10 years, during which time she has invested in her business and acquired housing where she also has her small business. She has gradually been improving her beauty salon in order to provide suitable service to her clientele.

Her business was started because she needed to be self-employed. Since she had completed a beauty course and did not have other employment, she decided to open her own beauty salon herself with the help of Fundacion Leon. Her big dream is to be able to air-condition and expand her salon, in order to support her children's professional development.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

Doña Helen tiene 41 años de edad es soltera, vive del teatro municipal 4 cuadras y media al sur vive en casa propia, tiene dos hijos uno ya esta casado y la otra es una niña vive con ella es menor de edad cursa el tercer año de secundaria , Doña Helen tiene de trabajar con fundacion leon 2000 10 años tiempo durante el cual ha sabido invertir en su negocio y adquirir una vivienda siendo esta donde actualmente tiene su pequeño negocio. En su pequeño salon de belleza ha venido poco a poco mejorandolo de esta manera ofrecer un servicio adecuado a su clientela negocio dio origen como una necesidad de crear su propio autoempleo, ya que ella habia adquirido un curso de belleza y no tenia otro empleo decidio poner su propio salon de belleza con esfuerzo propio y apoyo de nuestra isntitución, su mayor sueño es poder acondicionar y ampliar mas su salon de belleza, así como poder apoyar a sus hijos a que se desarrollen profesionalmente.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou N. est une veuve de 57 ans, mère de 10 enfants avec 03 autres en charge. Elle souhaite un prêt pour renforcer son activité de vente de fruits locaux (mangues) afin de subvenir aux besoins familiaux. Elle pourra ainsi améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et assurer une bonne scolarité à ses enfants. <b>Elle va rembourser ce prêt en une seule échéance au bout de six mois<b/>.
texts.en:
Fatou N., 57, is a widow, mother of 10 children, with three others for whom she is responsible. She is hoping for a loan to bolster her business selling local fruits (mangoes) so that she can better support her family. This will allow her to improve living conditions for her family and ensure a good education for her children. She is going to reimburse this loan in one single repayment at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of local fruit (mangoes)

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Thorn S., 52, sells rice noodles in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Rice noodles are served with blue or red soup. The blue soup is only cooked with fish and the red can be cooked with chicken or pork. There are many kinds of vegetables that they have to eat with the rice noodles, such as banana blossom, long bean, and many kinds of mints. 

Mrs. S.'s husband, Va Thoeun, 53, drives a motor-taxi around the market in the village. The couple has five children, one of whom is a student. The others are employed as garment factory workers. 

Mrs. S. is requesting a loan of US$1100 to build a bigger stand to sell groceries so they can earn extra profits.

loans.use: To build a stand and sell groceries.

loans.name: Ladis Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Ladis del Socorro, habita junto a su papá y su mamá en la zona No. 3, en juigalpa chontales, por esfuerzo de sus padres logró calificarse como técnico en administración de empresa y labora para gasolinera Shell como secretaria; debido a la temporada lluviosa su familia se ve afectada por el mal estado del techo de la vivienda y el deterioro de los pilares de madera, su sueño es lograr reparar estas partes de su vivienda y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus padres ya que ella representa el sosten familiar, para lo cual solicita financiamiento
texts.en:
Mrs. Ladis Del Socorro lives with her parents in Zone 3 in Juigalpa Chontales. Thanks to the effort of her parents, she is a qualified business woman who works as a secretary for the oil company, Shell. Due to the rainy season, her family has been affected by the faulty ceiling of their home and the deterioration of the wood pillars. Her dream is to repair these parts of her home and improve the living conditions of her parents because she is the supporter of her family. For this reason, she is requesting financial help.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fix the roof and wood pillars of her home

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith O. is 30 years old. She is married but does not have any children.
