For a living, she sells provisions and foodstuffs. She also sells pure water and drinks. She combined these businesses together to enable her to support her husband and help meet the family expenses.

She now needs a loan of N100,000 so she can purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a bull

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en:
Tuy S., 37, is married and has two children who are enrolled in school. She owns a business selling a variety of vegetables at an open-air market and can typically make about US$ 5/day in income. She started her business in 1979 when she was liberated from the Khmer Rouge “Pol Pot regime” which is a black period in Cambodian history, killing nearly three million Cambodians.

Her husband can typically make US$ 2.40/day in income from working as a motor-taxi driver transporting passengers to different locations in his community. The motor-taxi business in Cambodia right now is getting better because the price of gasoline keeps going down from day to day. The price is 3000 Riel per liter as compared to the inflationary period when it was about 5800 Riel.

Tuy S. has recently requested a loan to purchase more vegetables to expand her inventory as the Lunar New Year is coming soon, so the inventory expansion is a priority to allow her to meet the needs of about two or three times as many customers as she usually has.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to expand her inventory to meet her growing customer demand

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La señorita Marina es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del río blanco” comunidad Chipana, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia Del Collao, Departamento de Puno; de  26 años de edad, estado civil soltera, no tiene hijo, posee estudios de primaria completa.
Trabaja desde tres años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, posee un negocio compra y venta de quesos, chuño, maíz y otros; su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para acopiar quesos y comercializarlos en los mercados de Tacna e Ilave.
Ella desea mejorar su negocio de quesos, y quiere llevar este producto a otros mercados (Cuzco y Arequipa), con este préstamo de  S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles podrá comprar mayor cantidad de quesos asimismo ella desea comprar mas chuño negro y blanco; de esta manera piensa obtener mas ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su hogar, finalmente se compromete a pagar puntualmente su  préstamo en cinco cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Marina is a member of the communal bank "Las Brisas del Rio Blanco" located in the Chipana community, Pilcuyo district, Del Collao province, Puno department. She is single, 26 years old and has a son. Marina finished grammar school. She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years. She has a business buying and selling cheeses, dried potatoes, corn and other products. Her first loan was in the amount of $100 which she used to purchase and sell cheeses in the markets of Tacna. Marina wants to improve her business and wants to take her cheeses to other markets (Cuzco and Arequipa). With this loan of $950 she will be able to purchase a greater quantity of cheeses as well as dried potatoes. This will allow her to obtain more income so that she can improve the quality of life in her home. Finally, she promises to pay her loan in five monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a greater quantity of cheese and dried potatoes.

loans.name: Farida's Group

texts.en:
Farida N. is a devoted and hardworking lady with a business selling old clothes to customers in the various market areas. She has been in the business for over 10 years now, which has won her many customers. The only challenge she has now is over moving to various destinations on a truck which is a bit risky for one’s life but apart from that, she loves what she does.

She wakes up early in the morning and attends to her farm as well as arranging her home and after that she sets out to go and sell clothes. She has been able to buy a plot of land, build a house and buy many household items, making her standard of living better. Farida needs a new loan to help with stocking her business with a new bale of clothes from Kampala that will fetch more money.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes in a bale for sale.

loans.name: Mchicha Group

texts.en:
Amina A., age 34, is divorced with three children, ages eight, five and three. She sells charcoal. She started this business two years ago and works daily from 6am until 7pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $149. 

This will be Amina’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her capital and  repaid the loan successfully. She now hopes for a second loan to increase her stock by buying more sacks for charcoal storage.
 	
Amina will share this loan with her loan group, Mchicha, which totals twenty members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Amina is in a yellow dress at the top in the middle.

loans.use: To increase stock by buying more sacks for charcoal storage.

loans.name: Afi Delali

texts.fr: A. delali a commencé en 2004 le commerce de charbons de bois, avant elle  était la seule à exercer ce commerce dans son quartier, elle réalisait de bon chiffre d’affaire mais actuellement d’autres femmes ont commencé ce commerce, voulant surmonter cette concurrence et regagner la confiance de ses clients elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour augmenter son stock de charbons de bois.  Elle est mariée et a 04 enfants.
texts.en:
In 2004, A. Delali started doing commerce in charcoal. In the past, she was the only one in this business in her district. She used to realize good sale figures. But right now, other women have started in this business. Wanting to overcome this competition and to regain the trust of her customers, she’s requesting her first loan from WAGES, so as to increase her stock of charcoal. She is married and has four children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Ndiaya

texts.fr: Ndiaya S., 48 ans est célibataire avec une charge familiale de 04 enfants et 04 autres personnes. Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis 2 ans et demi Son activité  est la vente de tissus et de beurre de karité  Ndiaya veut  renforcer son commerce pour avoir plus de revenus Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Ndiaya S. is 48 years old and single. She is responsible for raising four children and four other dependents. She has been a member of the village bank for two and a half years. She sells cloth and shea butter. Ndiaya wants to bolster her business in order to make better revenues. She will repay this loan in one lump sum at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell cloth and shea butter

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio Huanta vive con sus padres en la calle 3 de diciembre de la zona de LLojeta de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja como vendedora en una tienda, el crédito que solicita es para pagar sus estudios y poder buscar un trabajo mejor, ya que como vendedora el salario que percibe es mínimo.

Es cliente de Impro y pago muy bien, por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Rocio Huanta lives with her parents on 3 de Diciembre (December 3rd) Street in the Llojeta zone of La Paz city. She works as a store vendor. The loan she is requesting will be used to pay for her studies so that she can look for a better job, as she is currently earning minimum wage at her sales job. She is a client of Impro and has a good history of repayment, therefore she is qualified to receive a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Education

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Enrique G. es casado y todavia no tiene hijos.  Inició su negocio con un capital de Gs. 3.000.000. - son $ 260.- aproximadamente, en el rubro de compra venta de divisas y compra de tarjetas para teléfonos celulares.  Su capital fue ampliando con el correr de los años ya que cuenta con una amplia clientela, porque la zona en la que se encuentran es muy poblada y muy concurrida. Su negocio se encuentra en la Terminal de Omnibus de Asunción, y desde hace más de 12 años.

El señor Enrique G. retira el préstamo para la compra de divisas, de esta forma ofrece sus servicios para dar satisfacción a todos los clientes, quienes son en su mayoría turistas y extranjeros.  Uno de sus apiraciones es poder abrir un salón comercial próximamente, refaccionando su vivienda y asi podría ampliar el negocio en lo que se refiere  al equipamiento o mobiliario y poder ofrecer un ambiente más cómodo y ameno a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Enrique G. is married, but does not have children yet. He started his business with approximately $260. He changes currency and sells cards for cell phones. With the passage of the years, his capital has been growing because he has a large client base. This is because his zone is very crowded and heavily populated. His business has been located in the Terminal de Omnibus de Asunción for over twelve years. Enrique G. will use the loan to buy currencies and provide services to satisfy all of his customers. The majority of his customers are tourists and foreigners. One of his aspirations is to open a commercial place of business. Then, he would refurbish his house. This way he would be able to expand his business with new equipment and furniture. Then he could offer his customers a more comfortable and pleasant atmosphere.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell currencies, buy cards for cell phones

loans.name: Marta Elena

texts.es: Marta Elena R. D. O. D. 49 años D. edad vive en Mejicanos ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Marta vive con sus tres hijos y su esposo. Jorge el esposo D. Marta trabaja como albañil y Marta se dedica a su negocio donD. venD. adornos, artesanías, peluches entre otros, Marta cuenta con 17 años D. experiencia en su negocio  donD. todas sus ventas y compras en mercadería siempre las hace al contado, ella solicita este crédito por que quiere surtir su inventario variedad D. productos que sus clientes le demandan.
texts.en:
Marta Elena R. D. O. is 49 years old and lives in Mejicanos located in the department of San Salvador. Marta lives with her three children and her husband. Marta's husband, Jorge, works as a mason and Marta sells ornaments, craftworks, cuddle toys, among others. Marta has 17 years of experience in her business where the buying and selling transactions are always in cash. She requests this loan as she wishes to supply her stock with the variety of products required by her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supply for business.

loans.name: Haydee De Jesús

texts.es: Haydee D. Jesús O. D. G. D. 45 años D. edad, resiD. en Cojutepeque junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos. Ella posee un bazar en el mercado D. Antonio Mejía en Cojutepeque y comercializa ropa, zapatos accesorios para el cabello, regalos para toda ocasión y así mismo cajas y bolsas para guardar los regalos. Haydee solicita un préstamo ya que desea surtir su negocio, ella desea aprovechar al máximo las ventas que realiza y es por esto D. espera obtener más productos para su negocio y así mismo obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Haydee D. Jesús O. D. G. is 45 years old and lives in Cojutepeque with her husband the three children. She owns a bazaar in the Antonio Mejía market in Cojutepeque and sells clothing, shoes, hair accessories, and all occasion gifts as well as boxes and bags to store gifts. Haydee is seeking a loan so she can stock her business. She wants to take the maximum advantage of the sales and in this way she hopes to obtain more products for her business and generate greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise for her bazaar

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma F. is from the village of Barangay Poblacion, Iligan City. She is 56 years old, is married, and has six adult children. Vilma operates a family member's business primarily providing lot rental services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over forty years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In July 2009, Vilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in renovating the business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in renovating the business

location.town: Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Bewondo Ii Group

texts.en: Kumba is a 33-year-old mother, married with 3 children. She has been involved in the sale of fish for the past six years. Kumba attracts her customers by always selling good, fresh fish and encourages customers with reasonable prices. She hopes for better education for her children as well as medical care.

loans.use: wholesale fish, barriers, drums, baskets, etc.

loans.name: Zeny

texts.en:
Zeny M. is from the village of Lawa-an. She is 50 years old. Zeny is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Zeny sells a variety of different vegetables in the local community. Zeny has been in business for over four years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Zeny joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zeny has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Zeny is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Zeny from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sengulu Nambozo Jackyln Group

texts.en: N. Jacklyn is a business woman of thirty-seven years, married with three children whom one is schooling and she looks after two dependents schooling too. She is operating charcoal business for so far eight-years. She is requesting for the loan to purchase bags of charcoal at least 100 bags and above to supply as a wholesalerto retailers and also sell to his usual customers. She is a hardworking business woman whose dream is to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase bags of charcoal at least 100 bags and above to supply as a wholesalerto retailers and also sell to his usual customers.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn D. is from the city of Pagadian City. She is 23 years old. Jenelyn is married. To make a living, Jenelyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jenelyn has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 4,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jenelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000.00 PHP from PMPC. Jenelyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jenelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Angelica Joao Da

texts.pt:
Angélica da C. é natural de Maputo tem 34 anos de idade casada e mãe de 6 filhos com idades entre 13 a 26 anos destes os 2 mais novos ainda vão a escola e 2 mais velhos já casados. Frequenta neste momento a 12ª classe depois de ter interrompido na 6ª classe devido ao casamento precoce. Vive na casa própria e para alem dos filhos sustenta mais 2 netos que vivem com ela.

Ela nunca mudou de cidade, já a 24 anos que começou a trabalhar na DIC (Direcção Nacional de Identificação Civil) actualmente afecta na Matola rio e tem um salário mensal de 3.290.00mt. Consegue ainda poupar algum porque tem um outro rendimento proveniente da actividade comercial, cerca de 6.000.00mt por mes.

Nunca pediu empréstimos em outras instituições de crédito, conheceu a Hluvuku através da sua irmã que também é cliente da mesma. Este é o seu quarto empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar cimento, chapas de zinco e outros, os valores anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt,13.000.00mt e 15.000.00 todos para a mesma actividade.

Os desafios que ela encara é o elevado custo de material de construção, assim pretende pagar bem o seu empréstimo para garantir os próximos créditos sem problemas para aceder a mais empréstimos no futuro com o objectivo de concluir a sua obra e comprar uma viatura.
texts.en:
Angélica da C. is from Maputo. She is 34 years old, married, and has 6 children between the ages of 13 and 26. The two youngest still attend school and the two oldest are already married. She currently attends 12th grade, after having interrupted her education in the 6th grade, due to her early marriage. She lives in her own home, and besides her children, she also supports two grandchildren who live with her. Angelica never left the city. When she was 24 years old she began to work at the DIC (Directorate of Civil Identification). She currently works in Matola-Rio and earns a monthly salary of 3.290.00 MT. She manages to save a bit because she has additional income from business activities, around 6.000.00 MT per month. She has never requested a loan from other institutions. She learned about Hluvuku from her sister who is also a client. This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku, for the amount of 20.000.00 MT, which she plans to use to purchase cement, sheets of zinc, etc. Her previous loans were for 10.000.00 MT, 13,000.00 MT, and 15,000.00 MT, all for the same purpose. The challenge she faces is the high cost of construction materials. She therefore plans to pay her loan properly to guarantee future loans without problems, so that she can have access to future loans to complete construction and purchase a vehicle.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials (sheets of zinc, cement, sand, etc. )

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 37 years old, married to Beth Wambui, and they have four school-going children. James has been operating his motorcycle transportation business in Naivasha town for the past year. James was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He intends to buy a new motorcycle with the money from the loan and employ someone else to operate it for him as a taxi. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle for his transport business

loans.name: Oyla

texts.en:
Oyla S. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcohol and is requesting a loan to purchase more materials to use.  Oyla is 38 years old and is married to a businessman. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a retail shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to use

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.fr: A. Dorcas est née vers 1978 à Avrankou, dans le département de l’Ouémé au Bénin. Dorcas vit à Vakon Azohouè non loin de Porto-Novo, et est mariée à DJOÏ Jonas, un chauffeur. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Dorcas vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Depuis près de 20 ans, Dorcas vend des légumes et des condiments de sauce à Ouando à Porto-Novo. C’est à Ikpinlè et à Dangbo, au Sud du Bénin, que Dorcas fait ses emplettes. Dorcas a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. En vue d’accroître son activité et de mieux satisfaire les demandes des consommateurs, Dorcas sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Dorcas envisage acquérir sa propre parcelle et construire plus tard sa maison, grâce à ses économies.
texts.en:
A. Dorcas was born in 1978 in Avrankou, within the county of Ouémé in Bénin. Dorcas lives in Vakon Azohouè, not far from Porto-Novo, and is married to Djoi Jonas, a driver. The couple has four children, all of whom are attending school. Dorcas lives with her husband and children. Together, Dorcas and her husband pay for the family's expenses. For the past 20 years, Dorcas has sold vegetables and sauces in Ouando, which is in Porto-Novo. Dorcas purchases her supplies in Ikpinlè and in Dangbo, in the south of Benin. She has previously benefitted from 3 loans with ALIDé, all of which she fully repaid. In order to grow her business and better satisfy the needs of her clientele, Dorcas is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé. Dorcas hopes to purchase a parcel of land and later build her own home, with the help of her business.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various vegetables and sauces

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is 35 years old and a petty trader. She is married and mother to five children. All her children are now in school and her husband is a farmer and petty trader.

Adwoa is a very resourceful mother whose hard efforts give hope and transformation to the family. Adwoa supports her kids through the sale of used clothing, curtains and bedsheets. Selling used clothing, curtains and bedsheets has a very big market share in Ghana as brand new ones are very expensive for the economically active poor. Therefore selling used clothing has created a market for many women.

Adwoa has been in this business for six years now. She travels to a nearby city called Kumasi to purchase her stock of goods. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing to increase her inventory. She normally concentrates on bedsheets and used towels. She believes this loan would help her save for her children's future and also to rent a store to sell out of as she currently sells through hawking.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Unidas” se formó con la unión 15 vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano R.Alonso. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas.
1.Las integrantes constituyen un grupo muy solidario y organizado,demuestran compañerismo y están formando una muy linda amistad con el Comité. 
2.Ademas las integrantes del Comité tienen interés en continuar mucho mas allá del año 2009.
Todas las integrantes del comité son madres que se dedican a varias actividades con el fin de fortalecer la economía de la casa.
1
Ignasia S. 
Despensa

texts.en:
The Committee “Mujeres Unidas” was formed with the union of 15 neighbors in the city of Mariano R.Alonso. All of the members of the committee work in independent activities, like sales. 1. The members form a very supportive and organized group; they show companionship and they are forming a very nice friendship with the Committee. 2. In addition, the members of the Committee are interested in continuing past 2009. All of the members of the Committee are mothers who dedicate themselves to different activities with the aim of strengthening family finances. 1 Ignasia S. grocery store owner 2 Paola C. food sales 3 Raquel Corvalán Clothing sales 4 Blanca R. cosmetic sales 5 Graciela G. drink sales 6 Sandra S. grocery store owner 7Juana D. domestic worker (cleaner) 8 Cristina A. Fruit, Vegetables, natural herbal remedies sales 9 Juana G. nurse 10 Buenaventura G. International cook 11 Teresa M. fruit sales 12 Maria A. ice cream sales 13 Gabriela O. kiosk 14 Narcisa C. dress maker 15 Eustaquia C. dress maker

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for the grocery store( rice, noodles, candy, dairy products, baked goods, soft drinks, etc) the purchase of clothing, the purchase of fabric for making clothes, the purchase of drinks, the purchase of ingredients to prepare food, the purchase of ice cream, the purchase of notions, the purchase of fruit and vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique, trabaja en una consultora y también en el restaurant de comida rápida  “pollos copacabana”.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de tembladerani de la ciudad de la Paz; vive en la casa de sus padres, pero es independiente ya que con su trabajo se solventa los gastos de alimentación, estudios y otros.
El crédito será destinado para salud (tratamiento completo de su vista y medición de lentes).
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial lo califica como cliente bueno en  el pago se sus cuotas. Con este crédito le podremos ayudar para que pueda desenvolverse bien en las actividades que realiza.
texts.en:
Enrique works at a consultancy firm and at Pollos Copacabana, a fast food restaurant. He lives in La Paz, in the area called Tembladerani. He lives at his parents' home, but earns his own living and is able to cover his own expenses for food, schooling and other necessities. He will use the loan for medical expenses (eye treatment and prescription for glasses). This is the second time he has requested a loan at Impro. According to his file, he has met his loan payments in the past. We hope that this loan will help him do well in his work and other activities.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To cover eye treatment and prescription for glasses.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora D. is from the city of Mantic Tangub City. She is 63 years old. Teodora is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Teodora owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling crabs in the local community. Teodora has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Teodora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teodora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from GDMPC. Teodora is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Teodora from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Dulamdorj

texts.en:
Dulamdorj is 59 years old. She lives with her husband and son in the Chingeltei District of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  She and her family live in a "ger," a yurt or Mongolian nomadic tent. They used to rent a place to live, but with the profits from their business, they bought their own tent, and the whole family now lives in it. Dulamdorj's husband and son run a taxi service using their own car. 

Dulamdorj sells traditional Mongolian clothing at her own counter in the Narantuul Market, one of the biggest markets in Mongolia. She started her business in 1990. Originally, she sewed traditional Mongolian clothing to supply to the  Narantuul Market's sales people. At that time, her total working capital was 500,000 tugrugs (~ $351 USD), and average monthly sales revenue was 1,000,000 tugrugs (~ $700 USD).  Now she has expanded her business, and her total working capital is 2,100,000 tugrugs (~ $1477 USD) and average monthly sales revenue is 2,000,000 – 2,500,000 tugrugs (~ $1565 USD).  

She has a great business mind and says “I would like to expand my business and workplace.” She is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug (~ $2100 USD) loan to purchase a large amount of material to prepare for the Mongolian Lunar New Year celebration. During this holiday, customer demand  is very high.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of material to make traditional Mongolian clothes to sell

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel V. V.  de 39 años de edad, reside en el pueblo de Panchimalco, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposa la cual es ama de casa y junto a sus tres hijos de 11, 9 y 7 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Miguel posee una venta de tortas, las cuales son hechas de carne, aderezos, escabeche, aguacate y jamón. Su venta está ubicada en las afueras del Estadio Mágico González, lugar en el cual ya tiene 9 años de vender su productos, el cual es consumido por las personas que pasan por el lugar, trabajadores y atletas que entrenan diferentes deportes dentro del estadio. A pesar que es un negocio pequeño Miguel obtiene ganancias diarias muy buenas, las cuales en su mayoría son destinas a los gastos del hogar, lo que no le ha permitido poder ser propietario de su propio carretón, el cual es en el que cocina la carne y prepara las tortas, ya que el que posee es la actualidad es alquilado y debe pagar diariamente por el. Miguel solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar su propio carretón, lo cual sería de mucha ayuda para él ya que no tendrá que pagar diario por alquilar uno. Miguel es un hombre lleno de muchos deseos de seguir adelante y de trabajar más para brindarle todo lo necesario a su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel V. V. , 39, lives in the town of Panchimalco, San Salvador department, with his wife, who is a housewife, and their three children, who are 11, 9, and 7 years of age, who are students. Miguel sells tortas (a sandwich-like dish) made from meat, sauces, pickled vegetables, avocado and ham. His cart is located outside the Mágico González Stadium; he has been located here for 9 years. His main customers are passersby, workers and athletes who train in different sports inside the stadium. Despite it being a small business, Miguel earns good daily profits, most of which are destined to household expenses. This has prevented him from owning his own sales cart in which he cooks the meat and prepares the tortas; the one he has is leased and he must pay a daily rental fee to use it. Miguel is asking for funding so that he can have enough money to buy his own cart. This would be of great benefit to him because he will no longer have to pay a daily rental fee for one. Miguel is filled with desire to succeed in life and to work even harder to provide for all his family's needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sales cart.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a 39-year-old single mother of two from Paraíso de Cartago located in the central valley of Costa Rica. She has had to fight hard in order to improve living conditions for herself and her two children.

Patricia has worked over the past ten years selling podiatrist (foot treatment) services. She learned how to work in podiatry as an employee in a clinic many years ago. She opened her business with an initial investment of 20,000 colones. She specializes in providing podiatry services to clients living with diabetes as well as to seniors.

This will be Patricia’s second loan with Fundación Mujer; her first loan was paid back on time and in full. Her goal is to increase her client base in order to earn more revenues and continue to provide a quality standard of living for her children.

In a good month Patricia might earn 600,000 colones and in a bad month, only 200,000. She dedicates eight hours a day to her business, while her children are at school. Patricia hopes to use the revenues from her business to finance housing costs, invest in home improvements, re-invest in her business, make contributions to her savings, and to repay her loan.

The income generated from Patricia’s business represents 90% of family income and is used to finance the living expenses of Patricia and her two children. Her long term goals are to open her own clinic and to invest in higher quality education for her children. 

Recently, Patricia had a car accident. The use of her vehicle is central to the operation of her business as she uses it to visit clients and carry out her daily routine. She will use this loan to finance repairs to her car so that she can continue to work towards the expansion of her business. At the moment, she is using a car borrowed from a friend to conduct her business.

Patricia says her only obstacle is time. If she had somebody to help her perform some of her domestic tasks, she would be able to dedicate more time to her business.

loans.use: To repair her car which she uses in her business

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing is a single lady about 24 years old. She trades to earn a living in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells clothes. Initially she hawked her clothes to make sure there were sales. But recently she rented a shop that is yet to be completed. Blessing said that she rented the shop and bought some of her goods with her previous loan from LAPO Microfinance. She is asking for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more clothes and repair the shop. This will attract more customers and she can increase her business and profitability. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and repair her shop.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Mrs. T. is 52 years old and since 2005 has made a living by selling groceries. Among the items she sells are various cooking ingredients, soft drinks and sweets for kids. She buys these items in bulk on credit from a wholesaler and pays for them after they are sold to her customers. She earns about $2 a day to help support her six children and her husband, who is a farmer. Mrs. T. is looking to increase her income by buying a small plot of land in a good location on which she can farm, and has applied for this loan to help pay for it. She will also use her savings to fund the purchase.

loans.use: To buy a small plot of land.

loans.name: Abby

texts.en:
Abby cooks and sells cassava dough. This is one staple food in Nigeria mainly eaten in the Eastern, southern and western part of Nigeria. She has been in this business for long. She hopes for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more cassava to cook more cassava dough to sell. 

Abby is 50 years old and she is married with 6 children. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava

loans.name: Las Leonas Group

texts.es:
Las Leonas así se denominan el grupo integrado por  Lea del Carmen Sánchez Castañeda,  Ana Marlene L. Solís y Vilma Leonor M. C. tres féminas trabajadoras y luchadoras quienes día a día se esfuerzan por mejorar y darle un mejor futuro a su familia.

La coordinadora del grupo es Lea del Carmen C. quien desde 2001 inicio con el comercio de sabanas y ropa de manera ambulante los cuales distribuye en Villa fontana y Ticomo. Ella con el préstamo invertirá en sabanas, toallas, colchas y pacas de ropa.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Ana Marlene L. Solís quien desde hace 30 años vende ropa y cosméticos y Vilma Leonor M. C. quien vende carne, pollo y ropa desde hace 12 años.
texts.en:
The group made up of Lea del Carmen Sánchez Castañeda, Ana Marlene L. Solís and Vilma Leonor M. C. is called “The Lionesses.” These three hard-working and tenacious women go out to work every day in an effort to improve and provide a better future for their families. The group coordinator is Lea del Carmen C. who has sold bed linen and clothing door-to-door since 2001 in Villa Fontana and Ticomo. She will use the requested funds to buy sheets, towels, bedspreads and bundles of clothing. Her fellow group members are Ana Marlene L. Solís who has sold clothes and cosmetics for the last 30 years and Vilma Leonor M. C. who has sold meat, chicken and clothes for the last 12 years.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bed linens and bundles of clothing.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
41-year-old Dolores C. is from the town of Surallah. She is married and has four school-aged children.

Dolores owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She also raises some hogs. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-three years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

Dolores joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Dolores is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure and feed for the hogs. This loan will be her sixth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure and feed for her hogs

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen V. is from the village of Poblacion Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old, married, and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Helen owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, & toothpaste in the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Helen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Helen is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Helen from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase tomatoes, onion, potatoes, cabbage

loans.name: Tsendsuren

texts.en:
Tsendsuren H. is 44 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Hovd province, western Mongolia, in their own house. His two children attend a local middle school, while his wife helps with his business. Tsendsuren operates a clothing trade business, along with working as a doctor in his town's police department.

He began his clothing trading business in 2005, and he has quickly found success. He works very hard to understand his new business and has already gained much experience. He knows he must continue to work hard and improve his selling skills if he wants to improve his business. He says, "In the future, I hope to expand my business so that I can improve our family's quality of life. My wife also wishes to create her own workplace as a small sewing shop." Tsendsuren is requesting a 4,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a variety of clothing for the upcoming academic new year.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Benkadi 1(Entente) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI  est constitué de femmes mariées du village de Warasso dans l’ex l’arrondissement de Kimparana du cercle de SAN, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et au moins 5 enfants.
Elles cultivent  de l’arachide et du maïs. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. 
KOROTOUMOU S., la présidente du groupe, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture. Elle s’approvisionne  au grand marché de Kimparana. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 30 000 à 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of married women from the village of Warasso in the former quarter of Kimparana in the SAN circle, in the Ségou region (the fourth largest administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families. They are all around 35 years old and have 5 children on average. They grow peanuts and corn for a living. With the aim of boosting profits from their agricultural activities the group's members have decided to seek a loan from Soro Yiriwaso. KOROTOUMOU S., the group's president, aims to use the loan to purchase a sufficient quantity of peanut seeds, small tools and other inputs for cultivating these crops. They source their goods from Kimparana. Following wintering of the crops the harvest is stocked for a given length of time so that it may accrue value before being sold at the same market and in the neighbouring markets for retail and bulk sales. Sales are usually cash-based and the customers usually come from large towns. The group's members aim to each generate between 30 000 and 45 000 FCFA which will be used to repay the loan and to meet their families' expenses.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inputs, seeds and small tools

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: Rosmery, de 29 años, es una joven madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo Alex de 29 años, quien trabaja en lima y sus dos hijos, Jefferson de 9 y Grisell de 5 años, a quienes desea brindarles una buena educación. Con mucho esfuerzo Rosmery ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva espinacas, zanahorias, lechugas, productos que son llevados a vender al por mayor en la ciudad de Lima. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta lima, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. En adelante, espera mejorar sus cultivos y poder así tener mejores ingresos. Este es el décimo crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono para que pueda mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Rosmery, age 29, is a young mother who is very cheerful and hard-working. She lives in her own house together with her husband Alex, age 29, who works in Lima, and her two children, Jefferson, 9, and Grisell, 5, for whom she wants to provide a good education. With great effort, Rosmery has been able to work her fields and make them very productive. She grows spinach, carrots and lettuce, products that are taken to sell wholesale in the city of Lima. Her crops have provided the necessary income to support her family, and for this reason, she wants to put all of her profits into improving this business. What she likes best about her work is taking care of her crops. She has done this work for 6 years, and she thinks the hardest part is transporting her products to Lima, since the sacks that she carries are very heavy and make her quite tired. In the future, she hopes to improve her crops and thus earn a better income. This is her tenth loan with MFP; she has been very punctual with the previous loans, and she plans to do the same now. Within her communal bank, she is a very participative member, and she is always up to date with the agreements made within her group. With the 500 Peruvian new soles she is requesting, she will buy fertilizer to improve her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fertilizer

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad P. is from the village of Palattao, Naguilian, Isabela. She is 41 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, she sells eggs in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $225 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Caridad joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Caridad is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more products to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie L., 25 years old, is a sari-sari storeowner. She is also a farmer.  She is doing these activities to be able to purchase items to fulfill the needs of their family. She has one son. She is saving money for her to support for the needs of her son.

She would like to apply for a loan of PHP 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise to resell and purchase farm supplies. In that way, she will be able to offer her customers with more products with variety and supply her farm of needed inputs. She likes the CEVI services because she is also covered by micro-insurance benefits.

loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise to resell and farm supplies.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia tiene 27 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su esposo y a su hijos en el sector Pueblo Libre del distrito D. TambogranD., una zona agrícola que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia D. Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más D. tres horas y media D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Ella cuenta con una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para efectuar servicios D. transporte) con la cual su esposo se encarga D. brindar servicio D. transporte D. carga y pasajeros. Adicionalmente cuentan con una pequeña parcela D. terreno en donD. siembran mango y limón para venderlos a las plantas procesadoras D. la zona.

Silvia desea realizar algunas reparaciones en su mototaxi ya que el continuo uso otrogado y el estado accidentado D. las carreteras han hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunas fallas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder mejorar su calidad D. vida y la D. su familia.
texts.en:
Silvia is 27 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children in the Pueblo Libre area of the TambogranD. district. It is an agricultural area located in the province of Piura, in the region of the same name. It is a little more than three and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

She has a motorcycle taxi ( a vehivle like a motorcycle that has a cabin attached to function as a transportation service) . Her husband is in charge of offering the transportation of cargo and passengers. They also have a small parcel of land where they grow mango and lemon to sell them to the area proessing plants. 

Silvia wants to do some repairs on the motorcycle taxi since its continuous use and the poor condition of the roads has maD. it start to suffer some damage. That it why is has been in her best interest to ask Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for a loan of 500 nuevos soles which will help her attain her goal.  

She is a very calm and resposnible woman. Her greatest wish is to keep growing as a business woman and be able to improve her quality of her life and her family's.

loans.use: Repair and maintenance expenses for a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Phei Ro Group Loan

texts.en:
Eleven women in Krasaing Chrum Tabong village in Kampong Thom Province have formed a group loan. The eleven members of this lending group are part of AMK’s Loan Workout Program. All clients have outstanding loans that are delinquent and they are currently unable to pay back the full amount of their existing loan.

Their business ventures, which they funded using their existing loan, have failed, putting them in a very unfortunate position. In addition, less work at garment factories and sickness in their families have drastically reduced other sources of income for each family. All eleven clients will use their loan to start a new business making ties and pillow cases.

As part of AMK’s workout program, each client is given a workout loan that will be used to purchase sewing machines, an electricity line and additional sewing equipment. AMK has hired a tailor to train the group to make ties and pillow cases. The material will be provided by AMK to ensure that quality material is used and so that the clients do not have to purchase it themselves.

AMK has partnered with Ahkun.org to sell their ties and pillow cases online. Fifty percent of all profits will go to this group and the other borrowers in their village who are unable to repay their loan.

This program is in contrast to the traditional ways that microfinance institutions deal with delinquent clients.  These traditional ways are:
• By rescheduling the loan and pushing off the problem to another day
• Repossessing items that the clients own, including their house or land.

Because of AMK’s strong social mission, AMK has created this program to provide an alternative solution to one of microfinance’s dark sides. We hope that Kiva Lenders will support us in this initiative.

loans.use: To start a new business making ties and pillow cases.

loans.name: Javier

texts.en:
Javier lives in the village of Pan de Azucar in the district of Oyotun.  The region is primarily rural with many small farms.  Javier and his wife  own  their home and a small plot of land nearby.  Javier is 67 years old.

For over thirty years Javier has planted various crops on his land and worked as a farm hand for his neighbors.  He is a very hard working and strong man, traits which have earned him great respect in the region.  He is always ready to help and provide a friendly slap on the shoulder to someone in need.

Javier plans to invest the loan proceeds in additional seeds and fertilizer in order to obtain a good crop in the coming growing season.  He hopes to be able to increase the yield on his land and replenish the nutrients in the soil.  He is always proud to see the land produce under his diligent care.

loans.use: To purchase seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Casimiro

texts.es:
Casimiro A. G., quiere empezar el nuevo año  con la posibilidad de tener  unos más novillos  para venderlos a muy buen precio.
El tiene mucha experiencia en la ganadería, y en este momento necesita un préstamo de ₡500 000  (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de  3 novillos para engorde, con el fin de venderlos a u mejor precios el próximo año. De esta manera y aprovechando su experiencia  se va asegurar una fuente de ingresos para  mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. 
Don Casimiro es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal  Florida S.A, una de las más de 100 organizaciones  socias de EDESA.
texts.en: Casimiro A. G. wants to begin the New Year with the possibility of having more cattle to sell at a good price.  He has a lot of experience with livestock and now needs a loan of ₡500 000 (500 hundred thousand  colones) to purchase 3 steers to sell next year at a good price.  In this way he will ensure a source of income to improve the quality of life of his family.  Don Casimiro is a partner of the credit business in the community of Florida S.A., one of the more than 100 EDESA partner organizations.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia B. lives in the Kamwokya neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has two children whom are in school. She also takes care of her father. Sylvia has a business of selling shoes. She has been in this business for five years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Sylvia sells her products at the market, by means of retail.  Sylvia has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second hand shoes. The main business challenges for Sylvia are defaulters and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and also to build her own house. Sylvialives in a home that she rents, she doesn’t have access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent, food and medication.

loans.use: To buy second-hand shoes for sale

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
As the saying goes, opportunity knocks only once. Arlene V., knows this truth and grabs every opportunity that comes her way. Arlene, 41, reached high school and is married to Rolando, a businessman. Together they are raising five children, of whom two are in elementary, one in high school, and the other two still staying at home. Together, they live in Pasay City, Philippines.

Arlene presently runs a sari-sari (variety) store, in which she sells items that are needed daily by neighbors in her community. Products on her shelves range from soap bars to candies and energy drinks to rice.  Having been at least ten years in business, she knows to pay her dues on time. She also has an excellent reputation with her fellow community partners in CCT* and, most importantly, her customers. Monthly she is able to earn a net income of Php 10,000.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She intends to use this money to purchase more products for her store, all the more now that the Christmas season is fast approaching. Arlene plans to take this opportunity to drive her business toward more profitability.

Arlene's life is never without challenges, both in her business and in her personal life. Nonetheless, she stays focused on the opportunities that lie ahead, and not on the failures of yesterday or the worries of today.


*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: additional stock to replenish current inventory

loans.name: Gladys Yoni

texts.es:
Gladys tiene 30 años y vive con su pareja y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Poroy de la ciudad del Cusco. El distrito de Poroy se encuentra ubicado a 25 minutos de la plaza de armas de la capital arqueológica de América del Sur (Cusco). 

Gladys tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de golosinas de forma ambulatoria en su pequeña carreta. Hace varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va regular. 

Gladys espera recibir S/.1000 nuevos soles de crédito, ella utilizará este dinero para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo chocolates, chicles, dulces, galletas y muchas cosas más. 

Gladys pertenece al banco comunal “Mama Simona” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el quinto año de funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva.

Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos de los Incas, la ciudad del Cusco está construida en la base de la antigua ciudadela Inca.
texts.en:
Gladys is 30 years old and lives with her partner and two children in Poroy district, in the city of Cusco.  Poroy district is located 25 minutes from the main square of the archaeological capital of South America (Cusco).

Gladys has a small business selling candies.  She makes her sales from her small cart as an itinerant street vendor.  She has been in this business for several years and it is going OK.

Gladys hopes to receive a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles which she will use to buy merchandise such as, for example, chewing gum, cookies, etc.

Gladys is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Mama Simona" community bank.  The community bank has been going for five years and is well run by its board of directors.

Cusco is a delightful city which dates back to Incan times.  The city of Cusco is built on the site of the ancient Incan citadel.

loans.use: To buy chocolates, gum, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Tserennadmid

texts.en: Tserennadmid, 36, is widowed and lives with her three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her children live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent. All her three children attend school. Tserennadmid operates a clothing trading business to support her family. She started her business in 2003 by selling a variety of clothing items out of a rented space in Narantuul, the main and largest outdoor market in the city, with the help of her husband. Her husband passed away two years ago; therefore, she runs her business all by herself. Her business is located in a popular spot of the market that attracts many customers. She is working hard to raise her children as a single mother. Tserennadmid is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to import more clothing items from Erlian, a border city of China.

loans.use: To import more clothing items

loans.name: Kaadija Enole

texts.en:
Kaadija Enole K., a 35-year-old married mother of seven children, has been farming her own piece of land for the last four years. Kaadija Enole learned about KADET LTD from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her third loan with which she is planning to buy fertilizer and three bags of wheat and maize. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

An assiduous woman determined to achieve her goals, Kaadija dreams of buying a good house and expanding her farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and three bags of wheat and maize.

loans.name: Ngô's Group

texts.en:
L. Ngô Thị (20211040008) is a 25-year-old female who lives in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  L. is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Tiên Trà 1 - Nhóm 04 (nhóm 04).


L. is married and has 2 school-aged children. She operates a family member's business, manufacturing & selling wood products to local businesses and community members. L. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7.840.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. She is now requesting a new loan of 6.496.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital.  This will be her 4th loan from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nghiêm Thị P. (0) is a 40-year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.


2.  Nguyễn Thị T. (0) is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her service-based business.


3.  Nguyễn Thị S. (0) is a 19-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her furniture making business.


4.  Nguyễn Thị S. (0) is a 40-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her recycling services.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


L. Ngô Thị (20211040008) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  L. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Tiên Trà 1 - Nhóm 04 (nhóm 04).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các P. thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng gỗ cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa P..  L. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, L. kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, L. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  S. hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  L. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 7.840.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô để sản xuất các sản phẩm bổ sung.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.496.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nghiêm Thị P. (0) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


2.  Nguyễn Thị T. (0) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


3.  Nguyễn Thị S. (0) là 19 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


4.  Nguyễn Thị S. (0) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ tái chế.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

loans.name: Rodolfo Roberto

texts.es:
Rodolfo Roberto G. Q. tiene 27 años, es soltero vive  con la madre en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. No tiene hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  JUNTOS TRABAJADORES AGRICOLAS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Matilde Esther  pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 9 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de cacao, café y naranja.

Rodolfo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, café y naranja. Compra sus productos en  Mata de Cacao cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos de cacao, café y naranja.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir sembrando.

Le gusta la familia por que es muy responsable y trabajadora y le gusta festejar el carnaval.
texts.en:
Rodolfo Roberto G. Q., 27, is single living with his mother in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.  He doesn’t have any children.

The JUNTOS TRABAJADORES AGRICOLAS (Agricultural Workers Together) communal bank is located in Matilde Esther which is part of Chillanes canton.  It has nine members who are cocoa bean, coffee and orange farmers.

Rodolfo grows cocoa beans, coffee and oranges.  He buys his supplies in Mata de Cacao at the end of each month and sells at the Chillanes farmers market on Sundays.

He is asking for a loan to buy supplies for his cocoa bean, coffee and orange crops.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  The challenges he faces are infestations, illnesses and weather variations.  His dream is to continue planting.

He enjoys his family because they are responsible and hard working and he enjoys celebrating Carnival.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies for cocoa bean, coffee and orange crops.

loans.name: Kandalat

texts.ru:
Кандалат Мамажанова родилась в городе Ош (Ошская область, Кыргызстан). Замужем и проживает с мужем, сыном, снохой и двумя внуками.
Кандалат родилась в 1953 году в простой и многодетной семье фермера. С раннего возраста помогала матери по дому и была самостоятельным ребенком. В 1972 году, после окончания школы, Кандалат поступила в Национальный университет на биологический факультет. В 1977 году, окончив обучение, Кандалат вернулась в город Ош и устроилась на работу в среднюю школу, в качестве учителя биологии. Став матерью двоих детей, она продолжала работать в школе, а супруг занимался полеводством.
В 1982 году Кандалат стала директором школы, где проработала до 2008 года. Из –за низкой оплаты, в 2008 году Кандалат решила оставить работу в школе, и вместе с семьей переезжают из Оша в село Новониколаевка (Чуйская область, Кыргызстан). Они покупают дом со всеми необходимыми хозяйственными постройками и участок земли в 3 гектара для выращивания фруктов и овощей. 
В данное время, благодаря упорству и трудолюбию Кандалат, в хозяйстве у нее имеется 1 дойная корова, 3 теленка и 1 бык, также ежегодно на своем участке в 3 гектара и на арендованных 14 гектарах, она выращивает фрукты, овощи, а также сажает зерновые культуры и клевер, необходимый для содержания собственного скота. Кандалат запрашивает кредит в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для покупки семян арбуза, пшеницы, а также для покупки двух бычков для откорма. 
Со временем, Кандалат мечтает расширить площадь сарая, увеличить поголовье скота и купить благоустроенный дом в городе Карабалта (Чуйская область, Кыргызстан).
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.
texts.en:
Kandalat M. was born in the city of Osh (in the Osh region of Kyrgyzstan). She is married and lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law, and two grandsons.

Kandalat was born in 1953 into a large and simple farm family. From an early age, she was an independent child who helped her mother with the house. In 1972 after leaving school, Kandalat entered the national university to study biology. In 1977, she graduated, returned to the city of Osh, and  got a job teaching biology in high school. She had two children and continued to work at school while her husband worked in agriculture. 

In 1982 Kandalat became the principal of the school, and she worked there until 2008. Because of the low salary, in 2008 Kandalat decided to quit and she and her family moved from Osh to the village of Novonikolaevka (in the Chuysky region in Kyrgyzstan). They bought a house and a three-hectare plot of land to grow fruit and vegetables.

At present, thanks to Kandalat’s persistence and diligence, their holdings include one milk cow, three calves, and one bull.  Additionally they grow fruit, vegetables, and the grain and clover to sustain their own cattle on their three hectares and fourteen hectares they rent. Kandalat is asking for a loan for 100,000 som (KGS) to buy watermelon seeds, wheat, and two calves for fattening. In time, Kandalat dreams of expanding their shed, increasing the number of livestock they own, and buying a nice house in the city of Karabalta (in the Chuysky region of Kyrgyzstan).

loans.use: to purchase seeds, wheat, and cattle.

loans.name: Estacion De Amor Group

texts.es: En esta fotografia se muestra al grupo llamado “ESTACION DE AMOR” el cual esta ubicado en el estado de Puebla, México. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes. La señora Maria Teresa P. es una de las integrantes del grupo y se dedica  a la elaboración de bordados como sueters, bufandas, bolsas entre otras,  esta activiadad la realiza desde hace 4 años, las clientas comentan que el trato es muy bueno y los pagos son razonables. Ella es conocida por mucha gente que le compra. Este credito lo destinara para el pago de los pedidos que le solicitan para realizar sus entregos y las ganancias que obtenga las inverte en hilos y estambres para sus bordados, ella quiere posteriormente agrandar su negocio y comprar una maquina de bordar. En un futuro la señora Teresa tiene el firme proposito de construir un establo para sus animales pues tiene vacas las cuales estan en su patio amarradas. Ella tiene 42 años y estudio hasta el sexto grado de primaria, es divorciada, tiene 3 hijos,  1 hombre y 2 mujeres.
texts.en: In this photograph the group called “ESTACION DE AMOR” [Love Station] can be seen. It is located in the state of Puebla, México. The group is made up of 9 members. Mrs. Maria Teresa P. is one of the members of the group and she does embroidery on things such as sweaters, scarves, and bags, among others. She has done this activity for 4 years. The customers remark that the service is very good and the payments are reasonable. She is known to many people who buy from her. This loan will be used to pay for the orders she has so that she can make her deliveries. She will use her earnings to invest in thread and worsted yarn for her embroidery. In the future, she wants to enlarge her business and buy a sewing machine. Teresa also has a frim plan to build a stable for her animals. She has cows, which are tied up in her patio. She is 42 years old and finished sixth grade. She is divorced and has 3 children, 1 boy and 2 girls.

loans.use: to invest in thread and worsted yanr for embroidery

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice is currently in the business of selling Irish potatoes. She is 30 years old and married with six children, only two of whom go to school. Joice borrowed a loan to stock more Irish potatoes to sell. She hopes to expand her business with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: to stock more Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a shop in a good location

loans.name: Leilita

texts.en:
Leilita is from the village of Sinayawan, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 37 years old. Leilita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Leilita owns & operates a business making and selling snacks & other delicacies, like rice & cheese cakes, in the local community. Leilita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Leilita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leilita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional ingredients & working capital. Leilita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed, like flour, eggs & powdered rice. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Leilita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed, like flour, eggs & powdered rice

loans.name: Jekadi Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les 7 femmes du groupe JEKADI IV sont toutes mariées et vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux-parents, belles-sœurs à KAPALA. Elles ont en moyenne 28 ans, au moins 3 enfants. Le village est un chef lieu de commune situé à environ 17 km  de la ville de Sikasso troisième  région administrative de la république du Mali.  
Elles font essentiellement la culture du pois sucré  avec WASSA..
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leur activité agricole, les membres du groupe ont donc décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année. Elles sont à leurs premiers cycles de prêt de campagne. Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter,  une quantité suffisante de semence de pois, des intrants et des équipements appropriés pour sa production et sa récolte.
