WASSA compte acheter,  1 sac d’urée, 2 sacs de complexe. 
Ces équipements et intrants seront achetés au grand marché de Sikasso. Après les récoltes en fin de campagne, les produits sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso en détail (souvent en gros) à divers client.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 55.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The seven women who make up the JEKADI IV group are all married and live in big traditional extended families with their children, husbands, parents-in-law, and sisters-in-law in KAPALA. They are on average 28 years old and have at least three children. The village is a county seat situated about 17 miles from the town of Sikasso, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They essentially grow sugar peas, as does for example WASSA. 

Wishing to make their agricultural activities profitable, the members of the group decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso this year. They are on their first seasonal loan. The loan itself will be used to buy a sufficient quantity of pea seeds, entrants, and appropriate equipment for their production and harvest. WASSA intends to buy one sack of urea and two sacks of a fertilizer complex. 

This equipment and these entrants are purchased at the big market in Sikasso. After the harvest at the end of the growing season, the products are stockpiled for a certain time so that their value rises before they are sold retail (often wholesale) at the big open-air market in Sikasso, to various customers. 

WASSA expects to make an average profit of 55,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the interest on the loan and to pay everyday expenses for her  family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural entrants.

loans.name: Santos Epifanio

texts.es: Santos Epifanio tiene 43 años, su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene más de 5 años, en este tipo de negocio, inicio con un dinero que le habían prestado pues a pesar de que no era mucho capital compro ciertos productos fue así que ha logrado hacerse poco a poco de su propio negocio, es una persona muy responsable y disfruta de proporcionarle a sus 3 hijos los ingresos necesarios. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos, trajes, camisas entre otros.
texts.en: Santos Epifano, 43, sells general merchandise. He has been doing this for more than 5 years. He started with money from a loan, and in spite of the fact that he didn't have much capital he bought certain products and little by little has made his own business.  He is very responsible and enjoys giving his 3 children the money they need. The requested loan is for the purchase of pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, suits and blouses, among other things.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, suits and blouses, among other things

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 26 years old, married and has one child.

Maher has owned an agency since 2003 for renting and selling cooking utensils.  He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and he has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $3000 loan to enlarge his agency and to add more inventory. He is aiming to earn more profit so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To enlarge his agency and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose sells cooked yam and gari at Elmina in the Central Region. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. Rose has been selling yam for six years. She assists her husband to pay school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more yams to cook to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy land.

loans.use: to buy more yams

loans.name: Erwin Daniel

texts.es:
Erwin Daniel tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero, vive con su mamá y sus hermanos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C JESUS NOS AMA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Los Amarillos, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol Gandul.

Erwin  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol Gandul. Compra sus productos en Agroquímicos El Copa y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.
 
Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de abonos e insumos  para los cultivos.   El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como enfermedades en los cultivos como cinta roja en el maíz. Su sueño es ampliar su producción e incrementar sus ganancias. 

Le gusta estudiar y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Erwin Daniel is 21 years old. He is single and lives with his mother and brothers in the Ventanas canton in the Los Rios province. 

The members of the JESUS NOS AMA [Jesus Loves Us] community bank are located in the community of Los Amarillos, which belongs to the Ventanas canton. This bank works with short cycle agricultural work such as planting corn, rice and gandul beans.

Erwin grows corn, rice and gandul beans. He buys his materials in Agroquímicos El Copa and sells his products in the wholesale market of Ventanas.
 
He is asking for the loan to plant corn and to buy fertilizer and materials for the crops. The loan will serve as support to meet his financial needs and improve his farming activities as well as face challenges such as crop diseases like the "red ribbon" in the corn. His dream is to grow production and increase his earnings.  

He likes to study and play sports.

loans.use: to plant corn and buy fertilizer and ingredients for his crops.

loans.name: Soumaïla

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Soumaïla a 35 ans, marié et père de quatre enfants, il réside avec sa famille à Sanoubougou II Extension de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Soumaïla après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, s’est initié  il y a douze ans aux activités de commerce d’articles divers dont il dispose une boutique devant le domicile conjugal où il mène cette activité d’achat et vente des articles tels les Cigarettes,  les bonbons, allumettes, Cheeving Gum, lait en poudre, Thés, sucres, savons, insecticides etc. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ une année. Il est à son premier prêt qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 10 cartouches de Cigarettes différentes, 2 sacs du sucre, 8 cartons du thé, 4 paquets de bonbons, 3 paquets de Cheeving Gum, 10 paquets d’allumettes et 5 cartons de savons. 
Ses marchandises sont achetées auprès de commerçants grossistes de la ville avant de les revendre en détail dans sa boutique située à Sanoubougou I.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 120 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Soumaïla is 35 years old, married and the father of four children. He lives with his family in Sanoubougou II Extension, in Sikasso (third administrative district of the republic of Mali). 

He tried several different activities without success, then thirteen years ago, he began selling miscellaneous items. The goods, such as cigarettes, candy, matches, chewing gum, powdered milk, tea, sugar, soap, insecticides, etc., are sold from his shop in front of the family home. He is in high demand because of the quality of his products. To meet the demand of an increasing number of customers, he decided to join micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso about a year ago. He is on his first loan which will be used to buy 10 cartons of various cigarettes, 2 sacks of sugar, 8 cartons of tea, 4 packets of candy, 3 packets of chewing gum, 10 packets of matches and 5 boxes of soap. He buys the merchandise from wholesalers in town, then re-sells at his retail shop located in Sanoubougou I.

With the loan, he plans to make a monthly profit of 120,000 CFA francs which will mostly be used to increase his business capital, contribute to the family's expenses and to pay interest on the loan.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru:
Наргиза трудолюбивая, честная и добрая женщина. Она со всеми общается с улыбкою и всегда старается сделать всем добро. Она замужем и любящая мать 2 детей. Более 11 лет она занимается купля продажей продуктов питания на местном рынке. Она начала свой бизнес с продажей мелочевки, а затем постепенно перешла на продаже продукты питания. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свой прибыль. Она хочет, устроит своих детей в хорошую школу и поэтому ей нужна денег.  По этой причине она запрашивает займ для покупки нового ассортимента продуктов, который позволяет ей максимизировать свой прибыль.  Наргиза хочет заранее благодарить вас за вашу помощь и поддержку.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Nargiza is a hard-working, honest and kind woman.  She interacts with everyone with a smile and always tries to show kindness for everyone.  She is married and a loving mother of two children.  She has been involved in buying and selling food products at the local market for over eleven years.  She started her business with selling small items and then gradually moved to selling food products.  Nargiza wants to expand her business and maximize her profits.  She wants to place her children into a good school and needs money for that.  This is why she is requesting a loan for the purchase of new assortment of products, which will let her maximize her profits.  Nargiza wants to thank all of you in advance for your help and support.

loans.use: to purchase food products

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 57-year-old married man. He is a father of three children, and has worked as a blacksmith since 25 years ago.

Hussein is an expert in his field; he is a hard worker who devotes his whole life for the sake of his family and business. Hussein improves himself and his work a lot; he works hard on it all the time, especially through updating his tools and machines used. That's why he requested a loan from Al Majmoua to buy new tools necessary to make his work easy and with good quality.

Hussein has been an Al Majmoua borrower for two consecutive loan cycles, with a good history. He has a good quality of work with the best price given. Hussein is also going to help his son with building his house. 

He hopes he can expand his shop more in the future to take more requested projects.

loans.use: To buy new tools necessary for his business.

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora María Guadalupe esta agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudo invertir en su negocio. 

Está solicitando un préstamo para comprar más variedad de mercancía, ya que desea invertir en comprar artículos escolares, que son (cuadernos, lapices, colores, plumas y carpetas, también comprar ropa de temporada de inviernos) para estar preparada ya que sus clientes le están solicitando ya este tipo de mercancía.

Doña María Guadalupe planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas del negocio. Ya que su esposo el señor Moisés se encargara de los gastos familiares y escolares de sus dos hijos, con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como chofer de una camión de carga. 

Desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y que su negocio tenga mucha más mercancía.
texts.en:
María Guadalupe is grateful for the assistance of her previous loan, which she was able to invest in her business.

She is requesting a loan to buy a greater variety of merchandise, since she wants to invest in buying school supplies, which are notebooks, pencils, colored pencils, pens, and folders.  She also wants to buy winter clothing to be ready for the season, since her customers are already asking her for this type of merchandise.

María Guadalupe plans to repay the loan with her profits from her sales in her business, since her husband, Moisés, will take responsibility for the family and school expenses of their two children with the salary he receives from his job as a cargo truck driver.

She hopes to improve the quality of life of her family and she wants her business to have much more merchandise.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as school products and winter clothes.

loans.name: G.s. Las Chacaras Group

texts.es: Marcia Mercedes y Maria Luisa conforman el grupo solidario Las Chácaras. Ambas tienen diferentes actividades económicas, pero han logrado salir adelante por medio de sus esfuerzos. Maria Luisa se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace más de 30 años que tiene este medio de vida, tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo ella es una madre responsable que disfruta de realizar este negocio que le proporciona los gastos necesarios para su hogar. El motivo del crédito es para la compra sandias, melones, mangos, naranjas, entre otros productos.
texts.en:
The Las Chácaras solidarity group has two members, Marcia Mercedes and María Luisa.  They have different economic activities, but both have managed to get ahead through their efforts.

María Luisa has been selling fruits and vegetables for more than 30 years.  She has three minor children.  She is a responsible mother who enjoys her business, which provides her the necessary expenses for her home.

The reason for the loan is to buy watermelons, melons, mangos, and oranges, among other products.

loans.use: to buy watermelons, melons, mangos, and oranges, among other products.

loans.name: Adpat 8 Group

texts.fr: Ce groupement se trouve dans une région proche de la capitale du Sénégal. C'est un groupement qui est constitué de cinq femmes, leur principale activité est le commerce. Seynabou est leur présidente, elle fait du commerce depuis plus de 10 ans. elle sollicite ce prêt dans le but d'augmenter leur stock de marchandises. Avec ce crédit elle compte acheté des produits de mer comme (des poissons, des crevettes, des crabes) qu'elle va revendre au niveau du marché locale. Espérant que ce prêt lui permettra d'augmenter son pouvoir d'achat puisque la demande est supérieur à l'offre. Elle veut faire beaucoup de profits pour aider son mari dans les dépendes de la maison.
texts.en:
This group is found in a region near the capital of Senegal. It is comprised of five women, and their main work involves commerce. Seynabou is their president. She has been in commerce for over ten years. She is requesting this loan with the goal of increasing their stock of merchandise. With this loan, she intends to buy some seafood (such as fish, shrimp, and crabs) that she is going to resell at the local market. 

The hope is that this loan will enable her to increase her buying power, since the demand is greater than the supply. She wants to make much more in profit in order to help her husband to cover household expenses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 40 years old, married, and has four children.  He lives in Kasese, Uganda. He has been a farmer for eight years, focusing on coffee, vanilla, and bananas.  He also raises goats.  He started with a small piece of land but now has three acres. Nelson also does carpentry to supplement his income for the well-being of his family. 

Nelson is requesting for a loan, which he will use to buy more land for his coffee plantation. His hardship is limited capital; his vision is to have more acres of land so that his plantation will be able to generate high levels of produce leading to higher income.

loans.use: To purchase land for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Erdenetsetseg

texts.en: Erdenetsetseg is 46 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar City, Mongolia. Her husband runs a woolen clothes manufacturing business, her elder daughter is studying in Malaysia, and the younger one is studying in China. She used to work with her husband at his manufacturing business, but in 2010, she started her own garment retailing business by renting two counters in the biggest market in Mongolia. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "Now that my kids are studying abroad, I need to expand my business in order to support them." She is requesting MNT 1,500,000 to buy more garments.

loans.use: to buy more garments.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar sigue participando en el banco comunal “Ricchary  Runa” de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Cesar sigue trabajando como seguridad de una empresa privada en la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios años que se dedica a brindar servicios de seguridad a la empresa privada y le va muy bien. 

Cesar en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para gastos familiar como por ejemplo para la alimentación, vestimenta, educación y otras cosas más.

Cesar se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Cesar continues to participate in the Communal Bank “Ricchary Runa”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco. He still works as a security guard for a private company in the city of Cusco. Cesar has been providing security services for his employer for several years and has done very well.

He is taking this opportunity to request a loan to pay for family expenses such as food, clothing, education, and other items. Cesar is grateful for the opportunity being given to him and promises to complete his payments on schedule.

loans.use: to pay for family expenses such as food, clothing, education, and other items.

loans.name: Rosa Maribel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Inmaculada se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi (Portoviejo), cantón conocido  por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 20 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de tres y de un año y medio. Su esposo es albañil. Ella lleva cinco ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos.

Es una joven ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo en la dura tarea de mantener el hogar  se  dedica a la cría y venta de chanchos y pollos, ella compra estos animalitos cuando aun están pequeños y luego los tiene por espacio de tres a cuatro meses hasta que tengan un peso adecuado para después venderlos a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa, para luego llevarlos a los mercados de otras ciudades. Su esposo le ayuda cuando puede en la alimentación y cuidado de los animales. Lleva dos años con esta actividad y le gusta porque se gana algo sin salir de su casa.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar alimento y medicinas tanto para pollos y chanchos y poder aprovechar la época que se avecina donde hay bastante venta de estos animalitos.
 
Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The María Inmaculada communal bank meets every 15 days in the parish of La Sequita de Montecristi, Portoviejo. The area is known for the famous "panama"-style hats made of toquilla straw, which are well known in the country and abroad.

This is where Señora Rosa lives. She is 20 years old, and is married with two children, one aged 3 and one ages 18 months. Her husband is a bricklayer. She has been with the communal bank for five loan cycles, and she likes it because of the very low interest rates available. 
She is a young housewife, who helps her husband to provide for the family by raising and selling pigs and chickens. She buys the animals while they are still small and keeps them for three or four months, until they are a sufficient size to sell. She sells them to dealers who come to the house and take the animals to be sold at markets in other cities. Her husband helps her when he can, with feeding and caring for the animals. She has been working in this way for two years, and she likes it because it means she can earn some money without leaving the house.

Rosa plans to use the loan to buy food and medicines for her chickens and pigs, to be able to make the most of the coming season when sales are likely to be good.

Her dream is to give her children the best she can.

loans.use: To buy food and medicines for her pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Moustapha

texts.fr:
Moustapha, âgé  de 48 ans fait du maraichage depuis prêt de 12 ans. Il est marié et père de sept enfants. Il fait de la culture de légumes : carotte, oignon, choux. Il fait aussi du commerce de gasoil.
Avec le prêt il veut acheter des semences et de l’engrais pour faire du maraichage.
Il arrive à couvrir les dépenses de son foyer avec les revenus de son activité. Et aimerai dans l’avenir faire de l’ embouche.
texts.en:
Moustapha, 48 years old, has been a small-scale farmer for close to 12 years. He is married and has seven children. He grows vegetables such as carrots, onions, and cabbage.  He also sells diesel. With the loan he would like to purchase seeds and fertilizer for his market garden.
He is able to cover the expenses of his household with the income from his business. He would like to raise animals in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for a market garden.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is a 32-year-old laundry cleaner in Mombasa. He is single and has been operating this business for the last eight years. He is doing great in the business. 

He was introduced to KADET and this marks his first borrowing to finance his business. He plans to purchase more basins, iron boxes and washing powders for his business.

He will use the anticipated profits to build capital and hopes to realize more profits and expand the business.

loans.use: To purchase more basins, iron boxes and washing powders for his business.

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.ru: Мунаввар замужем и любящая мать четверых детей. Муж занимается строительством, а Мунаввар занимается скотоводством, а также выращиванием сельхозпродуктов. Муж помогает ей по бизнесу. Из- за не благополучных природных условий она не получила хороший урожай, поэтому из-за недостатка корма для скота она хотела бы получить займ для покупки сена и соломы для  скота, а также на остальную сумму хочет купить 4 голов мелкого рогатого скота. Она надеется на вашу доброту и с нетерпением ждет вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Munavvar is married and is a loving mother of four children.  Her husband is involved in construction work, and Munavvar is involved in animal husbandry and also growing agricultural crops.  Her husband helps her with the business.  Due to bad weather conditions, she did not obtain a good harvest and does not have enough fodder for the livestock.  This is why she wants to obtain a loan to purchase hay and straw for the livestock and also wants to use the rest of the sum to buy four heads of small livestock.  Munavvar relies on your kindness and eagerly awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy small livestock and fodder

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Nelfa has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has also a food shop or restaurant that sells viands. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Nelfa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Nelfa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for the food shop.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 46 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, with 4 of them currently in school. For the past six years, Nelson has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells soap, sugar, milk and bread, etc. 

To help expand his business, Nelson has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more grocery items  to sell, and will help Nelson to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Nelson hopes that in the future he will be able to open up another business of the same kind. 

Nelson is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Nelson who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to stock more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Mahougnon Group

texts.fr: MAHOUGNON est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même village. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la cinquième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Pascaline (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 32 ans. Pascaline est mariée à un conducteur du nom de Abel. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Pascaline  vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Pascaline  et son mari. Pour cette raison, Pascaline vend divers produits( conserves, des savons etc) dans sa région, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Pascaline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Pascaline sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe MAHOUGNON, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter divers produits.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Doña Angela por años trabaja como conserje, labor que le ha ayudado a apoyar a sus hijos y sacarlos adelante los cuales hoy en día son mayores de edad e independientes que ahora le ayudan a su madre económicamente, doña Angela con apoyo del financiamiento anterior invirtió en las mejoras de su cuarto y baño lo que ha contribuido a tener mejores condiciones en el hogar. Solicita nuevamente el micro crédito para comprar materiales y poner el techo del porche, con esta inversión doña Angela y su familia podrán disfrutar de más tranquilidad porque el agua ya no se introduciría a su vivienda y sus cosas estarán más seguras.

loans.use: Doña Angela solicita el crédito para poner el techo del porche, evitando así se introduzca el agua a su vivienda dañando las cosas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on Business

loans.name: Maharram

texts.en: Maharram is local and lives in Beylagan town. He has a shop and sells fruit and vegetables. He is doing this business since 2003. In beginning of his business he applied to Normicro Beylagan branch and borrowed $200. After investing the loan into the business he applied for subsequent loans. Eventually be borrowed 4 loans. Now he needs another loan to invest more into his own business.

loans.use: To invest in his Fruits and Vegetables business

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en: Laurence is a widow who supports her family through her business. She is 60 years old and has eight children. She started her business in 1997. Her determination to succeed makes her a strong woman, and she wants to expand her business in order to generate additional profit. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy a freezer, which would help her to better serve the high demand of clients in her community.

loans.use: To purchase prepaid phone cards in bulk for resale, and a freezer for soft drinks.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has a small store where she sells sodas, juices and beer. She already owns two large freezers thanks to the profits the business has generated. Six months ago, Maria took out a loan with Mifex that helped her improve her sales and eventually upgraded one of her older refrigerators. She is now hoping that a second loan will help her venture into selling dairy products such as cheese and yogurt.

Maria and her husband have 10 children, and 6 of them still live at home. She has been living in this very poor community for many years. Her home was once in very poor conditions and vulnerable to the rising shore, but she has made various improvements thanks to her business.

loans.use: Invest in dairy products

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 43 years old, is separated from her husband and has a 13-year old daughter. To provide for her daughter and give her a good education, Maria started a business selling products for the home three years ago. She already holds a full time job, but her salary isn't enough to cover household expenses, so she started this business to supplement her income. She has been able to obtain more customers and increase her sales because she sells high quality products.

Maria is requesting a loan of $475 to buy additional merchandise and continue to provide her customers with good service. She will repay the loan over a period of 6 months. Your assistance and support will help her expand her business and provide a better life for her family, for which Maria thanks you.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria tiene 43 años de edad, está separada de su esposo y tiene una hija de 13 años. Para sacar adelante a su hija y ofrecerle una buena educación Maria comenzó a vender productos para el hogar desde hace tres años, aunque ella tiene un empleo, su salario es insuficiente para cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar e inició este negocio para tener un ingreso extra, la buena calidad de los productos que comercializa le han ayudado a incrementar su número de cliente y sus ventas rápidamente.

Para comprar mercancía y ofrecer a sus clientes un buen servicio Maria esta solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses. Con tu ayuda Maria podrá continuar creciendo con su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, por lo que te agradece sinceramente la confianza y apoyo que le brindas.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Kambona

texts.en: Kambona U. is a 45-year-old father of two and a resident of the Kiwalani area in Dar es Salaam. He has been in business for the past 10 years and owns a wholesale store in Kiwalani selling soft drinks.  Kambona has just cleared his former loan and now is need of another one to realize his dream of transforming his shop into a warehouse for one of the soft drink companies in Tanzania. Kambona would like a loan of $1,200 to achieve his goal.

loans.use: To transform his successful wholesale store into a larger warehouse store for soft drinks

loans.name: Dominga Escolástico

texts.en:
Dominga defines herself as a goal-oriented, active and assiduous person.  She is 29 years old and has two sons, aged 9 and 7, that attend school.  Her husband works as truck driver for a company.
Dominga’s business consists of buying and reselling plots of land.  This is a new business for her, and she is rapidly learning how to be a good real estate agent. This entrepreneur graduated with studies in Computation Systems.  She is thinking about taking postgraduate classes.  She is requesting a loan of $300 so she can improve her business, continue caring for her family, and save money to further her studies.

loans.use: To purchase of pieces of land for resale

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa is a happy mother of a four month old baby. Five years ago, together with her husband who works as a mechanic in a shop in Juliaca city, she decided to aircondition and remodel their home, which they inherited from her mother, and open a small grocery store. This small but well-stocked store is enabling her to provide her family’s daily food and also cover the family’s basic expenses. Today she needs a loan to purchase more merchandise such as noodles, sugar, milk, beverages, etc. as the Christmas and New Year holidays are when there is great demand for these products. “Teresa and her dear family need your help.”

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Teresa, es una alegre madre de un bebé de cuatromeses; hace cinco años junto a su querido esposo, quien trabaja como mecánico en un taller de la ciudad de Juliaca,decidió acondicionar y refaccionar su casita,que por herencia le dejósu madre, y dispuso poner su tiendita de abarrotes. Ésta pequeña pero surtida bodeguita le está permitiendo brindar consumo diario a su familia y también cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar.En esta oportunidad necesita de un crédito para comprar más mercadería como fideos, azúcar, leche, bebidas, etc. ya que se aproxima la fiesta de navidad y fin año y es donde hay mayor demanda de estos productos.“Teresa y su querida familia necesitan de tu ayuda”.

loans.use: Purchase a large quantity and variety of items to sell in her small store.

loans.name: Norma Verónica

texts.es:
When Norma learned that she was going to become a mother, she began to worry about how she would support her child since her husband’s income was only enough for the two of them. It was because of this that she decided to sell catalog cosmetics. Little by little, she became known in her area, which also helped her sell floral arrangements of artificial flowers. Currently, she has a long list of clients who seek her out in order to buy her products and/or to request her services of making flower arrangements for parties and other events.

Nevertheless, Norma currently has various orders to fill but she does not have enough money to buy the merchandise and products. As a result, she is soliciting a credit of US $375 which she will repay 6 months. With this money, Norma can buy the merchandise she needs. With your help, Norma can get her family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Cuando a Norma le dieron la noticia de que sería madre, comenzó a preocuparse en cómo le haría para poder mantener a su hijo. Puesto que con lo que gana su esposo sólo les alcanzaba para ellos dos. Fue por eso que se decidió a vender cosméticos por catálogo poco a poco se fue haciendo conocida en su colonia, lo cual le ayudó a vender también arreglos florales de flores artificiales. Actualmente ya cuenta con un gran número de clientes quienes la buscan para poder comprarle los productos y le elaboren floreros y/o arreglos para fiestas y otros eventos.

Sin embargo Norma actualmente tiene varios pedidos que surtir y no cuenta con el dinero suficiente como para comprar la mercancía y los productos es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Norma podrá comprar la mercancía para así poder elaborar sus productos. Con tu ayuda Norma podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Mr. Kodjo V. was born in Lomé on March 9, 1964 and is married and the father of 7 children. He founded and directs a primary school located in his neighborhood of Hédzranawoé and is asking for a loan for the school from Kiva. The money from the loan will be used to outfit two classrooms so that the pupils can study in a good environment. Making this project a reality will considerably improve chances for the success of his little school and his pupils this school year.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur V. Kodjo est né à Lomé le 09 Mars 1964, marié et père de sept (7) enfants. Gestionnaire, il est le fondateur d’une école primaire sise dans son quartier Hédzranawoé et sollicite à travers ce projet un financement sous forme de prêt. Ce fonds lui servira à l’aménagement de 2 salles de classe pour une bonne condition de travail et d’étude des élèves. La réalisation de ce projet augmentera sensiblement un bon rendement en fin d’année par conséquent le potentiel éducatif trouvera son essor.

loans.use:
Outfitting of classrooms

Amenagement de salles de classes

loans.name: Cherinor Hassan

texts.en: Cherinor is a hardworking man.  His wife makes soap and he assists by selling the soap in various villages.  With the income from the soap business, they decided to purchase reconditioned freezers and started selling cold soft drinks in Kabala town, but at a very small scale.  Cherinor is excited to grow and expand his business.  He needs additional business capital to purchase a larger quantity and assortment of drinks. Cherinor would like to expand his business and is requesting a loan of Le.3.500, 000, to purchase different types of drinks.

loans.use: To purchase cold soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is 30 years old and is a married woman with 5 children, ages 3-11 years old. Mwanaisha owns a small grocery store. Every day, she works from 7am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma is a very hard-working woman who entered the commercial world led by the desire to improve her family’s quality of life. She sells beauty products by catalog, and her work, thanks to her daily efforts, has given her great satisfaction. For this reason she would like to increase her total investment.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Norma, esa una dama muy trabajadora que se inició en el mundo comercial a raíz de su ímpetu por mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Vende productos de belleza por catálogo y su trabajo gracias al esfuerzo en su desempeño diario le ha otorgado muchas satisfacciones y por esa razón desea incrementar el monto de su inversión.

loans.use: Increase capital in order to offer a greater quantity of products

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en: Mr. Noun S., 38, is a motor-taxi driver in the Prey Veng province of Cambodia. Each day he can earn up to three dollars. He is not married, but lives with and supports his elderly parents. He is requesting a loan for $150 to go towards replacing his old motorbike. In the future, he hopes he can save enough money to purchase a car to run a taxi business instead of a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Kemokoh's Group

texts.en:
Kemokoh C., Frank D. S., Sheika I. S., Tennyacy Y. K. and Abu B. D. are a group of soldiers requsting a loan of Le 3,600,000.

Kemokoh C. is the leader of this group. He was born in Freetown. He is 42 years of age and is married with 4 children. Kemokoh wants a loan to help him continue his education. Frank D. S. would like to use his loan to purchase a plot of land. Sheika and Tennyacy would like to use theirs to build houses. Abu B. D. will invest his loan in agriculture.

loans.use: Pay school fees and other charges.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel is 54 years old and is married to Seferina Ferreira who is 51 years old. Seferina is a homemaker and they live in their own home.

Miguel worked for several years as an employee at a business. One day, after noticing that his father had a vehicle that he did not use, he asked him if he could use it as a taxi with the promise that he would pay him over time with the income he generated from the vehicle. Fortunately, the business was successful and it is how today Miguel generates income for his family.

Miguel has been very successful in his business as he has many clients that travel with him daily. Thanks to his efforts he can support his two children who are in college.

Miguel is seeking this loan to purchase new covers for the car as these now need to be replaced.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Miguel tiene 54 años de edad, está casado con Seferina Ferreira de 51 años quien es ama de casa, viven en casa propia.

Miguel trabajo varios años como empleado de un negocio. Un día, viendo que su padre poseía un vehículo que no utilizaba, decidió hablar con él para poder usarlo como taxi, con la promesa de que iba a pagarlo con el tiempo de los ingresos que esto le genere. Afortunadamente el negocio resulto bastante rentable y es así como hoy día Miguel genera sus ingresos para la casa.

El negocio es un éxito para él, pues ya posee muchos clientes que diariamente viajan con él. Gracias a su esfuerzo hoy en día puede mantener a sus dos hijos quienes están cursando carreras universitarias.

Miguel hoy desea adquirir un crédito para comprar cubiertas nuevas para el auto pues ya es tiempo de cambiarlas.

loans.use: Purchase of new car covers.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.en:
Doña Maria lives with her 18-year-old daughter in her own home in the tropical Santa Cruz region of eastern Bolivia. She has run a very well-stocked dry goods store for the past 10 years. Her mother and daughter help her run it.

There is a decent level of competition in the area, but Doña Maria's store is one of the most well-stocked, and her prices are very low compared to other stores in her neighborhood. She buys her goods in bulk in Camiri and Villamontes in order to offer such a wide variety of goods at such low prices.

With this loan, Doña Maria will buy merchandise to stock her store such as pasta, flour, sugar, rice, and canned goods (sardines, tuna, meats). This is her fifth loan with AgroCapital: she has been a client since November 11, 2003. She has been an excellent client and rarely if ever makes late payments.

loans.use: Buy dry goods (flour, pasta, sugar, rice, canned goods)

loans.name: José Ramón

texts.es:
En el municipio de Condega de la ciudad de Estelí, el señor José Ramón Z. se dedica con mucho esfuerzo desde hace varios años a la actividad agropecuaria el cual ejerce con mucho empeño para mejorar su condición de vida.

Hoy en día el señor Z. ha decidido invertir en su actividad y para ello ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito que le permita la compra de novillos para su desarrollo. Por este motivo espera que su crédito sea otorgado y así continuar con su actividad y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
In the Condega municipality in the city of Esteli, Mr. Jose Ramon Z. has worked very hard in farming for several years. He does this with much determination to improve his life conditions.

These days, Mr. Z. has decided to invest in his work and to do this he has looked for the support of Ceprodel, to be benefitted with a loan, which will allow him to purchase young bulls for their development. With this motive, he hopes that his loan will be authorized so he can continue his work and improve his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase young bulls

loans.name: Olivia Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Olivia tiene 43 años de edad, habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, en la capital de Managua, con dos hijos de 12 y14 años de edad, los dos están estudiando la secundaria en el colegio del barrio madre soltera, ha puro esfuerzo logro poner una pequeña pulpería que la tiene desde hace diez años, solo comenzó vendiendo refrescos, y frutas, y por falta de financiamiento es que su pulpería no ha tenido el crecimiento en capital, pues comenzó con capital propio, ahora esta optando por prestamos en Afodenic para invertir en la compra de productos para su pulpería como pollo, granos básicos y frutas para ofertar a sus clientela espera beneficiarse para crecer y a largo plazo  poder crear nuevos nichos de mercados, a si como ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
Olivia is 43 years old and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in the capital city, Managua. She has two children ages 12 and 14 who study in the neighborhood secondary school. A single mother, she was able to open a small grocery store 10 years ago, beginning with selling refreshments and fruit. Because of a lack of financing her convenience store hasn’t grown as she started with just her own savings. Now she is opting for loans from Afodenic to invest in buying products for her store such as chicken, basic grains and fruit to offer her customers in hopes of growing her business and in the long term to create new markets and in this way help her children with their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains, vegetables, and fruit

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 27 años, vive con su hijo de un añito. Es una joven muy entusiasta que a pesar de las circunstancias no deja de trabajar, desde hace un año inició un negocio de confección de camisetas dentro de su hogar  para luego venderlas en los mercados, o distribuir los pedidos, sobre todo en  fechas y eventos deportivos. Para ella este trabajo está lleno de creatividad y dedicación, por los diseños, y no es difícil, ya que cuenta con un gran don para confeccionar diversos modelos, sobre todo porque es muy rentable. Lo difícil es abastecer su taller con todos los tipos de telas novedosos. Luz es muy puntual en sus pagos, este es su 10mo préstamo con MFP. Ahora está dispuesta a poner un taller en el centro de la ciudad y exponer sus  diversos diseños en una tienda de confecciones, para ello quiere invertir 1000 soles.
texts.en:
Luz is 27 years old and lives with her son who is one year old. She is a very enthusiastic young woman and because of her tough circumstances works very hard. One year ago she started a business making t-shirts in her own house. She then sold the shirts in markets or by order and especially at sports events or days. For her this type of work is full of creativity and dedication because she designs the shirts. It is not very difficult for her because he has a gift for making various designs. Above all it is a profitable business. The hard part is keeping her workshop stocked with all types of new materials. Luz is very punctual with her payments. This is her 10th loan with MFP. Now she is ready to open a workshop in the city center and sell her various design in a clothing shop. For this she is requesting a loan of 1000 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Open a textile workshop in the city center to sell her clothing.

loans.name: Fialupe

texts.en: Fialupe P. is 29 years old, and married with 6 children.  She has one years of experience in the taro growing business. Besides growing taro, she sells to the people in her village and to the public one day every week. Fialupe is a member of SPBD and she has made a previous loan with this microbank.  With this, her second loan, she expects her weekly net cash flow to be around 50 Tala.  SPBD loans are Fialupe’s only access to business capital as she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase farming equipment and expand her taro planting

loans.name: Ursula

texts.es:
La señora Ursula es socia del Banco Comunal “Sacuyo”, de la comunidad de Sacuyo, distrito de Acora, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; de  26 años de edad, tiene un  hijo, es conviviente y posee estudios secundaria completa.
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace siete meses e inicio su negocio de abarrotes con un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, que invirtió como capital. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 3 cuotas, podrá comprar más mercadería (saco de harina, azúcar, arroz, caja de leche, y entre otros).
texts.en:
Ursula is a member of the Sacuyo Community Bank in Sacuyo, Peru. She is a 26-year-old mother of one son and lives with her partner. She has a high school degree and has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for six months. She started her convenience store with her first loan of 500 soles. With the current loan of 500 soles she's requesting, which she plans to repay in three months, she plans to purchase more merchandise, such as sacks of flour, sugar and rice, boxes of milk and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise, such as sacks of flour, sugar and rice, boxes of milk and other items.

loans.name: Prince

texts.en: Prince O. is single and has no children. He has received schooling through junior high. Prince sells LP Gas cylinders and stoves at Kotokraba which is the heart of Cape Coast, which he has done since 2005.  Prince uses his income to pay for rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. Prince will use the loan as additional capital to enable him to increase the sale of LP Gas cylinders to meet the increase in demand by him costumers. With the new profits from his expanded business, Prince plans to put up a building for  himself and for the future family he will be having.

loans.use: Prince will use the loan as additional capital to enable him to increase the sale of LP Gas cylinders to meet the increase in demand by him costumers.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: S. is 71 years old and the father of one child who is married and lives with him in Seim Reap Province. His wife, Lang, is 59 and owns a grocery shop. Since 2000, S. has made a living repairing vehicles and supervising a construction crew. He is a great father and a responsible neighbor because he works hard and never wastes time. Because this is the harvest season and prices are low, S. wants to buy rice which he will store for later use. He has applied for a $700 loan to buy more products for his wife's shop and to buy rice. The loan will help the family attain a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more products for his wife's shop and to buy rice to store for later use

loans.name: Geneviève Rita

texts.fr: Résidente du quartier  de Teshie, A. Geneviève   est une femme très travailleuse,  elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des produits de mercerie, elle a commencé ce commerce en 2004, ses clientèles sont principalement des couturières et des tailleurs. Voulant agrandir son commerce et réaliser de meilleures recettes, elle demande à WAGES son premier crédit pour l’achat des articles de mercerie. Elle est mariée à un monsieur qui est médecin dans une clinique, ensemble ils ont eu 02 enfants.
texts.en:
A resident of the Teshie district, A. Geneviève is a hard-working woman. She earns an income through commerce in sewing supplies. She started in this business in 2004. Her customers are mainly seamstresses and tailors. Wanting to expand her business and to realize better receipts, she's asking WAGES for her first loan to buy sewing supplies. She is married to a gentleman who is a mechanic in a clinic. Together they had two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Mashkhura

texts.ru: Машхуре 29 лет, замужем. Последние несколько лет занимается предпринимательством. Весной она продает зелень, летом и осенью кроме зелени она еще продает консервы и различного рода овощи. Для закупа зелени она выезжает в Худжанд (100 километров от ее дома) и для того чтобы успеть купить подешевле, она выезжает рано утром. Уже к 7 утра она раскладывает товар на прилавке и торгует до позднего вечера. Для Машхуры торговля основной вид деятельности и дохода. Она подала заявку на займ и планирует увеличить свой оборотный капитал.
texts.en:
Mashkhura S. is 29 years old and married. For the last few years she has been an entrepreneur. She sells herbs during the spring and also various vegetables and canned goods during the summer and autumn. She travels to Khujand (100 kilometers from her home) for the herbs and has to leave home early in the mornings in order to buy at cheaper prices. By 7 o’clock in the morning, Mashkhura already sets up her goods at her market stand and sells until the late evening. Retail is the only business and income source for Mashkhura. She requested the loan in order to increase her working capital.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Abigail

texts.es:
La señora Abigail es ama de casa y vive con su esposo el señor Guadalupe que es albañil en una Constructora obteniendo un muy buen ingreso mensual.
Ellos tienen el proyecto de la colocación de una losa de concreto, para ampliarse y tener una mayor comodidad. 
El crédito que están solicitando solamente lo requieren para la compra del material ya que Don Guadalupe realizara la mano de obra.
texts.en:
Abigail is a homemaker and lives with her husband, Gaudalupe, who is a construction working for a company. His monthly income is very good.

They wish to install a concrete slab to expand their home for greater comfort.

The loan they are requesting is only for the price of the building material because Guadalupe will be doing the work himself.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install a concrete slab as the roof of a room, currently under construction.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary E. is married and has 2 children. She has received schooling through senior high. Mary has sold provisions such as Milo (a brand of malted milk) and sugar in Elmina since 2005. Her husband is a teacher whose income is too small to support their family. Mary uses all her income to pay utility bills.

Mary plans to use this loan to purchase more groceries to sell in her store. With the resulting profits, Mary plans to save and buy a container shop where she can sell her provisions.

loans.use: Purchase additional goods to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn L. is from the village of Bay-bay, Balatacan, Tangub city. She is 29 years old. Evelyn is married. To make a living, Evelyn operates a family member's "sari-sari" or general store. They sell daily use products such as soap, shampoo, toothpaste, etc. in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Evelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Evelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business and to support the needs of her family. 


About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Cinthia Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Cinthia es una persona joven y muy trabajadora. Se dedica a la venta de masitas (pastele), ella prepara las masitas en su casa y su especialidad son las "Llauchas" (empanadas con queso), una especie de empanada grande y con mucho queso. Además también hace pasteles y tortas para cumpleaños y matrimonios. Vive en su casa de la Calle 5 de Pampahasi junto a su esposo Omar y sus dos hijos pequeños. Cinthia inició esta actividad hace dos años y actualmente solicita el crédito para una tienda que funcionará como puesto adicional de venta de las masitas. Ella es una persona muy responsable con su trabajo y dedicada con su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cinthia is a hardworking young woman. She sells “masitas” (a type of pastry), which she prepares from her home. Her specialty is "Llauchas", a large empanada filled with lots of cheese. She also bakes pies and cakes for birthdays and weddings.

She lives in a house on #5 Pampahasi Street with her husband Omar and their two young children. Cinthia started her business two years ago and is requesting a loan so that she can open a store where she can sell more pastries. She is very responsible at her work and dedicated to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two display cases and pay 3 months rent

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn T. is from the village of Barangay Poblacion, Iligan City. She is 32 years old, is married to Lloyd, and has two school-aged children. Merlyn owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling processed food products such as longganisa (Filipino-style sausages) and dressed chicken in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month. In July 2009, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

location.town: Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
El señor Rafael L.  vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su hija.
El señor Rafael trabaja como mensajero y auxiliar de oficina en una empresa privada de La Paz, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de un muro de contención, ya que la pendiente en la que se encuentra su vivienda exige que se estabilice el suelo.
Esta es la cuarta vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Rafael L. lives in his own house, in the area of Pasankeri, Iadera, which is west of the city of La Paz, with his daughter. Mr. Rafael works as a messenger and assistant in the office of a private company in La Paz. The income from this job is used to take care of his family. The loan he is requesting will be used to build a retaining wall, since his house is located on a slope, so he needs to stabilize the floor. This is the fourth time that he has requested a loan. Because of this and his socio-economic level, he qualifies for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a retaining wall for his house

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna P. is from the village of Naawan , Misamis Oriental. She is 44 years old. Lorna is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Lorna owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting coconut for sale. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lorna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lorna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Adoni

texts.en: Adoni S. sells women's underwear and children's clothing of various shapes and sizes. She started this business in 2002. She is 40 years old and married with five children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura J. is from the village of Manamong. She is 51 years old. Maura is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Maura owns & operates a sari-sari store business in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Maura has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005,Maura joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maura has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Maura is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Maura from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Loyola Group

texts.en:
Rajabu S., age 25, is single with two older brothers and one younger brother.  He has a small business selling cassava and sweet potatoes. He opened the business in 2005 and works long daily hours from 5 am until 6:30 pm. By selling cassava and sweet potatoes both wholesale in bulk and in smaller amounts at a higher price he is able to earn a monthly profit of around $120.

This will be Rajabu’s 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to establish and grow his current cassava and sweet potato stand, and he has paid back his loan successfully. He hopes to use this loan to increase his stocks even more.
	
Rajabu belongs to the Loyola Group, which totals 24 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. In the picture, Rajabu is sitting next to the man in white shirt on the right side.

loans.use: to increase the stock of cassava and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Ermy

texts.en:
Ermy is already a widow.  Her three children are already married but she still help her children to meet their needs.  

Ermy is a food snack vendor in their village in Nagassican, Santiago City. Due to the demands of her customers, she needs to have additional capital to be used for the maintenance of her business.  She is now asking for financial support from the KIVA lenders amounting to PHP5,000.  She believes that this amount will be of great help for her to purchase different commodities she needed.

loans.use: Additional capital for vending activity

loans.name: Jeremias

texts.en:
Jeremias Q. is from the village of La victoria, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 30 years old. Jeremias is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Jeremias owns & operates an "okay-okay" shoe store, where he buys and sells used shoes in the local community. Jeremias has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Jeremias joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to improve his living situation and give him the ability to engage in business activities. Jeremias has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jeremias is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Jeremias from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the his family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Rosa Esther

texts.es:
Rosa Esther  es socia D. Banco Comunal Picoaza,este  banco está conformado por mujeres  de diferetnes  edades.  Picoaza es un pueblito ubicado a diez  minutos al norte de Portoviejo en la provincia de Manabí en la costa de Ecuador, ésta  provincia es  muy  conocida por su gastronomía, las playas y los ceibos (arboles únicos de la región) y ésta localidad no podía ser la excepción pues es un lugar muy comercial, aquí  encontramos muchos  distribuidores de productos agrícolas,  consumo, ropa, etc.

Rosa vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos de 19, 16 y 7 años en su vivienda propia ubicada en la Avenida Kennedy en el centro de la comunidad de Picoaza, su cónyuge es ayudante de albañilería  
 
Nuestra socia es dueña de una tienda de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños vende vestidos, blusas, medias, pantalones, etc. que los adquiere en varios mercados de Guayaquil para vender en su localidad, en Portoviejo y otras ciudades de Manabí.

A  Rosa le gusta trabajar con  la  Fundación ESPOIR  por los múltiples  beneficios  como el emergente (en casos de emergencia) y por la facilidad de pago  de los créditos (quincenal).  También por la capacitación donde aprende conjuntamente con su hija sobre educación familiar y otros temas.

El crédito solicitado lo usará para incrementar su negocio comprando  mercadería surtida para damas, caballeros y niños como pantalones, blusas, camisetas, calcetines, interiores   para la temporada navideña.
texts.en:
Rosa Esther is a member of the Picoaza communal bank whose members are women of different ages. Picoaza is a little town located about ten minutes north of Portoviejo in Manabí province on Ecuador's coast. This province is very well knows for its gastronomy, its beaches and the ceibo tree (the striking green giant Ceiba trichastandra) which are unique to the region. This place is no exception for there are many distributors of agricultural products, clothing, consumption, etc. Rosa lives with her husband and their three children: 19, 16 and 7 years old, in their own home on Kennedy Avenue in downtown Picoaza. Her husband is a masonry helper. She owns a clothing store where she sells clothing for women, men and children: dresses, blouses, hosiery, pants, etc., that she gets from various markets in Guayaquil to resell in her locality, in Portoviejo and in other cities in Manabí. Rosa likes to work with Fundación ESPOIR because of the many benefits, like the emergency fund (for emergencies) and the ease of payment schedules (every two weeks). She also likes the training sessions where she, together with her daughter, learns about family education and other subjects. The financing requested will be used to buy merchandise for women, men and children like pants, blouses, t-shirts, socks, underwear, for the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, socks, underwear for women, men and children.

loans.name: Yesu Mo Group

texts.en:
Theresa is 59 years old ;she is married with four children. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc. She deems this a big opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by customers, as we approach Christmas festivities and with her seven years' experienced in retailing. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body lotion, detergent and hair creams etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve sales to enable her to save more for the children's education.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Yesu Mo’ which literary means 'Thank you, Jesus'. She is the one sitting in the middle in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan. They would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
Marleni tiene 29 años, es una madre de familia muy cariñosa y responsable y cuyos hijos, Jhon de 8 y Joelin de 2 años, viven junto a ella en su propia casa y lo que más desea para sus hijos es darles una buena educación. Para ello, se dedica al tejido artesanal, actividad que le ha dado muchos beneficios, ya que gracias a esta labor ha podido mantener a su familia, cubriendo todas sus necesidades. Los tejidos que realiza Marleni son de muy buena calidad, ya que tienen bonitos acabados, y eso le ha favorecido mucho en la demanda de sus tejidos en la feria dominical donde los lleva a venderlos. 
Para Marleni esta actividad le da mucha satisfacción, ya que le gusta tejer y lo hace con mucha dedicación y  esmero logrando tener 6 años en este trabajo, siendo la parte más difícil en transportar sus tejidos hasta los puntos de venta. Es así que espera mas adelante alquilar un puesto en el mercado de su ciudad y vender todas las prendas que ella misma elabora. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, por lo que promete ser responsable y pagar a tiempo sus cuotas y para ello ahorrará poco a poco. Además siendo un miembro de su grupo comunal es muy activa y solidaria por lo que es muy respetada por sus demás compañeras. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita comprará más lana, para así incrementar el número de prendas que produce.
texts.en:
Marleni is 29 years old and a loving and responsible mother to two children, Jhon, age 8, and Joelin, age 2. She lives with her family in her own home and what she wants most for her children is to provide them a good education. Towards that aim, she works as a weaver, an activity that has many benefits and which has enabled her to take care of her family and provide for their needs. The items that Marleni weaves are of a very high quality, with beautiful finishing details. This has made her products very much in demand at the Sunday market where she sells them. Marleni gets much satisfaction from this activity, since she likes to weave and has done it with great dedication and care for the last six years. The most difficult part of the work is transporting the items to the market. Because of this, in the future she would like to rent a stall in her city's market to sell all of the items that she makes herself.

This is her fourth loan from Microfinanzas Prisma, and she promises to be responsible and on-time with her payments, as she will save little by little. She knows that being a member of a communal bank requires action and she feels a great sense of responsibility to the other members of the bank. She will invest the 1,500 nuevos soles in the purchase of more wool so that she can increase the amount of items that she can produce.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wool to create weavings

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es:
Marianela tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos en el distrito de Catacaos, en la region Piura, ubicado a tres horas y veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Su esposo labora como pescador, pero como esta actividad no tiene suficiente estabilidad debido a las temporadas de veda, ella tuvo que empezar hace nueve años un negocio de venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Tiene instalado un pequeño establecimiento en su domicilio y tambien distribuye pedidos que sus clientes le solicitan con anticipación.

Marianela se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de más productos para ampliar su negocio.

Ella es una mujer responsable y emprendedora, sus clientes y vecinos la aprecian mucho y siempre recurren a ella cuando necesitan ayuda. Su más grande anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria e instalar un pequeño puesto de venta en la ciudad de Piura.
texts.en:
Marianela is 36 years old, married, and lives with her husband and their 3 children in the Catacaos district in the Piura region, located 3 hours and 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Her husband works as a fisherman, but this activity does not generate enough stability due to the seasons when the government prohibits fishing. Nine years ago, she had to begin a business selling clothing for women, men and children. She has a small store in her house, and she also distributes orders from her customers that she takes in advance. Marianela is requesting a loan of 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternative for the first time. She will use the money to buy more products to expand her business. She is a responsible and enterprising woman; her customers and neighbors appreciate her very much and always turn to her when they need help. Her greatest desire is to continue to grow as a businesswoman and to have a small sales stand in the city of Piura.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing to expand her business

loans.name: Saphoan

texts.en: Mrs. Saphoan N. is a villager in Daeum Pou village in Takeo province. She is 29 years old. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land she uses to grow rice to support their family. Her husband, Mr. Chan Chhorn, harvests and sells green grass. This family has a problem because the green grass field is far from their home. It is also through a lake, but they do not have the supplies to support this business. Thus, Mrs. Saphoan N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a boat and a machine to support selling green grass. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in local public school, and the other is too small to study or work. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a boat and a machine to support selling green grass

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 25 years old, married, and lives in the province of Rizal in the Philippines with her husband and two young children.  To supply additional income for her family, Rosita is opening a local convenience store in her neighborhood.

Rosita would like to receive a loan to purchase inventory including rice, sugar, shampoo, detergent, and canned goods.  Rosita believes in offering a relevant assortment and inventory of goods in her store for customers seeking convenient purchases.  As a new member of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Rosita is grateful for the access to capital and loans to fund her entrepreneurial dreams.

Her long-term goals are to expand her retail business, fund the college education of children, and support her family financially.  With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, she is determined to achieve business success with her new entrepreneurial endeavor.


About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of the Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Carlos Jose

texts.es: El señor Carlos trabaja como cadete de taxi desde hace varios años, su edad es de 54 años, junto a su esposa se han esforzado para hacer las mejoras necesarias a su vivienda, ella tiene tres hijos los cuales estudian, y labora para un almacén, las dificultades de don Carlos es cuando se le daña el vehiculo y no trabaja lo cual no cubre la alimentación a sus hijos. Con el crédito anterior logro hacer el sumidero para el inodoro, y compro material para la construcción pero como no ajusto con el dinero. Terminara la obra con este financiamiento en hacer el baño y el inodoro para una mejor privacidad e higiene de su familia. Sus planes es poder lograr un financiamiento grande para comprar un taxi propio y poder tener un mejor ingreso para poder apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos, 54, has worked as a taxi driver for several years. Together with his wife, he has struggled to make needed home improvements.
