She has three children, who are students, and she works in a store. When his vehicle isn’t running right, Carlos can’t work and can’t earn enough for food for his children. The previous loan made it possible for him to dig a sewer drain for the toilet and he bought building supplies; however, he ran out of money. This loan will be used to finish the bathroom and toilet so that the family will have more hygiene and privacy. His plan is to qualify for a large loan so that he can buy his own taxi thereby improving his income to help support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Cristo Rey Group

texts.es: El grupo “Cristo Rey” esta representado por Liliana Martha e integrado por diez socios donde 9 son mujeres y 1 hombre, con actividad económica similar venta de productos por catalogo. La señora Guilfa es integrante del grupo madre soltera muy trabajadora tiene 4 hijos, uno ya es profesional, los otros están estudiando, ella es modista, confecciona ropa para damas de muy buena calidad con buena clientela, además también se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo, ella recibe la colaboración del padre de sus hijos con pensiones mensuales que sirve para su educación, a futuro ella espera poder producir en mayor cantidad las prendas de vestir para vender al por mayor y poder llevar a provincias abarcando mas para generar mejores ingresos para el sustento de sus hijos. El resto del grupo se dedica a la venta de material escolar, abarrotes, productos Argentinos, cosméticos, servicio de enfermería y al transporte de pasajeros. La expectativa que tiene el grupo es de seguir trabajando y contar sobre todo con financiamiento para poder alcanzar sus metas. La mayoría tiene experiencia en el rubro por lo que no temen a la competencia ya que tienen clientes que demanda su producto y requieren de sus servicios ya que son socias muy dinámicas y bien sociables. El crédito será destinado a capital de operaciones debido a que la demanda creció y ellas requieren de un capital para la compra de insumos, y mercadería. La mayoría tiene experiencia en créditos solidarios por lo que saben como manjar y administrar los fondos otorgados para su beneficio y el crecimiento de sus negocios ya que de ello depende el sustento de sus familias.
texts.en:
The group “Cristo Rey” (Christ the King) is led by Liliana Martha and consists of ten members, nine women and one man. They have similar business activities selling products by catalog. Sra. Guilfa is a member of the group who is a hardworking single mother with four children, one of whom is already a professional while the rest are in school. Guilfa is a dressmaker. She makes high-quality clothing for women and has a good clientele. In addition, she sells cosmetics through a catalog. Guilfa receives assistance from the father of her children with a monthly pension to help pay for their education. In the future, she hopes to produce garments in large quantities so that she can sell them in bulk and ship them to other provinces. This will generate more income for her to support her children.

The rest of the group is involved in selling school materials, groceries, products from Argentina, cosmetics, or providing services such as health care and transportation. They expect to continue working and rely on financing in order to achieve their goals. Most have experience in their respective fields, so they are not afraid of competition because they have customers who demand their products and services. The members are also very dynamic and quite sociable.

This loan will be used as operating capital because demand has increased and they need funding to purchase supplies and merchandise. Most of the members have previous experience working with solidarity loans, so they know how to handle and manage the funds to their benefit in order to grow their businesses and support their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Hamiss

texts.en: Mr. W. Hamiss is a 30-year-old businessman located in Kibuli. He has been operating a video library for over three years and the business is very successful. He is using his loan to purchase different types of video CDs, audio CDs and new novels for his customers. His future plan is to open his own film-making studio.

loans.use: To purchase more video CDs, audio CDs and new novels

loans.name: Gertrida

texts.en:
Gertrida is head of a family of six people, with all of them looking to her to provide for them in terms of education, shelter, and food. She is a single mother of four children with whom she lives in a rented house. She operates a retail shop in Hoima, Uganda, a small one in size, though she says it has grown over the years and she expects it to grow big in the near future. 

Gertrida also sells shoes on market days to make ends meet for the family, she says income from the shop caters for the children’s school fees and the supplementary income is what keeps them going at home. This is her second loan and she intends to buy sugar, rice, salt to sell in her shop.

loans.use: buying sugar, rice, salt for resale

loans.name: Kamakei Ole

texts.en:
Kamakei Ole K. is 23 years old. He is a single young man who is focused on farming. Kamakei has been farming for the past four years. 

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan with which he is planning to plant four acres of wheat which has proved to do well in his area due to good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to meet the market demand for wheat.

His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land. Kamakei is a young and energetic man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To plant four acres of wheat

loans.name: Mayanka Group

texts.en:
Meet with the members of the “Mayanka” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to apply for a loan of SLL 2,400,000. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve on their living conditions.

Mariatu K. (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group. The approximately 50-year-old woman is married to a businessman and they have three children.

Mariatu has been a businesswoman for more than thirty-five years now. She sells market-foods such as groundnuts (peanuts), palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), rice, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy wholesale more of the above mentioned items to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy more ground-nuts, palm-oil, rice, etc., wholesale

loans.name: Jiguitougou Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les huit membres du groupe JIGUITOUGOU II sont des femmes mariées  ayant en moyenne 40 ans, 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à YINASSO un des villages de la commune de KADIOLO préfecture  de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième collaborations avec l’institution, les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
Les spéculations cultivées sont :le riz, le maïs (par DIATA B.), l’arachide et le mil. 
Avec son nouveau prêt, DIATA B. compte acheter des intrants (semences, engrais, herbicides) payer les frais de sarclage, de labour et des petits matériels pour entretenir 2 Hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de KADIOLO et de ZEGOUA après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 140.000 FCFA après la campagne, qui sera utilisé pour soutenir les frais de scolarité des enfants et les soins de santé  de la famille.
DIATA B. souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’exploiter ses espaces culturales au mieux pour en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The eight members of the JIGUITOUGOU group are married women, on average 40 years old with five children. Most live in polygamous families in Yinasso, one of the villages of the Kadiolo commune in the Sikasso prefecture (the third administrative region in Mali) . The women work with the microfinance partner Soro Yiriwaso to help with their agriculture during the low season. This is their fourth loan with Soro Yiriwaso; all the previous loans were repaid without incident. The crops the group cultivates are rice, peanuts, millet and maize (by DIATA B.). This loan will help DIATA B. buy supplies (seeds, fertilizer, herbicide), pay for the costs of weeding, labour, and other small items that are needed to maintain her two hectares. The crops will be sold in the village, and at the KADIOLO and ZEGOUA markets, to both men and women. She hopes to make about 140,000 francs (CFAF), which she will use to pay for her children's schooling and for her family's medical costs. DIATA B. wants to continue working with Soro Yiriwaso so she can make the best use of her land for agriculture.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying seed and supplies for agriculture

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita P. is from the village of Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena. She is 44 years old. Anita is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Anita owns & operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Anita has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Anita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. Anita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Anita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Meldred

texts.en:
This is Meldred A., 40, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Raul A., a soldier. Meldred is mother of three children, one of whom is already working and settled down with a family, while the other two are in high school. By the grace of God, Meldred has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send the younger ones to college. A dream for most Filipino parents, like Meldred, as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Meldred operates a charcoal and firewood business. Many Filipinos are still using the old ways of firewood and charcoal cooking, which is the cheapest way to cook. Charcoal is sold in PHP 5 bags for easier lighting up. She also sells mineral water in their neighborhood. This is mostly used by nursing mothers and households with children, as normal tap water is already part of a normal adult's life. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 650 in sales every day for her firewood and mineral water refilling businesses.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 9, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of firewood and charcoal to be incorporated into her inventory. She will also be using a portion of the loan to buy mineral water to be retailed to her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Meldred dreams to be able to give her all of her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She also hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of firewood and charcoal to be incorporated into her inventory. She will also be using a portion of the loan to buy mineral water to be retailed to her customers.

loans.name: Mith's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mith S., age 52, is the leader of this loan group, having been selected by its five members who are located in Bat Lvea village, Kandal province. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their own business.

Mrs. Mith S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land that she uses to cultivate rice and she works very hard to support her two children. In order to increase her income to improve the family living, she will use the loan from AMK/Kiva to buy a cow for breeding.

Mrs. Mith S. is widow with two children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory and other is a laborer for the OMC company.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gallons of red oil

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is a widow. She has three grown children. Valentina runs a small business selling clothing and other merchandise in a little store, close to the central market, in her home town of Melitopol. Valentina has been in this trade for 10 years. She has 30,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her profit amounts to 7,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Valentina is seeking a 10,000 Grivnya loan to purchase assorted merchandise. She is very responsible when it comes to loan repayment. She can be characterized as a hard-working and circumspect individual with clear vision, a determined nature, and a kind heart.  She hopes to use additional income to help her children and their families.

loans.use: to increase her assortment

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah C. is from the village of Bonbon, Opol, Misamis Oriental. She is 43 years old. Leah is married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Leah owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Leah has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Leah joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leah is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the first taken out by Leah from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is from the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She is 46 years old, married and has 5 children. Her eldest child is 23 years old and the youngest is 9. She is involved in farming and has been planting and harvesting rice for more than 15 years now. Her husband, who is also a farmer, also does his best to keep their farm productive. Teresita wishes for her family to have better living conditions. She says that she believes everything is attainable if you work hard for it. 

Teresita joined CEVI to avail of its financial service. She has repaid a previous loan, which she said helped her farm a lot. She still needs financial support to be able to buy farm inputs and materials for the farm. She has applied for a loan of PHP 7,000, which she will use to buy seeds, fertilizers and other inputs.

loans.use: Towards buying seeds, fertilizers and other inputs.

loans.name: Karina Elizabeth

texts.es:
La persona que aparece en la imagen es el esposo.
Karina Elizabeth T. Solís y su esposo cuenta con un negocio de la elaboración de bloques desde hace 8 años, en este momento el negocio esta muy bien las ventas pero no cuentan con el capital para comprar el material para seguir con el proceso de elaboración, para esto solicitan se tercer crédito para surtir su negocio y así generar mas ganancias. Karina ha demostrado tener muy buena cultura de pago.
texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is the husband.  Karina Elizabeth T. Solís and her husband have had a business making cement blocks for eight years.

The business is doing very well now, but they do not have the money to buy the material to continue the process of making the blocks.  

This is why they are requesting their third loan in order to stock their business and generate more income. 

Karina has demonstrated very good payment history.

loans.use: Invest in the business

loans.name: Unathan

texts.en:
Unathan O. is 43 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Bayan-Ulgiy province in western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His oldest son is a university student and other children attend a local school. His wife is disabled. 

Unathan operates a milk and mare's milk trading business in his town. He started his business in 1998 with only one milch cow and 3 calves. Today, he has 5 cows and 5 mares at his home that produce the milk he sells. On average, his cows and mares can produce about 15 liters of milk and 10 liters of fermented milk in one day respectively. 

Over the many years of successful operation, his business has reached to a sustainable level and he has used his earnings to purchase a new car for himself. He has gained a many permanent and loyal customers and partners. Unathan is a gentle and open-minded man. He says, " I plan to buy a mare from the Gobi provinces." He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase hay to feed his cattle as well as buy one more mare.

loans.use: To purchase hay to feed his cattle and buy one more mare

loans.name: Constantina Maria

texts.es:
Constantina es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” ubicado en el distrito de Azángaro, provincia de Azángaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 47 años edad, de estado civil casada y con 02 hijos, la señora estudió hasta 5to de educación primaria.

Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 03 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para incrementar el capital de su negocio de venta de queso, leche y artesanías.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le servirá para comprar lanas de alpaca para tejer ponchos y escarpines.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener más capital y ser mayorista en artesanía.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones, la puntualidad y responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Constantina is a member of the Communal Bank “Punta Sahuacasi”, which is located in the District and Province of Azángaro, Department of Puno. She is 47 years old, married, and has two children. Constantina has a fifth grade education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for three years. Her first loan of 300 PEN was used to increase her business capital for selling cheese, milk, and handicrafts.

Sra. Constantina is requesting a new loan in the amount of 1000 PEN so that she can buy alpaca wool for making ponchos and baby booties. Her dreams for the future are to have more capital and become a crafts wholesaler. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the meetings, the promptness, and the responsibility.

loans.use: Purchase alpaca wool for knitting ponchos & baby booties

loans.name: Dilia

texts.es: La Sra. Dilia vive en la zona de la Villa 1ro de Mayo, , Ella se dedica a la confección de mandiles, capas y gorros para las peluquerías, los mismos que distribuye en las diferentes peluquerías de la Villa 1ro de mayo y escuelas de belleza. Ella es madre soltera y tiene una hija de 5 años, además de la confección ella cuenta con el negocio de alquiler de trajes de fantasía y vestidos de fiesta que ella confecciona y tiene a disposición para diferentes eventos sociales; recientemente ha iniciado un nuevo proyecto para realizar eventos de graduación para los niños de Kínder.  Ella es una señora muy responsable y emprendedora, ella quiere el nuevo crédito para ampliar su taller de costura comprando máquinas de costurar y comprar tela para los mandiles, capas y gorros que confecciona ya que en esta época del año por las graduaciones de los salones de belleza aumenta la demanda para ella, esta muy agradecida con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Dilia lives in the area of Villa 1ro de Mayo.  She makes aprons, capes and caps to distribute to the hairdressers and beauty schools in Villa 1ro de Mayo.  She is a single mother and has a five-year-old daughter.

Besides her sewing, Dilia rents out costumes and party clothes that she makes and has available for different social events.  Recently she has begun a new project producing graduation events for kindergarteners. 

Dilia is a very responsible and enterprising woman.  She wants the new loan in order to expand her sewing workshop, buying sewing machines and buying fabric for the aprons, capes and caps she makes since at this time of the year the beauty school graduations increase demand for these items.  Dilia is very grateful to the institution for the support given to her.

loans.use: Buy fabric, buttons and a sewing machine

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha N. lives in the Nabulagala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.  Aisha has a business of charcoal selling. She has been in this business for five years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Aisha sells her products at the market, by means of retail.    

Aisha has requested for a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through vending cooked food. The main business challenge(s) for Aisha include transportation and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van, to start selling only by wholesale and also to build her own house. Aisha lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Benson Nzuma

texts.en:
Benson Nzuma, aged 33, operates a motorcycle transport business in Tala town. He transports customers along Kikomba, Kivaani, and Kagundo routes. He is married to Mary Muthio, a teacher by profession, and together they have three children — one in class four, and 6-month-old twins. Benson was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of the Tala office.

Benson has been running this business for a period of two years and his monthly profit is Kshs 8,000. This loan of Kshs 74,871 is his first loan from KADET and he intends to use the money to buy another motorbike. If the loan boosts business, he will buy more motorcycles and take on other routes. He dreams of having many motorbikes running in many routes. He describes himself as honest, helpful, kind and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Arturo Hernan

texts.es:
Arturo tiene 28 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Lambayeque, una zona de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El se gana la vida trabajando como coreógrafo. Arturo tiene una pequeña escuela de danza en donde enseña a bailar a personas  de todas las edades. Su calidad de enseñanza le han hecho bastante conocido y actualmente es bastante estimado por la zona. Los ingresos que el obtiene de esta actividad le ayudan a sacar adelante a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Actualmente Arturo desea adquirir espejos, colchonetas y otros materiales que le ayuden a mejorar la calidad de atención en su escuela de baile. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Arturo is 28 years old, married and lives with his family in the the Lambayeque district, a very active commercial area located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.
 
Arturo earns a living as a choreographer. He runs a small dance school where he teaches people of all ages. He offers high-quality instruction, which has made him very well-known and earned him a good reputation throughout the area. The income he earns from his work helps him to raise his family and improve their quality of life.
 
Arturo is requesting a loan from Edypme Alternativa in the amount of $725. This loan will help him reach his goal of purchasing mirrors, mats, and other materials to improve the quality of his dance school.

loans.use: To purchase mirrors, mats, and other materials to improve the quality of his dance school.

loans.name: Mugoma Farmers Group

texts.en: Robert is a 27-year-old married man with two children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. The responsibility to take care of the family solely rests on him and his family dream is to build a permanent residential house. He has a retail shop, which he has operated for 10 years after saving money from alcohol brewing. His desire is to set up a wholesale shop in town. He is a member of Mugoma Farmers group where each member guarantees the other member's loan. Robert needs the loan to buy salt, sugar and paraffin to sell.

loans.use: To buy salt, sugar and paraffin to sell.

loans.name: Benoit

texts.en:
Benoit K. is 61 years old. He cares for two dependents, who are both students. 

Benoit has a clean and well-organized fabric store which he has owned for 10 years. He works by himself in his shop from 8:00 AM until 6:00 PM during the week.

Benoit will use his loan to purchase more of the traditional African fabrics which are popular for dressmaking in Rwanda. He wants to use any profit he makes to build a new store for his fabric business.

loans.use: To purchase more traditional African fabric for resell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is from the village of Dolores, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is a 59-year-old married woman with five adult children.  Rosalinda runs an agricultural business venture raising crops in the community.  Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for twenty years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month. 

Rosalinda joined Kiva partner Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) to access financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP with which she will purchase additional inventory as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen Bank model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To access additional capital to raise crops

loans.name: Mujeres Loma Group

texts.es:
El comité "Mujeres Loma" está integrado por 15 mujeres muy trabajadoras, la Sra. Cynthia O., presidenta de dicho comité, vive con su marido e hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas desde hace un buen tiempo, desea poder prosperar por eso ayuda a su marido con los ingresos económicos del hogar, pero ahora necesita del crédito para comprar más ropas que luego las estaría vendiendo.
Ella, como las demás integrantes, está muy satisfecha con los créditos y constantes capacitaciones que recibe de la fundación, porque gracias a ello puede ir aumentando sus ingresos y de esa manera ayudar al sustento de su hogar.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Loma Communal Bank is comprised of 15 hard-working women.  Cynthia O. is the president of the communal bank.  She lives with her husband and children.  She has been selling clothes for a good amount of time.  She wants to be able to prosper, so she helps her husband with the household finances.  

However, she now needs a loan to buy more clothes that she will later sell.

She, like the other members, is very happy with the loans and the regular trainings she gets from the foundation.  Thanks to the loan she is able to increase her income.  That way she helps to support her household.

loans.use: to buy clothes like t-shirts, shorts, blouses, shirts, and pants, etc.

loans.name: Fandy

texts.en: This is 44 year-old Fandy.  She is married and has 3 children, aged 26, 24 and 20 years. In 1996, Fandy established her fish business. She began her business because she needed to have a source of income to help her take care of her family.  Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about Le 900,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy more fish to supply other traders. In the future, Fandy plans to be one of the leading fish agents who supplies other local women in her community.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more fish for her business

loans.name: Jardin Group

texts.es:
Betzy Paola J. O., es casada tiene 22 años D. edad, cursos el segundo año D. educación basica,  tiene 1 hijo que esta estudiando, se dedica a la venta D. artículos D. consumo diario, tiene 5 años D. experiencia con este negocio, a principio solo vendía objetos D. recuerdo y actualmente venD. diferentes clases D. artículos, en el futuro quiere tener varios puntos D. venta. 

DeciD. entonces, organizar un grupo, para solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para comprar artículos varios para tienda y asi incrementar su capital y su negocio, las integrantes D. este grupo se dedican a diversas actividades como: Venta D. ropa, venta D. pollo frito, y la venta D. tortillas. Esperan con el prestamo cumplir su objetivo D. mejorar su negocio y sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Betzy Paola J. O. is 22 years old, is married, and has a son in school.   She sells consumable items and has been doing so for 5 years.  She began by selling souvenirs and now she sells different types of articles.  In the future she would like to have a number of outlets.

She organized a group so that she could request a loan, which she will use to buy various items for her store and increase her capital and business.  The members of this group are involved in different businesses, such as clothing sales, fried chicken sales, and tortilla sales.  They hope to improve their businesses and incomes through the help of this loan.

loans.use: to increase her store's inventory

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a resident of Nkubu in Central Kenya and has been in farming for 15 years, producing bananas, maize, beans and eggs. His produce is sold locally. He is married and has three children between the ages of 16 and 7. They all attend school. He gets additional income from his employment as a driver.

Joshua has requested a loan of 47,250 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the dairy cow will improve his income and make him able to expand his farming more and educate his children.

Joshua says the challenges in the farming business are in finding funds for purchasing farm supplies and for paying laborers, which are costly. He is glad, however, that Juhudi loans are accessible.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kasanje Twegate Group

texts.en:
Suyina N. is a 46-year-old enterprising business woman who has been plying a charcoal sales business in Mbiko-Lugazi for the past 18 years. Before that, this happily married mother of 8 was operating a food vending business. 

N. is a hardworking, sturdy and determined lady whose chances for future success look to be in the ascendancy every passing year. Weekly, she says her profits are 100,000 shillings. N. says she is going to use proceeds from this loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to resell.

loans.use: to purchase of more charcoal to resell

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en: Oscar is 31 years old, married and has one child. He sells second-hand shoes to earn a living. He has been in the business for six years. He has managed to grow his business with his previous loans from Faulu Kenya. He has also benefited from business training conducted by Faulu Kenya. He hopes to expand his business in the future. He needs 40,000 Kes to add to his stock of shoes.

loans.use: To increase stock of shoes for sale

loans.name: Nurchakan

texts.en:
Nurchakan, 65, is a widow living in Southern Kyrgyzstan. In her teenage years, she showed early talent in sewing and designing clothing, skills she inherited from her mother. Now, she can perform a wide range of activities, from designing small souvenirs to making large hand-made carpets for home decoration.

Nurchakan resides in a small town called Tashkomur. Her daughters make it easier for her to run her business by supplying fabric from the capital. It was Nurchakan’s initiative to turn her home into a small fashion house. She has been in this industry for 31 years and her invested start-up capital of only 2,000 soms now brings 9,500 soms per month. Nurchakan has increased the goods circulation, obtained permanent clients and has a stable income. She believes these criteria will help her to repay the loan successfully. The purpose of the loan is to purchase fabric needed for the upcoming busy season.

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for making clothing and for the maintenance of his machinery.

loans.name: Yvette

texts.fr: Yvette  est client d’ACB depuis 2007. Elle est célibataire, elle a 29 ans, née au Rwanda. Elle 3 ans des études université, et ce crédit  est son premier cycle  de prêt avec ACB.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour payer le minerval.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de fournir tout effort nécessaire à ses études pour prépare son future.  Elle voudrait devenir un diplôme de niveau A0 en comptabilité et trouver un emploi un peu meilleur.
texts.en: Yvette has been client of ACB since 2007. She is unmarried and 29 years old. Born in Rwanda, she has three years of university education. This loan cycle is her first one with ACB. She is going to use her loan to pay for tuition. Her strategy for growth is to put in any effort necessary for studying, so as to prepare for her future. She would like to graduate in accounting at the A0 level and to find a somewhat better job.

loans.use: to cover tuition

loans.name: Nimosi

texts.en:
Nimosi is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past two years, she has operated a boda boda (motorcycle transport) business. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. During the rainy season it becomes difficult to operate her business. She dreams of purchasing another motorcycle in the future. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) she wants to purchase motorcycle spare parts, spokes, and tires. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts, spokes, and tires.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 64 años, es separada, vive en casa propia junto a su hijo y sus dos nietos
a quienes desea ver crecer con una buena educación y salud, es por eso que ella trabaja duro para poder ayudarlos. Elizabeth trabaja como costurera, además utiliza su tiempo libre para ir a los caseríos y lugares alejados de la ciudad a vender ropa de segunda. Ella tuvo que trabajar desde muy chica ya que la costura lo realiza desde que tenía 14 años y lleva la cuenta de la venta de ropa de segunda desde hace 4 años, ella trabaja sola, pues su hijo le ayuda trabajando en su mototaxi por las calles de la ciudad. Le gusta su trabajo porque dispone de su tiempo y ella sabe cuando puede realizar otras actividades y además que genera ganancias ya que tiene clientes que siempre ella visita y le realizan buenas compras. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP y le gusta estar en este grupo por que lo bueno es que todos asumen su responsabilidad de no dejar mal al grupo. Con los 1200 soles solicitados, comprará telas para empezara a confeccionar fundas para televisores, además le enviaran ropa de segunda de la ciudad de Lima para que pueda seguir con el negocio acá.
texts.en: Elizabeth is 64 years old and is separated. She lives in her own house with her son and her two grandchildren who she wants to see grow up with a good education and good health. This is the reason she works hard in order to help them. Elizabeth works as a seamstress. She also uses her free time to go to villages and other faraway places to sell second hand clothing. She has had to work from a very young age. She started sewing when she was 14 years old. She has sold the used clothes for four years. She works alone and he son helps her by driving his mototaxi on the city’s streets. She likes her work because she organizes her time and she knows when she can do other activities. Also she likes it because it generates income now that she has customers that she always visits and they make good purchases. This is her fourth loan with MFP and she likes being in this group because everyone takes responsibility to make sure the group is successful. With the 1,200 soles requested, she will buy fabric to make covers for television sets. In addition, she will send second hand clothing to Lima in order to continue with her business there.

loans.use: stock up on second hand clothing and purchase fabric.

loans.name: Kabungo Women's Group

texts.en:
There are individuals who see no limit to their possibilities of success or progress in whatever they lay a hand on. One such individual is 50-year-old Nelson who, from the accounts of people who know him, is a personification of diligence. He is a stickler for hard work. That has been critical to the substantial advancement in his business skills in farming.

The father of 4 grows bananas on his farms. Needless to say, bananas are a staple food in most parts of Uganda. This means farmers like Nelson are doing a roaring trade selling their bananas to food traders who come all the way from the nation's capital, Kampala. He is based in Ntungamo. For most families in Ntungamo and other parts of Western Uganda, farming is a legacy. Most families have been able to contribute to their welfare with earnings from farming.

Notwithstanding the successes, there have been quite a few impediments which have clouded the success of some farmers. Nelson says at times he is hard-pressed at times to get enough finances to purchase better and higher-grade manure. He also says some seasons are particularly difficult as pests destroy his banana crop. However, he has remained philosophical in the face of all adversity which explains his longevity over the past decade. His second line of business is the sale of livestock. He says this business generates close to 200,000 Uganda shillings in weekly sales income for him. He says he intends to utilize this Kiva loan to purchase high-grade manure and pesticides, and to pay fees for his kids.

loans.use: to purchase high-grade manure and pesticides, and to pay fees for his kids.

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.ru: Зухра проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ей 42 года. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее муж работает электриком. Сама Зухра имеет средне - специальное образование, она медсестра. По специальности она работает 15 лет. Кроме того она занимается шитьем. Она у себя дома шьет национальные платья, наволочки и шторы. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 15 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения еще одной швейной машинки и покупки цветных ниток и бисера.
texts.en: Zuhra lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.  She is 42 years old, married and has three children.  Her husband works as an electrician.  Zuhra has a secondary specialized education and is a nurse.  She has been working in this field for fifteen years.  Besides this, she is involved in sewing.  She sews national dresses, pillow cases and window drapes.  She has been involved in this business for over fifteen years.  Zuhra is requesting this loan for the purchase of one more sewing machine and purchase of color threads and beads.

loans.use: to purchase one more sewing machine and color threads and beads

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a hardworking business woman aged 55. She is married and blessed with three children. For the past five years, she has been managing a private school to raise her family. Her other source of income is from her rental houses. Previously, she was involved in a business of selling groceries and clothes. 

In the next five years, Jane wants her school to become a boarding school. She is requesting for a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy textbooks. (This photo of Jane was taken when she was conducting a parent meeting at her private school.)

loans.use: to buy textbooks.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
La Señora Irene tiene 44 años D. edad, está casada con el Señor Ramón D. 51 años D. edad, ellos llevan 25 años D. casados y tienen la dicha D. tener 8 hijos.
La Sra. Irene es comerciante, se dedica a la venta D. sabanas, colchas, edredones, lo cual realiza en forma ambulante por toda la Cuidad y alrededores. Dicha actividad lo emprendieron con mucho sacrificio, mediante un pequeño ahorro con que contaban y con la ayuda D. 4 hijos que se encuentran trabajando en el exterior. Comenta que su trabajo le genera muy buenos ingresos, por lo cual le gustaría poder seguir invirtiendo en el. Uno D. los sueños D. la señora es ir ampliando su negocio ya que le genera un buen margen, ella cuenta con la ayuda D. 4 hijos que la ayudan en sus ventas, ella define a su familia como muy trabajadora.
Solicita el crédito para la compra D. sabanas, colchas, edredones y otros, con lo cual podrá aumentar la cantidad D. sus mercaderías en stock y ed esa forma cumplir con los pedidos D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señora Irene is 44 years old, and is married to Señor Ramón who is 51 year old.  They have been married for 25 years and have 8 children from the marriage.

Señora Irene works in retailing, selling sheets, bedspreads, and quilts as a street vendor throughout the city and the surrounding areas.  They undertook this activity with a lot of self-sacrifice, through a small amount of money that they had saved and with the help of four of their children who work abroad.

She comments that her work earns her a very good income, so she would very much like to be able to continue to invest in it.  One of the Señora's dreams is to expand her business as it generates a good margin.  She has the assistance of four of her children who help her with the sales, and she defines her family as very hard workers.  

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of sheets, bedspreads, quilts and other things, with which she can grow the amount of merchandise she has in stock and in this way meet her customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy sheets, bedspreads, and quilts to build up the merchandise she has in stock.

loans.name: Silvio Rene

texts.es: El señor Silvio vive en la casa de sus padres es soltero y aporta con la educación de sus hermanos y sobrinos, es un cliente nuevo que fue invitado por su hermana que es cliente de nuestra institución y como actividad principal se dedica al arte del pintado y decoración de interiores  fachadas de paredes desde  muy joven  actualmente el es independiente y sus contratos los realiza en la cuidad de La Paz, Cochabamba y otros departamentos  el crédito que solicitó es para la compra de escaleras metálicas y pintura por mayor por que sus contratos son a obra vendida, está muy feliz por que con el crédito otorgado ya podrá finalizar un contrato que tenia pendiente en Cochabamba.
texts.en: Silvio lives in his parents’ house.  He’s single and helps out with education costs of his siblings and nephews and nieces.  He’s a new client who was invited by his sister who is a client of our institution.  His main activity is painting walls and interior decorating.  He’s been independent since a very young age and he makes his contracts in the city of La Paz, Cochabamba and other departments.  He asked for the loan to buy metal ladders and paint at wholesale because his contracts are based on sold jobs.  He’s very happy with the granted loan because he will finally be able to complete a pending contract he has in Cochabamba.

loans.use: to buy ladders and paint.
